story:
"Entre los sueños y la realidad esta el equilibrio"

-En Español

-In English

Porque busco tu patrocinio? 

Why do I look for your sponsorship?

Tengo la oportunidad de ir a estudiar a otro país en una de las mejores universidades, tengo mis ahorros pero aun me falta dinero para lograr esta meta por la que he luchado mucho tiempo, y me gustaría contar con tu apoyo para no perder esta gran oportunidad, este es un gran sueño para poder crecer como artista, seguir emprendiendo nuevos proyectos y poder compartir nuevos conocimientos en mi país y en el mundo.

I have the opportunity to study a country in one of the best universities, I have my savings but I lack money to achieve this goal for which I have fought for a long time, and I would like to count on your support to not lose this great opportunity, this is a great dream to be able to grow as an artist, continue to develop new projects and be able to share new knowledge in my country and in the world.

 

Una breve historia de quien soy 

A brief history of who I am

Me llamo Alexander, soy de Costa Rica, tengo 25 años y llevo 10 años de hacer circo, cuando comencé todo era un pasatiempo, una forma de usar mi energía y hacer ejercicio mientras aprendía, a los 20 años decidí dedicarme al circo como algo profesional, comencé a llevar talleres y cursos sobre diferentes técnicas y enseñanza de circo, a mis 23 años fui invitado por el Parque la libertad, el Cirque du Soleil y el Cirque du Monde a llevar una formación como instructor en circo social, la cual me ayudo a crecer como artista y abrir nuevas posibilidades además comencé a trabajar en un proyecto de Circo Social en el Parque la libertad como instructor de un grupo de 25 jóvenes llenos de energía. Mi meta y mi sueño ha sido lograr estudiar en una escuela de circo profesional pero en mi país no hay una escuela profesional de circo, así que tome energía y decidí audicionar para una de las mejores escuelas de circo del mundo, la Academia Municipal de Circo y Artes Variadas de Kyie en Ucrania y logre entrar.

My name is Alexander, I'm from Costa Rica, I'm 25 years old and I've been doing the circus for 10 years, when I started doing a hobby, a way to use my energy and exercise while learning, at age 20 I decided to dedicate myself to the circus as something professional, I started to take workshops and courses on different techniques and teaching of the circus, a my 23 years I was invited by the Parque La lIbertad, the Cirque du Soleil and Cirque Du Monde I took a training as an instructor in the social circus, which helped me grow as an artist and open new possibilities to start working on a Social Circus project in the Parque de la Libertad as an instructor of a group of 25 young people full of energy. My goal and my dream have been to study in a professional circus school but in my country there is no professional circus school, so I took energy and decided to audition for one of the best circus schools in the world, the Municipal Academy of Circus and Various Arts of Kyie in Ukraine.


 

Porque hago esta campaña?

Why do I do this campaign?

 

Durante este tiempo he estado ahorrando para esta gran oportunidad pero aun me hace falta dinero para poder pagar mis estudios, esta campaña es para poder pagar la escuela, por mi parte estaré viviendo 2 años lejos y se me hace difícil trabajar porque la visa de estudiante no lo permite y el horario de la escuela es casi todo el día, con un día libre, difícil para poder buscar alternativas, sin embargo estaré dando mi máximo esfuerzo como lo he hecho los últimos años, y por eso me gustaría obtener tu ayuda para lograr alcanzar este sueño y no perder esta gran oportunidad.

During this time, he will save for most students, but the amount of years for the school, the school and the time for the student visa. do not allow it and the school schedule is almost all day, with a free day, difficult to find alternatives, however I will be giving the maximum effort as he did in recent years, and that's why I would like to get your help to achieve this dream and not miss this great opportunity.

 

Que voy a pagar con el dinero?

What will I pay with the money?

 

En un estimado de lo que ocuparía por año son $4000 esto seria para pagar hospedaje, comida, transporte, celular y lo mas importante los estudios. 

Hospedaje: Me estaré hospedando en el hotel del Circo Nacional de Kiev, una habitación pequeña que cuesta $4 por noche, $120 por mes.

Comida: En comida se gastan aproximadamente $150 por mes comprado un diario.

Transporte y celular: esto va a variar pero tengo un aproximado de $50 al mes en transporte y de celular son $4 por mes

La escuela se paga anualmente y son $1500 por año

In an estimate of what would occupy $ 4000 per year, this would be to pay for lodging, food, transportation, cell phone and the most important of the studies.

Lodging: I will stay at the hotel of the Kiev National Circus, a small room that costs $ 4 per night, $ 120 per month.

Food: In food they spend approximately $ 150 per month bought a newspaper.

Transportation and cell phone: this can vary but I have an approximate of $ 50 per month in transportation and my son $ 4 per month

The school is paid annually and the child $ 1500 per year

 

Después de la campaña

After the campaign

Si no se logra la meta total igual todo lo que se gane sera de gran ayuda para cumplir mi meta y mi sueño, y si se logra tendría cubierto parte del gasto por un año y yo cubriría lo que falte, además siempre vendría bien alguna ayuda después de la meta para cubrir algún improvisto.

If the total goal is not achieved, everything that is earned will be of great help to fulfill my goal and my dream, and if it is achieved I would have covered part of the expense for one year and I would cover what is missing, besides, some help would always be good. after the goal to cover some improvised.

 

​ 

Que significa tu ayuda para mi?

What does your help mean to me?

 

Soy del pensamiento de que ayudándonos los unos a los otros podemos llegar lejos todos, el circo me ha enseñado que todos podemos ser una gran familia, y cuando alguien me ayuda realmente aprecio esa ayuda porque cada persona que ha aparecido en mi vida me ha dado algo que compartir, y se ha llevado algo a cambio, más que solo gratitud cada ayuda es un escalón que me ayuda a cumplir mi sueño, no solo de dinero el apoyo de cada persona es lo que me hace ser quien soy ahorita y seguir luchando por llegar lejos en mi meta. 

De todo lo que recibimos tenemos que dar algo a cambio al mundo y a las otras personas. Dar es recibir.

I am thinking that by helping each other we can all go far, the circus has taught me that we can all be a great family, and when someone helps me I really appreciate that help because every person that has appeared in my life has given me something to share, and something has been brought in return, more than just gratitude every help is a step that helps me fulfill my dream, not just money, the support of each person is what makes me who I am right now and keep fighting for reaching far in my goal.

From everything we receive we have to give something in return to the world and to other people. Giving is receiving.
 

 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

Risks and challenges

 

No hay mayor riesgo que irme lejos, pero dentro de los obstáculos seria no poder completar mis estudios, tener que llevar hambre algún día, o no poder comprar algo necesario, tal vez tenga días difíciles pero siempre estaré dando mi mayor esfuerzo, espero poder regresar a mi país con un titulo, y mucha experiencia para compartir, lleno de energía para emprender nuevos proyectos y trabajar como artista por el mundo. Tengo una motivación muy fuerte y se que esta es una oportunidad única y muy difícil,  haré todo lo posible por lograr cumplirla. No es algo que vaya a comenzar ahora, es algo por lo que me esforzado mucho tiempo y no sera el final, un obstáculo más solo me hace seguir creciendo.

There is no greater risk than going away, but within the obstacles it would be not being able to complete my studies, having to go hungry someday, or not being able to buy something necessary, maybe I will have difficult days but I will always be giving my best effort, I hope to be able to return to my country with a degree, and a lot of experience to share, full of energy to undertake new projects and work as an artist around the world. I have a very strong motivation and I know that this is a unique and very difficult opportunity, I will do everything possible to achieve it. It is not something that is going to start now, it is something for which I worked hard for a long time and it will not be the end, one more obstacle only makes me keep growing.

 

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Other ways you can help

 

Tal vez ahorita no estés en una buena situación económica pero si igual quieres ayudarme puedes colaborar también compartiendo esta campaña, si me conoces puedes poner tu opinión en los comentarios, o bien con tan solo tener un buena intensión ya estas ayudando, gracias a ti y a todos los que me ayudan a vivir este sueño y espero ser de ayuda en algún momento para ayudarte en los tuyos.

Maybe now you are not in a good economic situation but if you want to help me you can also help sharing this campaign, if you know you can put your opinion in the comments, or just have a good intention and you are helping, thanks to you already All those who help me live this dream and I hope to be of help at some point to help you in yours.

 

Recompensas:

Rewards:

Aunque mi propósito no es vender un producto, quiero agradecerles la ayuda.

Las clases de Acroyoga se cambiaran en Costa Rica, con el profesor y mi compañero de Acro, Carlos Cambronero, el horario seria a coordinar con el.

Mi prioridad apenas termine mi formación como artista profesional, es hacer un show en Costa Rica, agradeciendo a todo por el apoyo, y poder compartir con todos. 

Although my purpose is not to sell a product, I want to thank them for their help.

Acroyoga classes will be changed in Costa Rica, with the teacher and my Acro partner, Carlos Cambronero, the schedule would be coordinated with him.

My priority as soon as I finish my training as a professional artist, is to do a show in Costa Rica, thanking all for the support, and being able to share with everyone.

 

Agradecido con todos los que pasan por mi vida y todos los que están por venir.

Grateful to all who pass through my life and all who are to come.

 

Si quieres saber más sobre mi o contactarme:

If you want to know more about me or contact me:

Email: alexander.ua@hotmail.com

Instagram: equilibrista.alex

Web: alexanderumana.com

story:
Editing involves

  1. Color Grading for 8 hours: 6.000 $

  2. Conforming the images: 900 $

  3. Audio post-production which includes sound editing, design and mixing: 2.500 $

  4. Image editing and export ProRes: 2.500 $

PERKS: 1000 $

 

From Syria to Palestine: El Autostrad’
A video by Stéphanie Dadour and Sirine Fattouh.

One apparatus: two cameras in a car. The first camera facing the road and the second directed towards the shoreline. Departing from Al Arida (the Syrian-Lebanese border) towards Al Naqoura (the Lebanese-Palestinian border). The journey is uninterrupted and follows the rhythm of a typical day. A little over 200 km crossed in 4 hours, on a Sunday without traffic, decrypting a set of spaces linked by this road.

A road, bearer of multiple identities.
A road that materializes the passage from one country to another.
A road, constituting the main artery of a third country.

Laid back moments.
Other tense moments as military checkpoints are approached.
Camera are dismounted.
Unexpected rhythms. Forced detours.

Not only does el autostrad’ glorify the landscape (sea, seashore, mountains…), it also exposes sceneries of complexities and contradictions. All along the coast, time strata intertwine, pushing the boundaries of the city and redefining the territory.

El autostrad’ looks nothing like a highway.

[…]

Before hitting the coastal road, the space is filled with joggers, trucks, plenty of cars and religious sites. The sea is to our right and from far the city is buried under a dense foggy atmosphere. It is 8 in the morning, and the shops are open.

Then, a long way. Construction sites filling the space and buildings growing taller. Street food shops, restaurants, gas stations and retails stores invading the space endlessly, shaping the urban scenery.

[…]

We cross several tunnels, before hitting a long road covered with constructions sites, banners with political messages and commercial billboards. There is something different, an uncanny feeling. The vast in which we were in, suddenly narrows..
We cross a lot of fields: banana, orange and citrus.. The sea is still there, bluer and clearer than before, accompanying us while our visibility shrinks again.

[…]

We cross a long concrete wall.
Filming is not allowed.
Stop.
U-Turn

El autostrad’ is a journey, exploring a large territory that encompasses an expression of everyday life. The territory is understood here as a space of cultural, social, economic, ideological and political appropriations.


Biographies :
Stéphanie Dadour is an associate professor and researcher in history and theory of architecture at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure d’Architecture de Grenoble. After a PhD on decentering approaches and feminist contributions in North American domestic architecture, her research focuses on the relationship between space and situations of vulnerability. Her experience in the field of teaching and researching is varied; visiting scholar at Columbia University in New York, researcher at Centre Pompidou, and teaching at design and architecture schools in France and Lebanon. Her work has been published in several publishing houses as well as international journals.

Sirine Fattouh is an artist and researcher working between Paris and Beirut. Graduate of the Paris-Cergy School of Arts (ENSAPC) and the Paris 1 University of Fine Arts and Art Sciences, she obtained her PhD in 2015.  Sirine teaches at several universities in France and Lebanon, that which came after a period of working as an associate curator at the Centre Pompidou. Her work has been presented in many private and public collections including the National Museum of the 21st Century Arts (MAXXI), Centre Pompidou Metz, the National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art of Algiers (Mama), the Nadour Collection and the National Museum of Contemporary Art Thessaloniki Greece (SMCA).

story:
Short Summary

Art is connection. Art tells stories. Art is for everyone. goARTful’s founders, Messay Derebe, Brandolon Barnett, Nacho Cerrato, and Meghan Ball, all believe strongly that the arts can be transformative. We believe that art is not just “pretty pictures” on a wall but something that can have a profound impact on peoples lives. Art can affect how comfortable, productive, and happy we are in the spaces we inhabit.

Your backing will allow us to expand our business, support more artists, and give people the opportunity to share their story with art.

What We Need & What You Get

goARTful envisions a world where everyone has access to art and where artists can make a living from their work.  Your contributions will enable us to make goARTful’s second year a success. We believe deeply in this vision, which is why our founding team has been bootstrapping goARTful for a year, while working 9-5's, to make our dream a reality. Your contributions will support the growth we need to reach our vision.

Our goal is to raise $20,000 that will enable us to: 

  • Polish our site and build out our app to create more features for customers to experience art, artists to grow their revenue, and art galleries to improve access to art;
  • Expand our operations through expanded sales to businesses and building our brand for consumers and businesses in the top 5 US markets;
  • Enhance our business operations/product to efficiently deliver and manage exchanges/orders;
  • Build our events offering and enhance the arts community starting in the DC area and then around the country;
  • Ramp up our artist recruitment to triple our active artists by the end of the year;
  • Invest in a more robust marketing and communications dashboard for our artists.

*All of these funds will be invested directly into the business. None of the funds will go to salaries for our founding team!*

While $20,000 will help us achieve all our goals, any amount of our goal will go a long way in democratizing art.

The Impact

  • Art is about powerful experiences, not just financial transactions. Our individual members and corporate customers don’t just get beautiful art to purchase, rent, and explore on their walls. They also get perks like access to a community and cool events that can help them to create more meaningful connections to artists.

  • Our artists are just as important as our members. In fact, we’re part artist-owned! They’ll grow as we grow. Plus, our platform helps them build their businesses through analytics and reaching new customers!

  • Technology can break down barriers and make it easier and more convenient to try out new art. You might love a piece when you see it at a festival or on a site. But what will it look like in your home? Our augmented reality app can show you! We want to build more  of these breakthrough technologies whether it's VR as a tool for interior design, better methods for easy hanging and shipping of art prints, or even better scanning of prints to enable artists to get more high quality prints of their work for sale.

  • We’re a social enterprise, with a goARTful corporate charitable advised fund. At a minimum, 3% of our membership revenue will go to support local artists and arts nonprofits in the cities in which we operate.

  • Our slogan with artists is “You do the art, we do the business!” We do the marketing, we do the customer relationship management, we handle the logistics at a fraction of the cost of traditional galleries and arts markets.

Risks & Challenges

We know that we’re not the first “rotating art” or “Rent the Runway for Art” platform. However, we are confident that we are the first of our kind to tackle a fundamental problem: that it’s expensive, scary, and hard for  ordinary people to enjoy local, original art. Yet that desire to "buy local" is just as important for art as it is for food and in other areas of our life. We’re different from what came before in a few really important ways:

  1. We’re all about quality and curation. Don’t need to scroll through a hundred pages to find one piece of art you like, only to discover you don’t know who made it.  
  2. We’re approachable. No elitist attitudes about what constitutes art here. We want you to try new art, especially if you don’t know what you like yet.
  3. We create a community, directly supporting artists and a thriving arts community wherever is local to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Art is connection. Art tells stories. Art is for everyone. Connect with us on social media! You can help us spread the word about goARTful, show us your world through art and tell us your story!  Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Art is connection. Art tells stories. Art is for everyone. goARTful’s founders, Messay Derebe, Brandolon Barnett, Nacho Cerrato, and Meghan Ball, all believe strongly that the arts can be transformative. We believe that art is not just “pretty pictures” on a wall but something that can have a profound impact on peoples lives. Art can affect how comfortable, productive, and happy we are in the spaces we inhabit.

Your backing will allow us to expand our business, support more artists, and give people the opportunity to share their story with art.

What We Need & What You Get
goARTful envisions a world where everyone has access to art and where artists can make a living from their work.  Your contributions will enable us to make goARTful’s second year a success. We believe deeply in this vision, which is why our founding team has been bootstrapping goARTful for a year, while working 9-5's, to make our dream a reality. Your contributions will support the growth we need to reach our vision.
Our goal is to raise $20,000 that will enable us to: 

Polish our site and build out our app to create more features for customers to experience art, artists to grow their revenue, and art galleries to improve access to art;
Expand our operations through expanded sales to businesses and building our brand for consumers and businesses in the top 5 US markets;
Enhance our business operations/product to efficiently deliver and manage exchanges/orders;
Build our events offering and enhance the arts community starting in the DC area and then around the country;
Ramp up our artist recruitment to triple our active artists by the end of the year;
Invest in a more robust marketing and communications dashboard for our artists.

*All of these funds will be invested directly into the business. None of the funds will go to salaries for our founding team!*
While $20,000 will help us achieve all our goals, any amount of our goal will go a long way in democratizing art.

The Impact

Art is about powerful experiences, not just financial transactions. Our individual members and corporate customers don’t just get beautiful art to purchase, rent, and explore on their walls. They also get perks like access to a community and cool events that can help them to create more meaningful connections to artists.
Our artists are just as important as our members. In fact, we’re part artist-owned! They’ll grow as we grow. Plus, our platform helps them build their businesses through analytics and reaching new customers!
Technology can break down barriers and make it easier and more convenient to try out new art. You might love a piece when you see it at a festival or on a site. But what will it look like in your home? Our augmented reality app can show you! We want to build more  of these breakthrough technologies whether it's VR as a tool for interior design, better methods for easy hanging and shipping of art prints, or even better scanning of prints to enable artists to get more high quality prints of their work for sale.
We’re a social enterprise, with a goARTful corporate charitable advised fund. At a minimum, 3% of our membership revenue will go to support local artists and arts nonprofits in the cities in which we operate.
Our slogan with artists is “You do the art, we do the business!” We do the marketing, we do the customer relationship management, we handle the logistics at a fraction of the cost of traditional galleries and arts markets.


Risks & Challenges
We know that we’re not the first “rotating art” or “Rent the Runway for Art” platform. However, we are confident that we are the first of our kind to tackle a fundamental problem: that it’s expensive, scary, and hard for  ordinary people to enjoy local, original art. Yet that desire to "buy local" is just as important for art as it is for food and in other areas of our life. We’re different from what came before in a few really important ways:

We’re all about quality and curation. Don’t need to scroll through a hundred pages to find one piece of art you like, only to discover you don’t know who made it.  
We’re approachable. No elitist attitudes about what constitutes art here. We want you to try new art, especially if you don’t know what you like yet.
We create a community, directly supporting artists and a thriving arts community wherever is local to you.


Other Ways You Can Help
Art is connection. Art tells stories. Art is for everyone. Connect with us on social media! You can help us spread the word about goARTful, show us your world through art and tell us your story!  Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

story:
General objective : 

The project aims to empower Palestinian children and youth in East Jerusalem to claim and enjoy their cultural rights as a means to encourage creativity and innovation and promote a culture of freedom, diversity and steadfastness among marginalized children and youth, especially young girls, and to flourish the creative diversity that can sustain public life in Jerusalem.

Background of beneficiary region: 

In addition to its religious importance, Jerusalem has played a historic role in Palestinian political, economic, social and cultural life, especially after the expropriation of the Palestinian urban centers in coastal cities and West Jerusalem in the Nakba in 1948. Over the years, Jerusalem, as a lively city, has been affected by the multifaceted system of occupation imposed by Israel which has adversely altered its urban, demographic, economic, social and cultural features and its predominantly Palestinian Arab landscape. The Israeli polices of physical, political and economic segregation of the City from the rest of the occupied Palestinian territory, has left the once vibrant urban and cultural centre completely isolated and cut off from its natural hinterland with its population living in marginalized conditions. These polices include the city’s annexation, expansion of Jewish settlements in and around East Jerusalem, construction of the separation wall, a complex system of checkpoints and closures as well as restrictive administrative policies and practices that influence every aspect of ordinary Palestinian life in Jerusalem that mainly aim to reduce the population of Palestinians in Jerusalem. This multifaceted system of occupation severely compromises individual and communal capacities to engage in economic and social life, to access health, education and commercial services and has demeaned the capacity of the City at large to naturally develop and progress. This separation of Jerusalem from the West Bank and Gaza, has severely affected the cultural life of the city. People cannot come from the West Bank to participate in cultural events, and Jerusalemites have to cross major checkpoints to join events in the West Bank. Jerusalem’s historic role as the centre of culture and art for the Palestinian society has inevitably been affected by the policies of closure and restrictions on movement of Palestinians, despite all efforts of institutions and individuals attempts to maintain and develop the cultural life of the city.

Project description : 

The Jerusalemite Youth Cultural Forum aims from this project to form an art school in Silwan to provide appropriate and equal opportunities for children and youths, who are interested in learning different kinds of art professionally, in that area in particular and Jerusalem in general. The project also aims to raise awareness and broaden the knowledge of individuals in the field of art and it’s aspects.

As well, the promotion of productions, work of art and spreading it’s message to the majority of locals will contribute to the preservation of the Palestinian culture heritage and also contribute in strengthening relations between the forum and various functioning youth community centers in Jerusalem that work in the same field, because part of the activities will be implemented in corporation with different art organizations in Jerusalem, In addition to organizing many public live art shows to the masses.

The project also aims to meet between the local needs of art and focus on the positive role of arts in the life of communities due to its importance in order to improve their talents and strengthen their interaction in this field which will contribute to the development of their art capabilities and expand the horizons of creativity and art perception to give them a path of hope to change their difficult life situations because of the continuous Israeli occupation practices.

 The Forum as well hopes to succeed in reaching various parts of the society to provide them with equal opportunities to learn art and improve their talents despite their economic situation or place of residence. The participants will be taught music weekly all year long. About 100 kids will benefit from this project between the ages of 7 and 20 boys and girls. The project will also form 3 choirs (20 to 30 students each), teach the skills of the Palestinian Folkloric dance “Dabka” for about 80 students through the year, teach Drama in order to execute plays and educational shows for about 1500 students at different schools following the Palestinian Ministry of Education in Jerusalem.

The aim in general is to attract students` attention to the importance of art and its different fields (music, Drama, Dabka, painting,…etc.) There will be about 25 public shows in Silwan and Jerusalem. The project will also hold a summer camp for 60 students to encourage them to continue studying art in its different fields and provide them with a chance to exchange experiences to realize the importance of art in our lives as a mean of education. The project also aims to shed a light on the importance of art in our Palestinian condition to ensure our cultural identity.

Project Objectives:

  1. Setting an art school in Silwan and enable it administratively, financially and organizationally to carry out its activities and maintain its continuity.
  2. Raising and disseminating artistic cultural awareness among the sons of Silwan in particular and Jerusalem in general, despite all the difficult living conditions that they experience as a result of the daily practices of the occupation.
  3. Provide equal and appropriate opportunity for children and young people who wish to learn art to do so, regardless of their economic status or place of residence.
  4. Providing safe and suitable places for children and youth in Silwan to develop their talents and skills, which will reflect positively on their personalities and give them a space of hope for a better future.
  5. Emphasize the Arab cultural identity and strengthen the steadfastness of the people of Silwan in particular and the city of Jerusalem in general and preserve the cultural heritage through generations of youth.
  6. Contribute to the promotion of artistic education in Palestinian schools working in Jerusalem through disseminating arts to the largest possible number of students and informing them about the importance of art in building healthy and strong societies.
  7. Strengthening and building cooperation and partnership relations between the Forum and the community institutions and other art centers operating in Silwan and many different areas in Jerusalem.
  8. activating the artistic life in Silwan in particular and in Jerusalem in general and trying to break the siege imposed on the holy city and strengthen the Palestinian communication with different musical cultures.
  9. Spread the messages of love, peace and joy in most areas of Jerusalem within the concept of the resistance society.

story:
Summary

Since we formed our camp in 2016 its popularity has exploded. While this is great and very gratifying, it has become much more costly to run.  Far more than all the members dues can cover.  Some of the things that have made our camp so popular:

  • Pewter Casting Events - Make your own pewter pendants.
  • Frito Pie Pig Out - 500 of these in 2017.
  • Sunglasses Monkey Hut - Gifting hundreds of sunglasses.
  • Hippity Hop Races
  • Full Service Bar - Day and Night

To bring it all back to the Playa at the level it has grown to, we find ourselves needing to raise funds.

How It's Used

Aside from the obvious cost of the pewter, food, and alcohol we serve, it runs over 50.00 per day just to stock the bar with ice, not to mention the mixers and soft drinks we dispense both during events and during regular bar hours.  

All funds gathered by our camp go directly towards serving the community. We have no communal camp stuff such as meals, so every cent raised in dues and this fund raiser goes directly towards products and materials for events on the Playa. All funds raised from this campaign will go solely towards things like pewter for our pewter casting events, food products for our Frito Pie Event, stocking the bar with alcohol, ice, mixers, and non alcoholic beverages as well. 

We don't just want to be standing here with our hands out begging and have come up with some great perks to thank those who donate.

The Impact

Your donations will help us keep the pewter casting events large, serve 500 or more Frito Pies, and keep the bar full service and open about 20 hours a day, serving a full selection of beverages both with and without alcohol to our Playa neighborhood.

Join with us to make Hookers & Makers Camp an even bigger success in its third year on the Playa.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if things are tight and you can't donate, please help spread the word. The Indiegogo share tools are great for that.

Location

We will post our exact location once we hear from placement, but in case you forget we are located in Barbie Death Village which is listed in the WWW.

History

2016

 As an outgrowth of friendships and our regional camp we formed our original Burning Man camp - Hungry Hungry Hookers (based on crocheting which uses hooks in case you are wondering). We hit the Playa with non WWW events in Pewter Casting, Frito Pies, Sunglasses Monkey Hut, and a bar that operated 4 to 6 hours a day.  This was a fairly small operation that was funded mostly by our founder.

2017

Membership increased and it was decided to change the name to reflect that we make other stuff besides crochet resulting in Hookers & Makers camp. Due to the popularity of the events and bar in 2016, we decided to up our game and add events to the WWW as well as to increase bar hours to 8 hours a day. Member dues were instituted to help cover the increased cost and the plan seemed solid. As usually happens with the best of plans, things went unexpectedly starting on opening day of the burn.  The bar became a neighborhood hot spot and was hopping 20 hours a day. Scheduled  WWW events drew enormous crowds. Everyone wanted to make a pewter pendant! Everyone wanted Frito Pie! Everyone was very thirsty, and at night we had the only open bar in the area. By Tuesday we were struggling to keep the bar stocked.  Through no plan of our own, the Playa had decided we needed to bring it bigger.

2018

We plan to bring it bigger and better than ever. We'll see you in the dust.

story:
Thank You.

Get familiar with Tic Toc through a Candombe story & help Tic Toc create The RōL!

The RōL is a new book design where the hand drawn illustrations are printed on a paper roll to create a panoramic view of the whole story. 

With this design, we are looking to create an experience that brings people together, for education, for recreation.

The standard coloring book only has space for one. The RōL is designed for everyone…

offering more possibilities for collaboration and for the painters to create a harmonious composition.

 

TIC TOC RōL for Education from Tic Toc 

Uruguay's first hand drawn Candombe Coloring RōL.

Feat: El Escobero

What is Candombe?

While we can not refer to anything before the 1900’s with historical certainty…

Candombe is a 200 year old ritmo (rhythm) and a central part of Uruguayan culture. A dancing and drumming style brought to the shores of Uruguay in the 1800’s by Africans who arrived during the slave trade— The Llamadas (calls) are practiced throughout the year, bringing together people of all ages.

Candombe fuses cultures and traditions with 3 distinct sounds: Tambor Piano, Tambor Chico and the Tambor Repique drums. The Comparsas (or groups) consist of drummers and dancers, with the root characters: Mama Vieja, The Gramillero, and the Escobero leading. A tradition once suppressed, now serves as a celebratory display in the streets of Montevideo during Carnaval. 

 

What is a RōL?

The RōL is a new design, with a series of hand drawn images in a format where you can unroll and paint sections at a time —  and or enabling many people to paint at the same time.

The RōL can be done all at once, with friends, by yourself, with paint, with crayons, with color pencils, with water colors, with acrylic…etc—the paper works with all mediums.

 

                 

                                           

 It can be hung up. It can be rolled out. 

It can stay rolled up. It can be folded. 

It can be cut.
It can be gifted. 

It can even be colored digitally! 

(see perks:)

How long is The RōL? 

Well, when we began this, the initial design started out as 17 different pages, that we managed (miraculously) to put together. The final continuous image is the actual size of the original, which measures at 16ft long. 

What if Candombe doesn't appeal to me, but I'd like another illustration?

There are 2 other designs (currently) that the creators would like to print with customizable sizes for anyone who wants one. Check out the perks to see the other RōL options available for pre-ordering.

 

Why we need your help

Attention to detail distinguishes itself & it is equally important to us that we convey the costs of production... 

We need to raise $12,000 to create The RōL & You get :

  1. A digital download of the Coloring Books to color on your device
  2. 3 optional Coloring RōLs, with customizable sizes
  3. A poster size print of one of the Candombe characters
  4. For every 10 RōLs sold, one RōL will be donated to a school in Baltimore and Uruguay
  5. To support the evolution of Tic Toc and it’s creators



 

All of the funds raised will go towards the registration, distribution, packaging, shipping of The RōL and for us to dedicate all of our time to creating this fine art for ya.

We estimate this process to take 3 months to print, package & ship.

We will update you (our generous supporters) on our progress.

Thank you in advance for taking the time to read this. Please share this project with your friends and family. Follow @TicTocWorld on Instagram! #tictocworld 

Unrolling the RōL from Tic Toc on Vimeo.


If you are an educator and would like to bring The RōL to your school, contact us!

For all other inquiries 

TicToc.Corn@Gmail.com

Please share this project with your friends and family. Follow @TicTocWorld on Instagram! #tictocworld Unrolling the RōL from Tic Toc on Vimeo.If you are an educator and would like to bring The RōL to your school, contact us!For all other inquiries TicToc.Corn@Gmail.com

story:
El artista

Arquitecto de formación (ETSAM) y con un Doctorado en Bellas Artes (UCM), Manuel Oyonarte lleva desde mediados de la década de 1980 entregado a su auténtica pasión, la pintura.

En solitario o acompañado de otros compañeros de profesión (ha fundado diversos grupos artísticos), Manuel Oyonarte ha participado en numerosas exposiciones en diferentes galerías y museos nacionales e internacionales. Además, es académico en Academias de reconocido prestigio, como en la Academia Internacional "Greci-Marino" di Vercelli o en la Academia Internazionale Gentilicia "Il Marzocco" di Firenze.

Su faceta investigadora le convierte en un artista nada usual, siempre preocupado por el pensamiento y la filosofía que hay en sus obras. Así, su proceso creativo, plasmado en sus cuadros, está ocultamente articulado en torno a nociones estéticas de corte vitalista y existencialista. Sus inquietudes le han llevado también a experimentar con numerosos estilos y materiales, generando curiosas y fascinantes combinaciones en el espacio abstracto.

El proyecto

En este documental, Manuel Oyonarte nos abre las puertas de su taller y nos habla de todo el recorrido que transita hasta colgar el cuadro en la galería: desde los motivos que inspiran sus cuadros hasta los últimos retoques, pasando por la exposición de su método creativo, original y muy personal.

La situación

La pandemia nos ha hecho darnos cuenta de la importancia de la cultura en nuestro día a día. Para poder disfrutar de una cultura segura se han puesto en marcha numerosas iniciativas, como por ejemplo los museos virtuales.

No obstante, no experimentamos lo mismo ante un cuadro si simplemente lo vemos que si su autor nos puede explicar qué hay detrás de cada pincelada. El documental de Manuel Oyonarte es una gran oportunidad para potenciar la experiencia estética al contemplar los cuadros de uno de los artistas más interesantes del panorama actual.

Con tu apoyo, además, demostramos el carácter indispensable de la cultura y la posibilidad de un disfrute seguro y cómodo de la misma.

La financiación

Hasta ahora, hemos conseguido completar la Fase 1 de esta pieza, que incluye la preproducción y el rodaje. En esta fase, gracias a la participación y ayuda de personas interesadas en el proyecto y un empuje de inversión propia, hemos conseguido completar todas las jornadas de grabación y alcanzar un montaje definitivo.

Actualmente, nos encontramos en la Fase 2: la postproducción. Ésta incluye tanto el etalonaje o la corrección de color, como la edición de sonido o la composición de una banda sonora original.

Es aquí donde entrarías tú que, con tu colaboración, nos ayudarías a conseguir la financiación necesaria para cumplir este último objetivo. Gracias a este último empujón podríamos dar las últimas pinceladas a este proyecto que se ha realizado con muchísimo cariño y dedicación, y comenzar su distribución por distintos festivales nacionales e internacionales. La proyección de este corto documental está planteada para llegar a festivales debido al gran interés que consideramos generaría entre su público y jurado. Algunos de los festivales a los que nos gustaría poder enviarlo serían los siguientes:

NACIONALES: 

  • RIZOMA: Festival Internacional de Cine y Cultura Entrelazada.
  • Márgenes: Festival de Cine Independiente de Madrid.
  • Documenta Madrid: Festival Internacional de Cine Documental de Madrid.
  • Festival Dart: Festival de cine documental sobre arte contemporáneo.
  • D'A Film Festival Barcelona: Festival de Cine de Autor de Barcelona.
  • DocsBarcelona: Festival internacional de Cine Documental.
  • FICX: Festival Internacional de Cine de Gijón.
  • Festival Internacional de Cine de Calzada de Calatrava.

INTERNACIONALES: 

  • Arte Non Stop Festival: Festival Internacional de Cine y Arte de Buenos Aires.
  • Vision du Réel Festival Internacional de Cinéma de Nyon.
  • CPH: DOX Copenhagen International Documentary Film Festival.
  • Festival Cinéma du Réel.
  • Zagrebdox Festival Internacional de Cine Documental de Zagreb.
  • Thessaloniki Documentary Festival.
  • Hot Docs Canadian International Documentary Festival.

Cómo ayudar

El objetivo de este crowdfunding es conseguir la cifra de 3.500€ para terminar la postproducción e invertir en su distribución. Para colaborar en este proyecto hay varias maneras de hacerlo.

La primera de ellas sería reclamando alguna de las recompensas que podrás encontrar en esta misma página, por las que puedes recibir desde una camiseta con estampación de un dibujo de Manuel Oyonarte en impresión directa, a una litografía original numerada y firmada a mano, o incluso el propio cuadro creado durante y para esta pieza documental, además de, por supuesto, una mención en los créditos como agradecimiento especial.

La segunda, sería haciendo una contribución menor a las recompensas (¡toda ayuda es bien recibida!), que también se realizaría en esta misma página, en cuyo caso no recibirías un regalo pero siempre aparecerías en agradecimientos en los créditos.

Por último, si te es imposible hacer una aportación monetaria, no significa que no puedas colaborar, ya siempre puedes ayudarnos compartiendo este crowdfunding en tus redes sociales y con tus familiares y amigos más queridos.

Si te interesa conocer más acerca de este proyecto, tienes dudas del crowdfunding, las recompensas... por favor, no dudes en contactar con nosotros y estaremos encantados de contarte más detalles y resolver tus preguntas.

story:
Short Summary

This project is a collaboration between Saumitra Chandratreya (https://www.saumitrac.com/) an award winning abstract artist working primarily with fabric and Kevin Mooney (https://www.leprechauninc.com/) respected author and published poet. Our campaign aims to raise the resources necessary to manifest the creation (Act I), marketing (Act II) and installation (Act III) of our artistic concept. The Secret Language of Intimacy  invites viewers to engage in various ways of communicating honestly the valid emotions created by differing levels of intimacy. In this case, intimacy is communicated by transcribing emotions utilizing two disparate art forms: the language of poetry and abstract art on fabric panels. Your contribution will play the part of the magician by giving us the resources to make a creative dream a reality! Be a part of creating an installation that is destined to be seen by millions of people worldwide.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Because of the interactive and theatrical nature of our installation the budget we have created is organized into three sections: Act I, Act II, and Act III. The total budget is $15,000 which includes manufacturing, marketing, installation, fees, taxes, plus 20% for unseen expenses.

Act I:   The construction and labor to actually build the physical installation. This includes but is not limited to: fabric, printing, hardware, and labor. Approximate cost: $10,000

Act II:  The marketing materials and services to ensure galleries, museums and other venues understand why they will want to exhibit The Secret Language of Intimacy. This includes but is not limited to: photography, video, brochures, flyers, shipping, advertising, and promotional products. Approximate cost: $3000

Act III:  The physical installation into the first few venues. This includes but is not limited to: site inspection, transportation, and labor. Approximate cost: $2000

With every donation you will receive a piece of the installation as a physical manifestation of the energy you contributed in order to create an amazing artistic installation! Check out the list of PERKS and choose which fits your best intention. If you wish to donate any amount of funds without receiving a gift you can click on the red BACKER button at the top of the page next to the FOLLOW button.

 

The Impact

Artists are people who have always taken the road less traveled and in doing so need to use their gifts to create out-of-the-box vehicles for seed money and income. Every project, whether it be a start-up business, a new product development, or a theatrical production on Broadway needs seed money to prime the economic engine it is intended to create. 

The Secret Language of Intimacy is not only an artistic installation meant to feed the soul but also an economic engine that will sustain itself in order to touch millions of hearts around the world. Intimacy is about relationships and the world needs more honest and non-judgmental communication of our emotional perspective.

With your contributions, our award winning artistic gifts, and our proven project management skills we can make this a reality, together!

 

Risks & Challenges

In every entrepreneurial endeavor there are risks and challenges, and The Secret language of Intimacy is no exception. The big risk is that no one will care or like what we are presenting but because of our successful artistic track record we believe our product (The Secret Language of Intimacy) has what the buyer is looking for: a creative window into their own soul. 

The biggest challenge is to promote and inform a wide variety of venues so they will know the product is available and will see the value in bringing the installation to their audience. We have already overcome this first hurdle with the honored opportunity by Gallery 221 at Hillsborough Community College (HCC) in Tampa to exhibit The Secret Language of Intimacy for a nine week engagement: July 20 - September 24, 2020!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are numerous ways to contribute with or without cash donations. In this age of social media and people to people connections everyone is a potential donor in one way or another. You can share this site with your friends and colleagues and join the mailing list on our websites to get all the latest information on the progress and notification of the dates of every installation.

Saying "Thank You" does not nearly express our appreciation and gratitude for all your help.

story:
A Brother & Sister With Opposing Views, Join Forces for Good: 

Raising Money for an Incredible Non-Profit While Settling a 50 Year Debate on Whether Mullets Should Exist.
 

 

Which adorable child will you side with?  

 

Keep the Mullet or Kill the Mullet!

 

Every Dollar Counts as a Vote
$10 = 10 votes $1000 = $1000 votes, and so on.


At the end of the campaign in 45 days Your Vote will have had a hand in  supporting the victor's ambitions in this ongoing sibling rivalry that has been raging during the Pandemic, while simultaneously crushing the dreams of the other child... 

 

If Cadence Wins:  Steven must cut his mullet in a live stream event into a "Respectable Hair Style" of her choosing.

 

 

If Steven Wins:  He not only retains his "Glorious Mane" but is bestowed permission to dye it Red, White, and Blue.  




Please understand the importance of this decision, as the children will be returning to school.  Seen together and separate by all their classmates.  It is a choice not to be made lightly.

 


 

With each passing day the Mullet Grows...
Will you stop this senseless hair fashion faux pas? 
Or Inject the Magic of the 80s into a new generation of awesome?

 


ALL the proceeds from both sides of the campaign are going to Elysian Sanctuary.  Proving no matter your stance on these important hot button issues, we can come together for the greater good.



ELYSIAN SANCTUARY is a retreat and wellness education center for artists looking to create its central home in an abandoned victorian era boarding school in need of preservation and restoration. With these historic buildings we would offer a nostalgic and imaginative environment for artists, writers, musicians, and performers to complete their works.    



Designed as an interactive campus with Artist Galleries, Libraries, a Theater, Gardens, Collaborative Workspaces, Recording Studios, Classrooms, and more. The Sanctuary will provide diverse creative opportunities for the local community on a daily basis through our school, as well as workshops, retreats, and residencies for an international audience. Our interactive experiential arts and therapies will serve those who are on a path of growth, healing, and transformation.



The Elysian Sanctuary employs a mindset of passive change, in which the everyday activities and choices of our members have great impact. Elysian utilizes our programs and property, to inspire and influence change in matters of sustainability, humanitarian aid, and other philanthropic endeavors around the world, with the greatest impact in our local communities. 

Watch our Elysian Video here:  https://youtu.be/2ZZCLgKXZ8U


 
 

What We Need & What You Get

So What does this money go towards besides campaigning pro or anti mullet?

  • Right now we are in a search for our forever home.  We have several historical estates on the east coast we are considering, and this is the first in a series of fundraisers for our capital campaign.  All together we need to raise approximately 1,500,000 for the purchase, immediate renovations and operating expenses.  
  • We are going to cap the mullet campaign at 45 days.  At the end, regardless of the amount raised, whoever has more "votes" will be declared winner, and rewarded accordingly.  
  • All monies earned will go into the Elysian Account along with contributions from our Patreon Supporters.  This money only goes towards Elysian Programs and the ultimate goal of building our dream home.  Everything else has been personally financed by the members of our board, separate from raised Elysian Funds. 
  • Joining our Patreon allows you access to a monthly update of exactly how we spend any Elysian Funds.
  • While we have set our goal at 100k for this particular fundraiser, our efforts are on going.  The money, regardless of how much is raised will go towards the funding our property purchase, the more generosity we have, the more exciting the mullet battle, and the more quickly we can procure our Sanctuary.  

 

Artists Creating Passive Impact

One of the things we really love about our organization is the idea of Passive Impact.  Artists, Writers, Performers, Musicians will all be able to stay with us in Creative Residencies, as well as Art Appreciators.  While they stay with us, the every day normal things they would do anyway impact the world around them.  

  • Ordering Room Service provides meals to the elderly, or our food pantries.
  • Attending a class provides free classes to disadvantaged children, and donate back to public school arts programs.
  • The gardens provide safe haven for important and endangered pollinators.
  • Residencies contribute to homeless and veteran initiatives.
  • Bottled beverages contribute to providing free drinking water in developing countries and improve recycling and sustainability initiatives.
  • Upgraded wifi donates technology to our art abroad programs in Cambodia, and soon Uganda.

     

Risks & Challenges

This is an enormous undertaking.  Big dreams always are.  But we are not dreaming, or building alone.  It takes a lot of faith to put your time, energy, and money into a new organization like this.  

  • While Elysian Sanctuary is young as a non profit, her board members have 40 years experience in the non-profit world, and 20 years collectively running successful programs and education directives for artists. 
  • There are calculated risks and added hardships in taking on historic buildings.  They're temperamental, and need lots of love, and aren't as efficient.  Renovations tend to go slower, and be more expensive, but we get to preserve the history and magic, and add to centuries of stories, and the many hands that came before us to make sure they lasted.
  • We have been building an amazing advisory cabinet with diverse talents and expertise in contracting, hvac, real estate, gardening, business, non-profit, accounting, and every avenue of arts imaginable. 
  • We also have an enthusiastic group of supporters in our facebook group, and patreon, as well as the communities we are interested in building in.  And we have you <3  That is why we will succeed. Whatever location, whatever hurdle or hardship, whatever challenge, as always you turn to family, and family keeps the home.  That's you: our family, and that's Elysian: our home.
     

Other Ways You Can Help

This election in the fate of the mullet is one time you shouldn't throw away your vote!  However if you can't contribute financially consider one of the other ways you can support our project: 

  • Help get the word out.  Share this project.  Share the video on your social media page, in groups, and DM it to friends and family like you just hopped on the latest MLM that's really not a pyramid scheme.
  • Share it more than once.  It's a 45 day campaign, social media loves to show it to 4 people at a time, so help us out by sharing it like it's a cute photo of your kid.
  • Join our community online at www.facebook.com/groups/ElysianSanctuary
  • Follow us on facebook at www.facebook.com/ElysianSanctuary
  • Follow us on Instagram @Elysian_Sanctuary
  • Subscribe to our Founder on Youtube and the Building the Elysian Sanctuary Playlist at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLMRhMGZlUMLyVvtZRX9sHLenTNKdn-cLW
  • If you can please consider supporting us on Patreon.  Many hands make light work, and subscribing even at $5/month for the year would allow us to provide free classes for 3 students.  10 people at $5/month is $50/month, which is $600 a year.  Every Dollar counts, and ongoing support will allow us to cover so much ground in an ongoing basis for months to come. 

    This is one of those rare chances, to have a lot of fun letting kids be kids, to help build something meaningful for artists and creatives, and to allow what we build together to influence the world in a very real way.  We can't do it without you.

What We Need & What You Get
So What does this money go towards besides campaigning pro or anti mullet?

Right now we are in a search for our forever home.  We have several historical estates on the east coast we are considering, and this is the first in a series of fundraisers for our capital campaign.  All together we need to raise approximately 1,500,000 for the purchase, immediate renovations and operating expenses.  
We are going to cap the mullet campaign at 45 days.  At the end, regardless of the amount raised, whoever has more "votes" will be declared winner, and rewarded accordingly.  
All monies earned will go into the Elysian Account along with contributions from our Patreon Supporters.  This money only goes towards Elysian Programs and the ultimate goal of building our dream home.  Everything else has been personally financed by the members of our board, separate from raised Elysian Funds. 
Joining our Patreon allows you access to a monthly update of exactly how we spend any Elysian Funds.
While we have set our goal at 100k for this particular fundraiser, our efforts are on going.  The money, regardless of how much is raised will go towards the funding our property purchase, the more generosity we have, the more exciting the mullet battle, and the more quickly we can procure our Sanctuary.  



 
Artists Creating Passive Impact
One of the things we really love about our organization is the idea of Passive Impact.  Artists, Writers, Performers, Musicians will all be able to stay with us in Creative Residencies, as well as Art Appreciators.  While they stay with us, the every day normal things they would do anyway impact the world around them.  

Ordering Room Service provides meals to the elderly, or our food pantries.
Attending a class provides free classes to disadvantaged children, and donate back to public school arts programs.
The gardens provide safe haven for important and endangered pollinators.
Residencies contribute to homeless and veteran initiatives.
Bottled beverages contribute to providing free drinking water in developing countries and improve recycling and sustainability initiatives.
Upgraded wifi donates technology to our art abroad programs in Cambodia, and soon Uganda. 




Risks & Challenges
This is an enormous undertaking.  Big dreams always are.  But we are not dreaming, or building alone.  It takes a lot of faith to put your time, energy, and money into a new organization like this.  

While Elysian Sanctuary is young as a non profit, her board members have 40 years experience in the non-profit world, and 20 years collectively running successful programs and education directives for artists. 
There are calculated risks and added hardships in taking on historic buildings.  They're temperamental, and need lots of love, and aren't as efficient.  Renovations tend to go slower, and be more expensive, but we get to preserve the history and magic, and add to centuries of stories, and the many hands that came before us to make sure they lasted.
We have been building an amazing advisory cabinet with diverse talents and expertise in contracting, hvac, real estate, gardening, business, non-profit, accounting, and every avenue of arts imaginable.  

We also have an enthusiastic group of supporters in our facebook group, and patreon, as well as the communities we are interested in building in.  And we have you <3  That is why we will succeed. Whatever location, whatever hurdle or hardship, whatever challenge, as always you turn to family, and family keeps the home.  That's you: our family, and that's Elysian: our home. 



Other Ways You Can Help
This election in the fate of the mullet is one time you shouldn't throw away your vote!  However if you can't contribute financially consider one of the other ways you can support our project: 

Help get the word out.  Share this project.  Share the video on your social media page, in groups, and DM it to friends and family like you just hopped on the latest MLM that's really not a pyramid scheme.
Share it more than once.  It's a 45 day campaign, social media loves to show it to 4 people at a time, so help us out by sharing it like it's a cute photo of your kid.
Join our community online at www.facebook.com/groups/ElysianSanctuary

Follow us on facebook at www.facebook.com/ElysianSanctuary

Follow us on Instagram @Elysian_Sanctuary
Subscribe to our Founder on Youtube and the Building the Elysian Sanctuary Playlist at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLMRhMGZlUMLyVvtZRX9sHLenTNKdn-cLW

If you can please consider supporting us on Patreon.  Many hands make light work, and subscribing even at $5/month for the year would allow us to provide free classes for 3 students.  10 people at $5/month is $50/month, which is $600 a year.  Every Dollar counts, and ongoing support will allow us to cover so much ground in an ongoing basis for months to come. This is one of those rare chances, to have a lot of fun letting kids be kids, to help build something meaningful for artists and creatives, and to allow what we build together to influence the world in a very real way.  We can't do it without you.

story:
ABOUT ME

I’ve been a professional artist--truly living the life of an artist, not squeezing it in--for over nine years and have loved every moment of this journey.  (Before this I taught at university, was academic director at a school in India, taught in Krakow, Poland, and then became a coach, teaching Law of Attraction and other courses I developed.)  But as I like to say, I coached myself into a full-time art career!) The two best things about this is that I get to paint almost every day AND I get to meet and paint for amaaazing people!

 

WHAT I WANT TO DO

I've had an interest in learning and teaching more of the Old Masters drawing and painting techniques for some time now and when I stumbled upon this program, it felt perfect for me.  It's from 9AM-4 PM, five days a week from July 8th-August 3rd! Total immersion!  Even though I'm a contemporary artist, I believe learning these classical techniques more deeply will inspire my contemporary work and also allow me to create more exciting portraits.  And this is important since I do a lot of commissioned portraits... I hope to be painting for many of you! 

Another big plus for me is that I know being away is always when new things bubble up and my art can take on exciting new directions or turns—as it did in 2012 when I began palette knife painting while I was at a painting retreat at the Atlantic Center for the Arts.  I know being able to explore NYC for a month will crystalize my vision for a new series of NYC paintings that I've been contemplating for some time.  (My working title is: Five Boroughs, The Iconic and The Everyday, but I will see how this emerges... As an artist, I always have to leave space for a new project to find its own way through me!)

 

MY GOAL

I 'm trying to raise a total of $5510.  This will allow me to cover my $2650 tuition and $1900 lodging, and some of the fees I will pay to Indiegogo and to my gallery, The Hub on Canal.

 

REWARDS: What you get!

First, please reach out to me if there is something you want, a specific type of painting, that you don't see... pamela@pamelarameytatum.com  

You can see all the details of the rewards on the side panel of this page by scrolling down.  Here are a few things:
*  Every single person who supports me in this project will receive a hand-written, heartfelt thank you on one of my art cards.  

* Plus you will have access to my donor exclusive weekly e-newsletter where I'll be sending images and updates during my month in NJ & NYC!

I'm offering my existing work—cards, prints, and originals--as well as new work I'll create while I'm away, as well as new work I'll create upon my return AND most special of all to my heart: commissions!  All of these are at discounted prices—less than at my website and less than at my studio.   PLUS, I'm giving some other fun incentives--or goodies as I like to call them--to all of my supporters. (Just click on the perk and you can see what all is offered.)

In the event that I do not reach my full goal, I will use the money for this program and have to finance the rest.. ugh!  Either way my art will pay for my art :)  I’d much rather not pay interest and give YOU the rewards.  It’s so much fun to have others be a part of an exciting project and my artistic journey!

 

IMPACT

Not only will this allow me to take my art to the next level, but it will also allow me to bring the Old Masters' techniques back to teach students, both adults and teens, in my community.  And it will allow my new NYC series of oil paintings to be born!  The other important aspect of this is that there are unforeseen gifts and unimagined directions my life could take as a result of this immersive experience, the people I will meet, and my new work inspired by this program.  I am always open to… what else… what wonderful things always seem to result when we follow our heart!

 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

The only risk I can really think of is that I haven’t imagined how many people will donate and I will get hand cramps from writing all the thank you notes!  Seriously, I feel very confident, that unless there is a natural disaster, I will be meeting my goals for this project and delivering my rewards on time.   Of course in the event of any eventuality--illness or whatnot-- I will keep my backers posted.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Every bit helps! Even if you can't contribute at the moment, you can still help by sharing my new project with your friends and family.  Just use the Indiegogo share tool.  At the top of the page on the right, you'll see FB, etc. icons.  You could also copy the link to this page and email it.  Thank you so much!

If you have any questions, or special requests please reach out to me! 

All my best in love and adventure!    

Pamela

 

 

.

Every bit helps! Even if you can't contribute at the moment, you can still help by sharing my new project with your friends and family.  Just use the Indiegogo share tool.  At the top of the page on the right, you'll see FB, etc. icons.  You could also copy the link to this page and email it.  Thank you so much!
If you have any questions, or special requests please reach out to me! 
All my best in love and adventure!    
Pamela

story:
Welcome!  

The Caregiver Journey project provides prints of my painting, "The Caregiver Journey" , to raise funds for caregiver education.  

Rosalyn Carter said, "There are only four kinds of people in the world.  Those who have been caregivers, those who are currently caregivers, those who will be caregivers and those who will need a caregiver." 

The statistics are shocking and only getting worse.  Eighty percent of adults requiring long-term care currently live at home in the community, and unpaid family caregivers, primarily women,  provide 90% of their care.  Family caregivers find it necessary to leave their jobs to care for family members, or must juggle both the caregiver role while providing care.  The role is both physically and emotionally draining.   Most caregivers face an escalating challenge that they are not prepared for and have no training for.   

Knowing  how to care for a loved one with dementia is not something we learn in school or through life experience.  It's a crash course with tests we are totally unprepared for.  The Dealing with Dementia workshop gives caregivers proven strategies for dealing with a number of issues.

This project is starting in Maryville, Tennessee, USA but my hope is to expand it's reach across the United States and beyond.

About me

I I am a caregiver and caregiver educator who has always found an escape in art.  I personally care for both of my parents in addition to working full time. 

Dad dropped into a deep depression four years ago and was eventually diagnosed with frontotemporal dementia.  As often happens, the stress of caring for my father resulted in my mother being diagnosed with dementia as well.  My husband and I moved them closer to us three years ago.   

From the start of Dad's illness I have attended a caregiver support group.   No one understands a caregiver like a caregiver.   Knowing that others feel the same emotions and face the same challenges gives caregivers hope. 

I started educating myself on dementia and eventually was asked to become a trainer for the Rosalyn Carter Institute for Caregiving's "Dealing with Dementia" workshop.  The number in attendance at workshop after workshop has floored me!  Dementia is an epidemic and caregivers are desperate for information and hope!  My church has been supportive of my efforts to reach this community by providing a location for workshops and this past year we opened a Caregiver Cafe twice a month.   

About the painting

During one Caregiver Cafe gathering I asked the caregivers attending to share words, colors and images that represent their caregiver journey.  My goal was to find a way to creatively express that conversation and hopefully provide them with a painting to celebrate and honor them.  The result is my painting, "The Caregiver Journey."  In this one work you will find quotes, words (both positive and negative), images such as storm clouds, sunflowers, a purple Alzheimer's ribbon, a singing bird, a drive in the mountains and much more.  All are  things that the caregivers requested to be included.  The painting is perfectly imperfect... just like every caregivers journey.  Not everything is as it seems,   What should be isn't and what shouldn't be.. well it is anyway! 

What your donation will do

Donations will fund "Dealing with Dementia" workshops.  The Dealing with Dementia workshop  is a five hour program that gives caregivers proven strategies for dealing with a number of issues.  The cost to provide the materials and lunch for each attendee is $35.  Many caregivers can not afford the cost of the workshop and I am continuously trying to find funding.  My goal is to raise funds so those who want to attend can do so.   My hope is to do that with this campaign. 

Thank you gifts

I am so grateful for your support.  A gift of any amount is appreciated.  I want to share "The Caregiver Journey" with you so as a thank you, I would like to send you the following:   

  • For gifts of...
    • $10 or more -   a 5" x 7" postcards of "The Caregiving Journey."
    • $35 or more -  a signed 8" x 10"  print of "The Caregiver Journey."
    • $65 or more - a signed 11" x 14"  print of "The Caregiver Journey." 
    • $100 or more - a signed  16" x 20"  print of "The Caregiver Journey."
    • $75 - set of 10  5" x 7" postcards of "The Caregiver Journey."

Your own "Caregiver Journey"

If have read to this point  I'm guessing you have been impacted by dementia in some way.   A spouse, parent, sibling, or grandparent perhaps? If you have been a caregiver, you understand the impact of something as simple as this print which lets caregivers know their emotions and thoughts are normal and understood.   One moment of support can make a lasting impact.  

If your "Caregiver Journey" would look different that those of us living in the mountains and you would like your own version of "The Caregiver Journey" please contact me.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute,  you can still help with the campaign and help caregivers.   

  • Help spread the word about "The Caregiver Journey" project. 
  • Share this campaign on your social media pages.  
  • Make a difference in your community by helping caregivers in some way.   
  • Appreciate and support caregivers in your family.  

On behalf of caregivers everywhere. Thank you for your support!

Help spread the word about "The Caregiver Journey" project.
