story:
What is it? Teach teenagers to make art to enrich their lives through skills training, psychological and experiential creativity and providing economic opportunities.

PLEASE MAKE A DONATION!




Why? Shobiyana High School is in Acornhoek, a designated Presidential Poverty Node in Mpumalanga Province, South Africa. There is 80-85% unemployment and not much hope for school leavers. This rural area is ragged - it is under-resourced, often forgotten, neglected with broken infrastructure, short of water, - people go hungry here. There are thousands of orphans and vulnerable children and in extremely high HIV incidence - 1 in 3 people are positive. 


There is also Walter Sibuyi. 

For years in this challenging environment, art teacher Walter has been diligently showing up to teach hundreds of children about art at Shobiyana - his devotion to creativity is absolute. On an average day he has 70 children in his classroom; several hundred show up every Saturday morning for the art class, which Nick Vorono of our partner organisation NPO Seeds of Light has been fervently supporting. 


Walter expressed a desire to meet his creative hero, internationally acclaimed artist Andries Botha, he of the monumental elephant sculptures, and late last year we made that happen. 

Andries was so inspired by Walter's joyful passion that he made a generous offer: as a project of The Andries Botha Foundation, he will run a week long art workshop at at Shobiyana in April,  donating not only his time but, with Walter and the children, will build one of his famous elephants on the school grounds!

This will prepare learners for phase 2 of our project: a grand exhibition in the school hall in July, where the winning artwork will be awarded R5,000 ($500) and 20 artworks will be selected to be exhibited at the prestigious Art Cave Atelier in Salzburg, Austria. (See our PERKS on how YOU get to own an artwork!)


50 children will participate in the workshop - we need to purchase art materials, food, transport and materials to build the elephant sculpture.

Why is this important?

 1. Art enables people to know that they have rich inner resources, that they don't have to look outside of themselves for what they need. 

2. There is also an ever important need to link young people to nature and to establish an intimate relationship with wilderness and animals. Acornhoek borders the Kruger National Park, a nature reserve bigger than Israel that many of these children have never been into - a tragedy as THIS is their heritage. 

What is rich beyond measure in Acornhoek is CULTURE. 

So: fusing deep Shangaan lore of family totems with the Human Elephant Foundation’s credo, “The elephant is a metaphor for the the yearning for forgotten conversations between humans, the Earth and all living things”, learners have begun preparations for the workshop (see our gallery for artists in action).


The purpose of our campaign is to fund the workshop and exhibition, and also to build resources for Walter to expand his art program, his influence and work in this highly deprived area. We would like to run this program again next year and invite other high profile artists to participate to add impetus to the program.

We have already raised some funds to initiate the project - our partner organisations Seeds of Light, the Andries Botha Foundation, the Human Elephant Foundation, Bartel Arts Trust, Pick n Pay Hoedspruit and  Zingela Ulwazi are working hard to make this happen. We hope you will join us!
story_txt:
What is it? Teach teenagers to make art to enrich their lives through skills training, psychological and experiential creativity and providing economic opportunities.PLEASE MAKE A DONATION!


Why? Shobiyana High School is in Acornhoek, a designated Presidential Poverty Node in Mpumalanga Province, South Africa. There is 80-85% unemployment and not much hope for school leavers. This rural area is ragged - it is under-resourced, often forgotten, neglected with broken infrastructure, short of water, - people go hungry here. There are thousands of orphans and vulnerable children and in extremely high HIV incidence - 1 in 3 people are positive. 

There is also Walter Sibuyi. 


For years in this challenging environment, art teacher Walter has been diligently showing up to teach hundreds of children about art at Shobiyana - his devotion to creativity is absolute. On an average day he has 70 children in his classroom; several hundred show up every Saturday morning for the art class, which Nick Vorono of our partner organisation NPO Seeds of Light has been fervently supporting. 



Walter expressed a desire to meet his creative hero, internationally acclaimed artist Andries Botha, he of the monumental elephant sculptures, and late last year we made that happen. Andries was so inspired by Walter's joyful passion that he made a generous offer: as a project of The Andries Botha Foundation, he will run a week long art workshop at at Shobiyana in April,  donating not only his time but, with Walter and the children, will build one of his famous elephants  on the school grounds!This will prepare learners for phase 2 of our project: a grand exhibition in the school hall in July, where the winning artwork will be awarded R5,000 ($500) and 20 artworks will be selected to be exhibited at the prestigious Art Cave Atelier in Salzburg, Austria. (See our PERKS on how YOU get to own an artwork!)50 children will participate in the workshop - we need to purchase art materials, food, transport and materials to build the elephant sculpture.Why is this important? 1. Art enables people to know that they have rich inner resources, that they don't have to look outside of themselves for what they need. 2. There is also an ever important need to link young people to nature and to establish an intimate relationship with wilderness and animals. Acornhoek borders the Kruger National Park, a nature reserve bigger than Israel that many of these children have never been into - a tragedy as THIS is their heritage. What is rich beyond measure in Acornhoek is CULTURE. So: fusing deep Shangaan lore of family totems with the Human Elephant Foundation’s credo, “The elephant is a metaphor for the the yearning for forgotten conversations between humans, the Earth and all living things”, learners have begun preparations for the workshop (see our gallery for artists in action).The purpose of our campaign is to fund the workshop and exhibition, and also to build resources for Walter to expand his art program, his influence and work in this highly deprived area. We would like to run this program again next year and invite other high profile artists to participate to add impetus to the program.We have already raised some funds to initiate the project - our partner organisations Seeds of Light, the Andries Botha Foundation, the Human Elephant Foundation, Bartel Arts Trust, Pick n Pay Hoedspruit and  Zingela Ulwazi are working hard to make this happen. We hope you will join us!

story:
You can do so many things with a wheel and some clay – bowls, cups, plates, vessels, sculptures, you name it. And during this process, you become acutely aware of your posture, your individual muscles, and your creative impulses, all while sitting there. It’s a rare thing, having that individual awareness while sitting with a group of your peers, throwing together, but producing work of all shapes and sizes.

We want to bring that to this museum. We have a large number of ceramics in our collection, and really, what better way to highlight it, than to offer this hands-on experience. We’ve been offering satellite clay classes at The Kiln Studio and Gallery in Fairhope for the past few semesters now, because they’re super nice people and they have a great facility. But our goal is to finally offer wheel classes here, at the Museum, in this room:

You may be thinking, “Where are they going to fit this stuff?” Thanks to modern advances, we have a plan: 

Tabletop wheels! These bad boys can center 20 lbs. of clay, and even come with a hand lever that is handicap accessible. They’re also portable, so we can pull them out in our multi-purpose adult classroom, and pack them up again before a drawing or painting class starts. We can also just as easily pack them in the van to take to schools that don’t have a ceramics or art program, or bring them to a community event.

What We Need & What You Get

To fulfill our goal of offering ceramics classes to the masses and fostering art education in our community, we are asking for $7,000. This money will go to the purchase of 15 tabletop wheels and the supplies that come with them, including:

  • Clay tool kits
  • Wonder bats for wheels
  • Assorted glazes
  • Raku kiln
  • Clay for outreach
  • Kiln shelves
If you give $25 or more, you will receive 2 free admission tickets to the Museum for use any day (during regular museum hours). Give $100 or more and receive a handmade commemorative mug by local potter and MMofA instructor, Susie Bowman. Give $250 or more, and you are invited to a special 3-hour night class clay party, during which you get to test drive the new wheels and make your own clay creation. Give us $500 or more, and you will have a dedication plaque mounted on the wheel with your name. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps! Please, give what you can, even if it does not meet a special gift level. If you can't, please help by getting the word out. Share our page on social media and with your friends and family members. You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools, and keep the buzz going with #GiveWheelsMobile.

story:
Greetings from Vilcabamba, Ecuador. My name is Matthew P. Corley and I am raising funds to travel safely back to the United States. I have been on a personal quest of health and healing. My trip to Vilcabamba was also in efforts to bring supplies from the States to a family in need, and help them with their own fundraising campaign. Many close friends and family know that I suffer from chronic depression and anxiety. Every day is a struggle, some days easier than others. It is something I manage one day at a time, working with diet, exercise, and spiritual practice to overcome. Why Ecuador? Here I traveled to a small town called Vilcabamba, which is friendly to foreigners, where there is some of the purest water in the world and land that grows a variety of food: so living on a local raw food diet is practical and acquiring food is relatively inexpensive. I was thinking to live here but I realized that right now I am being pulled back to the US to continue connections and work that needs exploring. On returning I am hoping to stop in Colorado to spend time with my family (and hopefully friends) who I have not seen in a year. But although I have a little money saved up it is not enough and that is where I could use your support. So... 

I am putting together a book of personal writing, poetic inspiration drawn from a life of ontological research into the philosophies of the Orient, of the Hermetic, and of the Indigenous Americas. My study into the world of Ideas and Belief has been a life-long path, continually unfolding through into gems of Insight and Experience. It has been an inner story, one that I would like to share with you.

"The Sun Feeds Off The Dragons Dreams" is a collection of lavish writings, mystical interpretations, musings of a nomadic lifestyle, but importantly it is a body of work that I have yet to share. The work is predominantly informed by Taoist traditions, but is not tied to any one belief, practice, or idea. Inspiration comes from the spark of Life itself, the essence of Creation. I am planning the inside shall contain also a collection of whimsical drawings to help illustrate, elaborate, illuminate, enrich and enlighten the reader's experience. 

The money raised will go directly to safe travels back to the US, for the printing and for the mailing expenses of "The Sun Feeds Off The Dragons Dreams", mailing letters, thank-you's and other rewards; 
Thank you in advanced for your support :)

*If you do not wish for a reward option you are welcome to contribute any amount you wish in helping me get back home*

~A little bit about Palo Santo from Wikipedia : 

Ethnobotany

The use of Palo Santo from B. graveolens is traditional in South America, especially in Ecuador. According to the local customs, it is used against the "mala energía" (bad energy) ("Palo Santo para limpiar tu casa de la mala energia, Palo Santo para la buena suerte" or "Palo Santo to clean your house of bad energy, Palo Santo for good luck"), which may sometimes refer to clinical disease. Its use reportedly dates back to the Inca era.[4] Palo Santo is common today as a type of incense.

Palo santo rituals

Palo Santo oil was used during the time of the Incas for its reputed spiritual purifying properties. Today, palo santo oil may be applied to the body (such as at the base of the skull or on the spine) to increase relaxation,[4] similar to aromatherapy.

Palo santo may be burned, similar to incense, by lighting shavings of palo santo wood. In Peru, a shaman, or medicine man, reportedly lights palo santo sticks and the rising smoke will enter the "energy field" of ritual participants to "clear misfortune, negative thoughtprints, and 'evil spirits'".[5] Peruvians harvest fallen branches and twigs of the B. graveolens tree, a practice that is regulated by the government of Peru, so trees are not cut for wood harvesting.[6] The charcoal of palo santo sticks can also be used for ritual smudging.

Link to Artist Xi Zhang's work: http://xizhang.org/

God Bless ~*~

Matthew P. Corley

Polaroid by ShotsInSilence www.shotsinsilence.com

story:
日本語はコチラへどうぞ！！！！

Help us make the NyamaNyama art festival a reality!

About us :

"NyamaNyama" is the first international art festival in the history of Diébougou, Burkina Faso, for the local people by the local people with the Executive Committee of NyamaNyama. 

Our mission :

 NyamaNyama's intent is to create cultural exchange and to inspire people to believe that when you have nothing, you can make anything!

What we need:

It will cost $15,000 to hold this festival. One of our goals is to do this festival every year, so this budget includes investments for future events. The breakdown is shown below.

in Diébougou,Burkina Faso : Total $ 4,900

  • For theater and workshop (tent, electricity, T-shirts for staff) :  about $ 1,300
  • Staff (around $5, per days, 17 ppl, 8 days) (Technical cleaners, around $2, 1 day,  6 ppl)  : about $ 750
  • Music, Traditional performance and other guests (include transportation, hotel charge, food) : about $ 1,500

  • Renting a car to pick-up artists and equipments : about $ 150
  • Gas $1.19 per L (about 160 L) : about $ 200
  • Advertising cost (TV, Radio, Flyer) : about $ 1,000
in NYC, US (We decided based on the laws of the State of New York) : Total $ 2,900

  • All images for NyamaNyama (Using T-shirts, Some goods, Brochure, Website, Post Card and everything) : $ 1,000
  • Translation of languages (4 countries $150 each other) : $ 600
  • Website for NyamaNyama ($200 per year) : $ 200 more
  • Post card (3 designs, 500 postcard of each design) : about $ 100
  • Brochure including postal fees (120 pages 100 books) : $ 1,000
The exhibition in NYC : Total $ 4,500

  • Kinda (Artist) and Cheick (organizer of NyamaNyama) 's transportation including hotel fee (3days) : $ 3,000
  • Participating Artists in NYC (musician, painter and someone about 10ppl) : $ 1,500
Make some products : Total $ 2,700

Why did we create "NyamaNyama"?

The seed of this art show was very simple: "I was planning on visiting a friend in Diébougou. There I thought I'll meet someone interesting and have a lively conversation. From that conversation, I believe something interesting can be born." Before you know it a simple gathering like this can make Diébougou a place to be.

The title of the show “Nyama Nyama” means garbage in the local language. Garbage is closely involved in our daily life, playing an important role in the cycle of human lives. We want to call this show “Nyama Nyama” To bring a new awareness to garbage to prove that something deemed to be worthless in our daily lives, like garbage, could have values with a different perspective.

Objective : 

The purpose of this art show is to achieve 6 goals below.

  1. To engage in creative activities using local resources, as a way to revitalize Diébougou.
  2. To enjoy the interaction created by co-exhibiting art works from New York, Berlin, Tokyo and many cities from around the world.
  3. To give rise to unfettered, free, uniquely Diébougou ways of thinking. 
  4. To make Diébougou a place of destination for people who want to experience things one can only experience in Diébougou. 
  5. To reflect on how Diébougou can be improved.
  6. To pass on whatever is created in this art show to the next generation of youth in Diébougou.

Our Challenges in Burkina Faso.

"To have nothing means to have a possibility of having anything."

The first task in creating this budget was to be on the same page with people in about value and priority. The initial budget estimation from Diébougou was a lot bigger than we thought, with a huge budget to invite a famous singer from the capital city and food vendors but it did not include payment for festival staff.

Many of the locals have never realized the possibility of Diébougou itself. What we need for the festival, is not to bring something that are said "good" from somewhere more developed. They said: "there is nothing here, who would want to come to such a place?"

But they do have things. Little kids are making djembe out of empty cans and playing music! So now, we have one thought that we share: this festival will help us realize all the art that’s already in our daily life by creating cultural exchange, and  seek the maximum possibility of our beautiful Diébougou.

With this budget, we are starting to create new products in Diébougou, by the hands of the local people. Through this festival, we would like to start searching something absolutely new, something that no one in the world has ever experienced, here in Diébougou, where has a possibility of having anything.

Short on cash? How about sending us your creative ideas!

We are looking for idea/concept donations as well. We want to collaborate with as many people from all over the world as possible. No matter how small of an idea, this beautiful city has a possibility to make it a reality.

Do you have an awesome chair design that is completely recyclable? Share it with us! We're hoping that manufacturers will see that this land is the best place to put their advanced technology to work and make donations for this festival. 

Our future:

We will continue this project for at least 10 years. Our near future goal is to pass this project to the next generation. We would be very happy if you will dream with us, by making a donation for this festival.

Follow us :

Website : http://www.nyamanyama.org

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/NyamaNyama/617093328390877?sk=info&tab=page_info

Twitter : https://twitter.com/NyamaNyama_org

Storehouse : https://www.storehouse.co/profiles/x2hn5

Sponsored by :

No-Bièl, District Sanitaire de Diébougou, Mairie de Diébougou, WOUNGOTO-SUI, BERGER AFRICA, Inoussa Dao

Organizers :

Cheick Ouattara : Burkina Faso / Revolutionary・No-Bièl Representative

Mihee Suh : New York, US / Photographer

Miyu Sakurai (Leilani) : Tokyo, Japan / Japan Overseas Cooperation Volunteer・Performer・WOUNTOGO-SUI

story:
Since 2006, Expressions From Englewood has presented the best personal essays, poetry, fiction and papers of research from people that live, work, and/or go to school in this much maligned, much misunderstood, but talent-rich community. In 2013, the City of Chicago recognized the journal's impact and importance by awarding its Kathy Osterman Award to Corey Hall, the journal's editor and publisher. To date, six volumes of Expressions From Englewood have given voice to people whose positive values and contributions to themselves, their families, and society have been ignored. Volume Seven -- which will arrive in early June -- promises to bring even more depth from an ever-growing talent pool of "Expressionists" to you. 

To meet the growing costs associated with graphic design and printing, we are seeking to raise $1000 to bring this project to fruition. Every dollar you donate to this cause will help satisfy these costs. If the campaign only raises $10, or if it raises $100,000, the funds will go solely to the design and printing of Volume Seven.

Additionally, numerous incentives for all contributors will be described in detail under the "Perks" section. Whatever you contribute to this cause will be very much appreciated, as we already thank you for taking the time to even read this pitch!

story:
Short Summary

Hello and welcome. My name is Phil Hernandez and I am an artist trying to take my own path with an art career. I have been drawing for over 25 years and painting for about 6 years. I have an Associates degree in Graphic Design but unfortunately the school I attended and received my degree from lost a class action lawsuit and shut down. So it's been rather difficult trying to get even an entry level position with my education background. But I haven't allowed that from stopping me and pursuing my passion. I greatly enjoy the game 'Magic: the Gathering' and have found a way to combine both my life long passion of art and a hobby I've enjoyed for years.

What I am trying to do is get my art and my name out into the world. Seeing as Magic: the Gathering is a worldwide game, it helps greatly in what I plan to achieve. But to reach that audience and to have my art seen worldwide, I need as much help as I can get because I also plan on making this a career. Which is why I'm here. With any and all assistance here I will be able to get a good jump start on my goal.

All contributions here will greatly help with all the supplies needed for me to get a jump start on my goal. I see this goal as a career move that I am taking as I plan on continuing long term. In contributing and helping me out, you will not be doing it without my gratitude. Several perks will be available to those whose choose to help me on starting my journey.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking at a funding goal of $800 to help get me started with the supplies I'll need to get things going. Here is a listing of the supplies I'll need to get started up.

  • Acrylic and water color paints
  • New paint brushes
  • Clear spray sealant
  • Magic: the Gathering cards
  • Blank playmats
  • Blank Artist Trading Cards
  • Shipping boxes
  • Envelopes and plastic top loaders for the cards
Some of the perks you can receive:
  • Randomly selected custom one of a kind hand drawn Token cards for your Magic: the Gathering decks
  • Randomly selected Magic: the Gathering cards altered to have the artwork extend out to the borders of the cards.
  • You may choose to ship your own Magic: the Gathering cards to me and have them altered.
  • A custom hand-drawn playmat done with graphite pencils.
(Perks will be shipped within 1-2 weeks of the end date of my campaign.)
Take a look at the sample images in my facebook link to get an idea of what my work looks like and what you may receive according to your contribution.
What if the goal isn't met?
If the $800 goal isn't met then don't worry one bit. For those who were able to contribute to my goal, you will still receive your perks and I will use whatever contributions were made to kick start my goal in getting my art around the world. But then again, if the goal is reached and there is still time remaining, then I will add on more perks for those who wish to contribute and help me share my passion with the world.

The Impact

This campaign is me reaching out to everyone in hopes that there might be someone out there willing to help me reach my goal. Some people believe in karma much like myself. There have been many in my life that I have helped when they needed it without question. So for those of you who do contribute and help me will receive my gratitude and I will do my best not continue pushing forward.

One too many obstacles have come across my path preventing me from reaching my goal of sharing my art and in turn having others come to me wanting more. Now being a contributor will give you a sample of what I am capable to producing and you can show it off to your friends and family which in turn could turn into more people wanting to have a piece of my work.

For those who enjoy playing Magic: the Gathering, you know that having that one special card can make you stand out in the crowd with so much positive attention. Some may frown upon getting a nice card of value and having someone paint over it but for every 1 of those types of people, there will be dozens who will be envious of what you have. Then again, not many people are able to go out and afford altered cards, so this here is a great opportunity to get your hands on 1 or 2 or 4, or even a custom hand drawn playmat that no one else in the world will have but you. We are each our own person and having your own personalized collection of something you enjoy is what will keep me going forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help. Everyone can help actually, in one way or another. Spread the word about me and my work. Let others see what I can do and the perks they can get. Perhaps you're not a fan of Magic: the Gathering but your neighbor is, just let them know about my campaign. Every little bit helps even if you're sending a link to my page to all your friends.

Thank you all for your believing in me and helping in whichever way you were able to, I greatly appreciate it.

Phil-

story:
About a year ago, I changed my outlook on life. I started to realize that I was allowing my surroundings to affect my mood. My current job was draining me and all I did was get up, go to work, go home and then repeat. I didn't exercise at all and I ate whatever was the quickest to order through the drive thru or get delivered. I ate what I thought I "deserved" because I was working so hard. I was the only one in the office, and I was managing everything. If it came through the door, I started the order and handed it back when finished. I also did cash reports, monitored/ordered inventory, designed, printed, dealt with billing issues and many other things. The line that I started to say that changed my outlook was "I'm not going to let them take that away from me.". It was a very powerful phrase for me.

This phrase meant, that if I can't go exercise/leave for lunch/meet up with friends later then it's their fault. However, it is MINE if I let them be an excuse. I stopped making excuses. I started taking a stand and started doing yoga. I knew I had to stay late at work, so I locked up the office at 5pm, flew down to my gym, went to a yoga class, and then came back to work. This sometimes meant I would be working until 1:30am, just to go home, sleep and go back to open the store at 8:00am. I loved my line of work and my customers, but I don't wish that kind of hectic on anyone.

Many other things started clicking into place after I started standing up for myself. I started working out at Farrell's Extreme Body Shaping last September. I started blogging for Jam Art & Supplies. I quit my job because I found a new one! I won Best Transformation and started coaching at my gym. By then I had met a ton of new people, amazing artists through events and JAM, and so many awesome people at Farrell's. These people are what got me started and who I am doing this for. I want to help this community GROW! I see the potential that Sioux Falls is coming into and I want to be a part of it!

Then, in perfect timing, I found out my previous job closed the doors a couple months after I quit. 

I kept missing my customers and printing. People would ask where I work now and if they can get prints from me there. (They also asked this when my last job was still up and running.) Artists were starting to hear about me through other people. A few were spreading the word that I knew what I was talking about and was very easy to work with.

I had the idea a couple years ago. I thought about starting off on my own, but just never got up off my butt and did anything about it. I just needed that teeny bit of confidence. All I really needed was hearing my friend Amy say "It's possible.". Suddenly, it took off. I was registering the business, applying for a sales tax license, naming the business and marketing via social media.

$6,000 will cover the cost of the printer, delivery and installation. If I get the money raised to buy the printer outright, this will allow me to focus on the orders that are already piling up! Anything over that amount will go towards rolls of media that I'll need to purchase to start printing as well.

With this printer, I will be printing out fine art prints and standard large prints up to 44" wide. I also have scanning capabilities for ANY size piece of work. I will be able to print on canvas, matte paper, lightweight paper, photo paper, vinyl, and so much more! It is a 12-color printer, so the colors will be fantastic! I've designated JAM Art and Supplies as a meet up place for pick up and drop offs. It is in the same building as Exposure. Until I get a physical location, I'll be printing out of my house. I'll be making appointments with people for the time being.

Pick a perk or donate a random amount! If you've been asking how to help, here is how! Thank you for being so supportive of me and my new business, Prints & Repeat !

story:
Hello World

 My name is Michael Vee and I wrote a book about Art Magic
I have been traveling the last two years painting at festivals.
One of the most common questions I get is where do you get inspiration?
So I filled a little pocket book with 100 quotes,ideas,drawings and projects to get those creative juices flowing.
The goal here is to buy more blank books and pens.
All these books are hand written by me. With original art in each one.

What We Need & What You get

I need more pens and blank books.
You get a (physical)copy of the book!
It is already free to view and download on my website michaelvee.com

I wrote this book last winter 

 Many have told me how much it has helped them to get creative again.


I want to make this book free for everyone.

That's why I need your help. 
This goal is small because it won't take much to make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share share share. You can also tell people about the book.

It's free to download in a PDF file on my website michaelvee.com

story:
Hi There!

You may know me, you may not. My name is Stephanie, I'm 26 and I have been an artist since I could pick up a crayon. Those who know me have always been supportive of my goals as an artist, So far in my life, art has just been a hobby and I never thought I would be given the chance to support myself doing what I love. I recently have been given an opportunity to start a tattoo apprenticeship at Shadow of Comfort Tattoo. The shop is only a year old, but in that year it has been able to gain a name for itself in the industry here in Albuquerque as a welcoming, clean, friendly place that gives nothing but the best work to it's clients and friends. This is all thanks to the dream of the team that works here. Gilbert, Eric, Jessie and Cynthia believe that art comes first. They saw something in me and were willing to teach me what I needed to know to grow as an artist. They spend time, effort, and money helping me reach my goals. I want to repay them by becoming the best at what I do and help the shop continue to make a great name for itself. The next step in my apprenticeship is purchasing my equipment. Right now, I have about 10,000 dollars in student debt and am unable to take out a loan to purchase what I need. My parents are helping to support me while I continue my education so that I don't have to work full time and I couldn't be more grateful. I wouldn't have gotten this far without their help. However, there are things that I simply can't ask them to pay for after all they already do. If you are willing to donate to my cause, I would not only be able to continue this great opportunity, but I would also be able to continue to enhance my life.

I need to raise 1800 dollars for equipment and supplies. Anything helps. If I don't reach my whole goal, all the money will be put towards buying the equipment piece by piece.  For those of you who are interested, if you contribute to this growing process for me, I will do my best to use your body as my canvas during this learning experience. Gilbert and Jessie will be over my shoulder making sure nothing but the best work comes out of this shop. If Tattoos aren't a part of your plans for the future, I could paint you a custom piece of artwork. Just send me an e-mail at smalan@unm.edu with your name and donation amount and we can discuss what it is that I can do to help with your tattoo and art plans. And be sure to check out the amazing work that is done here at Shadow of Comfort Tattoo. You can visit our website at soctattoo.com or follow us on Facebook. Thank you! This business is very tough and I am sure that the road ahead will be a rough one. With your support and encouragement, I am sure I will be able to share my art and be successful. I believe I can help people feel better about themselves and make this world a more beautiful place.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can donate, but there are other ways you can contribute. If you share this with friends and family or even just like our Facebook page, then the shop will be able to get more exposure and the additional clients can help repay my debt to these awesome people here at SOC Tattoo!

Love and blessings to all of you!

story:
My Story. 

My name is Cliff Maynard and art is what drives me. There is honestly nothing more that I would rather do with my life than to create and grow as an artist. Several years ago, purely by chance I stumbled upon a technique of using the leftover burnt paper scraps from the butts of marijuana cigarettes, commonly known as 'Roaches' to create all of the required tones and highlights in my artwork. Although I have generated a small following in the medical and recreational cannabis community, I now feel that it is time to reach out to a broader audience and more aggressively pursue my passion for art
For more about Cliff Maynard watch:  "The Roach Paper Artist"

What is 'Roach Paper Art?'

For those unfamiliar with my process here are some things you should know:

  1. The last bit of a joint left over after it has been smoked is called a 'Roach'.
  2. The scrap of burnt paper after any remaining plant material (reefer) has been removed is called a 'Roach Paper'.
  3. 'Roach Papers' come in varying shades of browns & whites due to the discoloration inherent to the smoking process.
These brown tones are what I use  as my medium. By tearing, trimming and combining these bits of paper i am able to create every line and shadow. It's a lot like working a jigsaw puzzle but each "piece" represents a moment in time shared by friends.


Some of my recent projects. More in gallery.


"This art is SMO-KIN!"..........................................................................Cheech Marin

"Creative way to dispose of roaches, MAN".....................................Tommy Chong

"This is the greatest art I've ever seen!"............................................,... Jack Herer

"Dude,YOU are phenomenal!! Craziest shit I've ever seen!" ................................................................................... Lou Dog ~ Kottonmouth Kings

What I Need.
The term 'Starving Artist' is a cultural reality and absolutely no joke. The funds we receive from this campaign will go to:
  1. Help me be able to afford to explore this unique medium and continue to create new material until I can find a way to get my work displayed in an art gallery.
  2. Purchase important items I desperately need to improve my YouTube Channel, printing, matting, and shipping capability.
  3. Cover the costs involved in getting 'The Perks' offered for this fund raising campaign to you for your generous and timely contributions.
  4. Bring more widespread attention to my artwork and its message.
Any amount over our goal will go to pay for a much-needed tech upgrade in the form of better video editing software and digital camera, both of which are needed for me to continue creating my 'timee-laps' movies like the one above and those in the 'Video Gallery' and on my YouTube channel.
What You Get.
Levels 1-3
Level one, two, or three contributors will receive one or more first edition Chronic Art - 'Cannabis Collectors Cards'. Available only through Indigogo! Signed by the artist Cliff Maynard.

Level 4

Level four contributors will receive a special edition print entitled "Chronic Mix". An Indigogo exclusive! Signed & numbered by the artist Cliff Maynard with a Certificate of Authenticity and brown or black matting. Only 50 available!



"Rose"

Contribute $500.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Rose" 
by Cliff Maynard.
10x8 - Custom matted & framed.

"Rose Bud"

Contribute $550.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Rose Bud" by Cliff Maynard.
8x10 - Custom matted & framed.

"Chain Smoker"

Contribute $1000.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Chain Smoker" by Cliff Maynard.
9x12 - Custom matted & framed.

"Opened Heart"

Contribute $1100.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Opened Heart" by Cliff Maynard.
9x12 - Custom matted & framed.

"Losing Faith"

Contribute $1500.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Losing Faith" by Cliff Maynard.
11x14 - Custom matted & framed.

"American Spirits"

Contribute $1600.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "American Spirits" by Cliff Maynard.
11x14 - Custom matted & framed.

"Super Mystery Project!"

Contribute $2500.00 and you'll get to commission and keep, a roach paper art original rendition of anything you want!

Seriously, Anything.

Other Ways You Can Help.

Not everyone can contribute financially. Here are some ways you can still help!
  • Spread the news about Cliff Maynard, Chronic Art and this campaign to all your friends and post about it on social media. Be sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools available on this site.
  • Visit my website: www.chronic-art.com or my Etsy store:  www.etsy.com/shop/ChronicArt420 and make a purchase whenever you like. The print runs are all strictly limited to 420 units and there are many different images available. Start a collection!
  • Commission me for original artwork using your own idea or design or your business logo! 
  • Save your own roach papers and somehow get them to me for use in future projects. It takes a lot of roach papers to make a mosaic and I'm always looking for new materials!
  • Basically just spread the word. Talk about and share my videos until they go viral! Like us on Facebook! Tweet about us, Instagram! Shout my name from a mountain top! Whatever you can do! Every little bit helps!

Social Media Info.

  • Website: http://www.roachpaperart.com
  • Etsy store: https://www.etsy.com/shop/ChronicArt420
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ChronicArt
  • Instagram: https://instagram.com/chronicart420/
  • YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/RoachPaperArt/videos


In Conclusion.

Cannabis is fast becoming a household word across the country and whatever your opinion concerning 'medical' or 'recreational', this artwork is on the cutting edge of that movement and YOU can be a part of it!

Thank You.

Cliff Maynard / Chronic Art
story_txt:
My Story. My name is Cliff Maynard and art is what drives me. There is honestly nothing more that I would rather do with my life than to create and grow as an artist. Several years ago, purely by chance I stumbled upon a technique of using the leftover burnt paper scraps from the butts of marijuana cigarettes, commonly known as 'Roaches' to create all of the required tones and highlights in my artwork. Although I have generated a small following in the medical and recreational cannabis community, I now feel that it is time to reach out to a broader audience and more aggressively pursue my passion for art

For more about Cliff Maynard watch:  "The Roach Paper Artist"





What is 'Roach Paper Art?'
For those unfamiliar with my process here are some things you should know:
The last bit of a joint left over after it has been smoked is called a 'Roach'.

The scrap of burnt paper after any remaining plant material (reefer) has been removed is called a 'Roach Paper'.
'Roach Papers' come in varying shades of browns & whites due to the discoloration inherent to the smoking process.
These brown tones are what I use  as my medium. By tearing, trimming and combining these bits of paper i am able to create every line and shadow. It's a lot like working a jigsaw puzzle but each "piece" represents a moment in time shared by friends.








Some of my recent projects. More in gallery.














"This art is SMO-KIN!"..........................................................................Cheech Marin

"Creative way to dispose of roaches, MAN".....................................Tommy Chong"This is the greatest art I've ever seen!"............................................,... Jack Herer
"Dude,YOU are phenomenal!! Craziest shit I've ever seen!" ................................................................................... Lou Dog ~ Kottonmouth Kings



What I Need.


The term 'Starving Artist' is a cultural reality and absolutely no joke. The funds we receive from this campaign will go to:




Help me be able to afford to explore this unique medium and continue to create new material until I can find a way to get my work displayed in an art gallery.

Purchase important items I desperately need to improve my YouTube Channel, printing, matting, and shipping capability.

Cover the costs involved in getting 'The Perks' offered for this fund raising campaign to you for your generous and timely contributions.

Bring more widespread attention to my artwork and its message.


Any amount over our goal will go to pay for a much-needed tech upgrade in the form of better video editing software and digital camera, both of which are needed for me to continue creating my 'timee-laps' movies like the one above and those in the 'Video Gallery' and on my YouTube channel.







What You Get.
Levels 1-3

Level one, two, or three contributors will receive one or more first edition Chronic Art - 'Cannabis Collectors Cards'. Available only through Indigogo! Signed by the artist Cliff Maynard.








Level 4

Level four contributors will receive a special edition print entitled "Chronic Mix". An Indigogo exclusive! Signed & numbered by the artist Cliff Maynard with a Certificate of Authenticity and brown or black matting. Only 50 available!











"Rose"
Contribute $500.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Rose" by Cliff Maynard.10x8 - Custom matted & framed.
"Rose Bud"Contribute $550.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Rose Bud" by Cliff Maynard.8x10 - Custom matted & framed.





"Chain Smoker"
Contribute $1000.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Chain Smoker" by Cliff Maynard.9x12 - Custom matted & framed.

"Opened Heart"
Contribute $1100.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Opened Heart" by Cliff Maynard.9x12 - Custom matted & framed.












"Losing Faith"Contribute $1500.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "Losing Faith" by Cliff Maynard.11x14 - Custom matted & framed.

"American Spirits"
Contribute $1600.00 and receive the original roach paper mosaic entitled "American Spirits" by Cliff Maynard.11x14 - Custom matted & framed.





"Super Mystery Project!"
Contribute $2500.00 and you'll get to commission and keep, a roach paper art original rendition of anything you want!Seriously, Anything.




Other Ways You Can Help.
Not everyone can contribute financially. Here are some ways you can still help!


Spread the news about Cliff Maynard, Chronic Art and this campaign to all your friends and post about it on social media. Be sure to check out the Indiegogo share tools available on this site.
Visit my website: www.chronic-art.com or my Etsy store:  www.etsy.com/shop/ChronicArt420 and make a purchase whenever you like. The print runs are all strictly limited to 420 units and there are many different images available. Start a collection!

Commission me for original artwork using your own idea or design or your business logo! 

Save your own roach papers and somehow get them to me for use in future projects. It takes a lot of roach papers to make a mosaic and I'm always looking for new materials!

Basically just spread the word. Talk about and share my videos until they go viral! Like us on Facebook! Tweet about us, Instagram! Shout my name from a mountain top! Whatever you can do! Every little bit helps!






Social Media Info.

Website: http://www.roachpaperart.com


Etsy store: https://www.etsy.com/shop/ChronicArt420

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ChronicArt
Instagram: https://instagram.com/chronicart420/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/RoachPaperArt/videos





In Conclusion.


Cannabis is fast becoming a household word across the country and whatever your opinion concerning 'medical' or 'recreational', this artwork is on the cutting edge of that movement and YOU can be a part of it!
Thank You.
Cliff Maynard / Chronic Art

story:
The Opportunity to Help Fulfill a Vision 

Focus on the Masters (FOTM) Founder and Executive Director Donna Granata will embark this summer on an ambitious project that will have far-reaching and long-lasting effects on our organization and our cultural community. She has been selected to participate in the prestigious Masters program at the USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism.  Beginning in July 2015 and ending in May 2016, the 9 ½ month program is designed to enhance her skills as a documentarian specializing in the arts. Utilizing the FOTM Archive and Library as primary source material, Donna will learn the latest digital recording and editing techniques, innovative documentation procedures and entrepreneurial skills needed  to reach the widest possible audience. The FOTM archive will serve as a living research laboratory unlike any project brought forth to the USC Annenberg School. Upon completion of the program, Donna will earn a Masters of Arts Degree in Communication & Journalism Specializing in the Arts, making her an even stronger leader of Focus on the Masters.  While Donna is learning all of the latest and best practices, her loyal staff and volunteers will conduct numerous special events for members and the general public throughout the year.  But, we need your help to make the coming year a success for Focus on the Masters! 

What is Focus on the Masters?

Focus on the Masters   is a non-profit, 501(c)(3), art appreciation program that documents, preserves and presents the works and lives of accomplished contemporary artists. The FOTM archive and library includes photographic portraits, audio and video interviews, digitized artwork and biographical research that encompass each artist's experiences, reflections and development. Not only is this rich resource made available to researchers, but FOTM also seeks to present it to a broad public through educational programs for all ages, notably the Learning to See Outreach program, a monthly Artist Spotlight Interview Series, exhibitions, publications, and an extensive resource library. FOTM is the only biographical resource project of its kind in California. Its multiple projects are linked by a common mission: to demonstrate the importance of the arts to a healthy society by bringing highly accomplished artists to the forefront of the community. 

Who Is Donna Granata?

From a very young age, Donna was surrounded by talented, creative people who taught her the nurturing qualities the arts bring to the mind and spirit. In her teens Donna was mentored by Blanche McBroom, a gifted artist who recognized Donna’s enthusiasm and talent for art.  She was encouraged to attend Ventura College where she met Gerd Koch, faculty member and accomplished abstract expressionist.  He described Donna as a “sponge,” her mind ready and eager to absorb all she could about art and art history.  Her travels to Europe led by Gerd deepened her knowledge and appreciation for art.  She enrolled at Brooks Institute of Photography, where she earned a Bachelor of Science Degree and later was awarded an honorary Master’s Degree.  Her skills as a photographer and her determination to share her knowledge of our arts community have been recognized by museums, journalists, critics and art lovers around the country. 

In 1994, Donna founded Focus on the Masters to preserve and share historic images of artists she had produced while a student studying photography. Over the years, with the help of financial supporters and volunteers, Donna created a unique organization that brings the inspiring stories of accomplished artists to all ages, from school children to adults, from those who simply love art to those who create it. 

What We Need & the Benefits of Your Generosity

The most important benefit to giving to this campaign is your historic contribution. With the success of this campaign, Focus on the Masters will reach a new plateau – critical to the long term planning, sustainability and distribution of our research to educate the widest possible audience. The Archive is a growing, jam-packed treasure chest of information about accomplished artists who are living and working in our community and beyond. A typical documented artist’s file contains extensive oral histories, videotaped interviews, a digital library of the artist’s work, publications, essays, published work, slides, CD/DVDs, and video footage. In addition, we maintain ongoing files on emerging and established artists. All of the biographical information we collect is used as a springboard for each of our programs. Click on the following links below to learn about each program and our community enrichment:

· Artist Spotlight Interviews Filmed before a Live Studio Audience 
· Learning to See Youth Outreach
· Learning to See Outreach for Adults with Mental Illness
· Master List of Artists Documented (updated yearly)
· Focus on the Masters Portrait Series
· Focus on the Masters Events & Exhibits

Specifically the funds will be used to secure operating expenses so that Focus on the Masters community programming will continue uninterrupted.

Funds are needed to:
· Secure grant-writing consultant Tracy Long, PhD. for one year;
· Increase our Education Director Aimee French’s hours from 30 hours to 40 hours per week; and
· Maintain our community outreach and special arts programming throughout the year.

The Impact on Our Community & Cultural Heritage
The artists who survive history are those who write or are written about. Your contribution will help many contemporary artists further their historic significance. Our goal is to enhance community awareness and share the history and diversity of our cultural assets, fostering an understanding of art and its essential place in a healthy community. In addition, we contribute to our community's reputation as a cultural destination and are a leading cultural and historic resource. 

Our biographical resources are utilized by historians, curators, museum directors and the media for exhibitions, books, artists' catalogs, publications and video profiles. Samples throughout our history include research by the J. Paul Getty Museum exhibition The Grapes of Wrath: Horace Bristol's California Photographs in 2002/2003;  The Museum of Ventura County’s Four Masters: Four Legends featuring Gerd Koch, William McEnroe, Carlisle Cooper and Norman Kirk in 2011 and Tina’s Toys and Other Things featuring the work of Jeff Sanders in 2014; and the Ojai Valley Museum’s research on Carlyle Montgomery (1947-1998) in 2014 for a feature documentary.  Video vignettes include the Carnegie Art Museum’s Urban Scenes:  Distinct but Related, photography by Robert Brown and paintings and monotypes by Elisse Pogofsky-Harris and the Santa Paula Art Museum’s video vignette for the Norman Kirk: A Retrospective in 2011.  Most recent publications include, Art &  Place Site–Specific Art of the Americas by Phaidon Press, 2013 who utilized Dennis Oppenheim’s Bus Home image to promote the book. Ventura’s Bus Home was published in USA Today, Time magazine and many other high profile publications. In 2013, The Birds of Bob Privitt, Gerd Koch & Carole Milton: Our Journey Together  and the Ojai Studio Artists: 3 Decades  were published utilizing FOTM intellectual assets and accompanied their respective exhibitions. The 2015 publication Trumbo: Blacklisted Hollywood Radical by Larry Ceplair and Christopher Trumbo (1940-2011) is among the most recent FOTM contributions providing Christopher Trumbo’s oral history to assist in the research of the family history.

Why you might want to fund this project?

  • Fund it because you know and appreciate the value of Focus on the Masters.
  • Fund it because you recognize the value of our community of artists.
  • Fund it because you have a keen interest in history.
  • Fund it because Focus on the Masters is the only biographical archive of its kind in California.
  • Fund it because you love the arts.
  • Fund it because you believe in arts education.
  • Fund it because you admire the artists who create amazing works of art.
  • Fund it because you’re inspired when others open their hearts and share what’s meaningful to them.
  • Fund it because you think artists’ stories need to be told and that they merit preservation.
  • Fund it because it’s Pay It Forward Time. You’ve been on the receiving end, now it’s your turn to be on the giving end.

Your help is NECESSARY and APPRECIATED. Look in the sidebar to your right for giving levels and for our gestures of thanks! 

Other Ways to Help Achieve Our Goal

Whether you donate yourself or not, there are lots of additional ways you can help! 

  • Share this campaign with your friends on Facebook and other social media. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us to get the word out.
  • Email the link to others you think may be inspired to contribute. 
  • Invite a member of our staff to speak to your organization or social group.
  • Donate your time to help us in the archive.
  • Host a fundraising event.
  • Become a Focus on the Masters member.

Remember: Focus on the Masters is a 501(3)(c) arts education program. Tax I.D. #77-049-8291.  Your gift is tax-deductible to the extent allowable by law.

story:
Now you can have your own animal house, without all the mess.

Do you love animals and want your home to reflect your love? Does your dog need a food dish that looks like him and do you wish you had a cake stand that looked like a big squishy kitty? If so, I have plans for a sweet new home decor and pet product line that will suit all your needs. Each piece is made with intricate details and high quality materials making it a precious piece of art. The offbeat style is unique while the practical designs are durable enough to be used and enjoyed daily. With your help I can begin to create the work using a streamlined process that will make it available at an extremely affordable price range.



But first, I need help spreading the word about my campaign, so before I tell you about my work let me offer you a chance to win your own super small snail friend.

To win him, simply share this campaign as a public post on social media as well as directly with any friends you think might like it. Then go to my page and let me know that you did, so I can give you credit. Once you learn about my story, if you decide you want to pre-order, it will count as a second chance towards winning this teeny tiny snail.

Over to the right you can check out the specific perks that are available for pre-order. They are structured by price, size, and fall into three product lines:


The Furry Friends line will be composed of products ranging from little dishes and cheese boards for humans to pet food dishes of various shapes and sizes for our furry friends to enjoy. The focus will be on house hold pets such as mice, dogs, cats, and rabbits. If you would like to see your favorite animal friends incorporated into a functional ceramic product then this is the line for you!


The Artfully Spiritual line was inspired by many of the lovely ladies I met through an online business class called B-School. I have always been interested in religion and spirituality and one of my first clay projects was a rather large Ganesha covered in henna patterns (not the one pictured). When I saw my fellow B-Schoolers sharing images of their crystal grids I was so intrigued by them and got to researching. I knew crystal grids could be so much more amazing if they were combined with animals and am really excited to offer this. I already have a mold for a sea turtle flower of life grid and am planing on developing a cat grid that incorporates the phases of the moon. I want  to combine the Sir Yantra with an animal but haven't settled on which one yet. If you have an idea, than this is the line for you. I would also like to create relief sculptures of various religious figures that could hang on the wall.


The Adirondack Friends Line will focus around the animals of the Adirondacks. I am creating this line to reflect the area I live in. It will have products ranging from chipmunk coasters, to loon trivets, and snapping turtle pizza stones. The image above is of an early version of the pizza stone. The final product will be similar but not exactly the same. Mostly, it will be a bit more detailed in the texture of its shell. I have done extensive research into the technical aspects of pizza stones and am really excited to get started on this.  (Hint: the clay is sparkly!)

And now, let me tell you a bit more about what you will be helping to create and why I need your help:

My work combines art, animals, and every day objects in a way that amuses people, helps them to pause for a moment in their busy day, and maybe disturbs them a little bit. Since 2013 I have been lucky enough to work creatively everyday to help bring art into peoples' lives. I've tested many different product lines and strategies for turning my creative endeavors into products that people love. After much trial and error I realized that I and my work are best suited for custom designs.


I love working one on one with clients but with the way I work, I need to charge at least $500, if not more, for the highly involved pieces I create. My clients love my work but it has left me wishing I could also produce pieces at a lower price point.

Not everyone is able or wants to spend hundreds of dollars on art and the customers who helped to build my business in the first place can no longer afford my work. I feel very strongly that everyone deserves and needs to experience art in their life, so I have been searching for a way to make my work more affordable. I looked into licensing my designs and having them produced but the start up costs are in the thousands, most ceramic production is done overseas, and a minimum order of 1,000 units per design is required.

Why not simplify?

At first I tried to create simpler work but even with simpler designs, it was still labor intensive and customers weren't really interested in the dumbed down versions of my work. Then after making a plaster mold for a client's project I realized that if I work with certain shapes, I can use plaster molds to preserve my detailed style while greatly reducing the labor. With the reduction of labor, I can pass on lower prices to my customers. Having a lower priced mold made line will allow people who aren't looking for a custom order to experience art in their everyday life.

In order to start a small scale production line I need financial help to cover a few things. I could keep going at my current pace, creating a few molds whenever I can squeeze them in, but that would make putting out a cohesive product line, with lots of options for you to choose from, next to impossible. With your help I can devote enough time to each line so that they will be done in time to be given as Christmas gifts to yourself or others.

My biggest expense to get these going is the time that I need to devote to creating the molds. Molds have many steps that take up a lot of time and energy. While I am creating them I am unable to seek out and fulfill custom orders. By covering basic expenses like studio rent, I will be able to focus on getting molds made so I can start creating the new line.

I need some new materials such as special thermal shock resistant clay for things like pizza stones and mold making quality plaster, which strangely enough is not available to me locally.

I am also desperately in need of more storage space as my shelves are full and the floor is now covered with various molds and drying projects. A few new shelving units would create space to store both my molds and new work as it dries.


All of this can be covered in the $3,000 and anything raised over that will go towards things like boxes for shipping as I will need different shapes than what I have used in the past, product labels, and maybe even some advertizing.

Be a part of the process

Once I make the molds they will be done and won't change much. Since I have only made a few so far you have a chance to be a part of their creation. By pre-ordering and supporting my efforts to start a production line I will inscribe the bottom of your piece with a note or little drawing of your choice. Also, to show my appreciation for your support you will receive a better price when you pre-order then you would in the future.

If you have an idea of something I should create and I feel it will work with the line, I will happily put your idea into production. This is a unique opportunity to truly be involved in the creation of this new line of work. You will get a custom experience, without the custom price.

Not interested in Pre-ordering?

That's totally cool. There are plenty of other ways to support my effort to make my work more accessible. The simplest is to share this campaign with your friends and family. You can always purchase something that is already in existence from my etsy shop or go for one of the custom project perks here. If you would like to see more of my custom work feel free to check out my page and read reviews here.

No matter what you do, if you have made it this far, Thank You for reading.


^ Aren't these guys ^ adorable?
story_txt:
Now you can have your own animal house, without all the mess. 
Do you love animals and want your home to reflect your love? Does your dog need a food dish that looks like him and do you wish you had a cake stand that looked like a big squishy kitty? If so, I have plans for a sweet new home decor and pet product line that will suit all your needs. Each piece is made with intricate details and high quality materials making it a precious piece of art. The offbeat style is unique while the practical designs are durable enough to be used and enjoyed daily. With your help I can begin to create the work using a streamlined process that will make it available at an extremely affordable price range.
But first, I need help spreading the word about my campaign, so before I tell you about my work let me offer you a chance to win your own super small snail friend.To win him, simply share this campaign as a public post on social media as well as directly with any friends you think might like it. Then go to my page and let me know that you did, so I can give you credit. Once you learn about my story, if you decide you want to pre-order, it will count as a second chance towards winning this teeny tiny snail. Over to the right you can check out the specific perks that are 
available for pre-order. They are structured by price, size, and 
fall into three product lines:
The Furry Friends line will be composed of products ranging from 
little dishes and cheese boards for humans to pet food dishes of various
 shapes and sizes for our furry friends to enjoy. The focus will be on 
house hold pets such as mice, dogs, cats, and rabbits. If you would like
 to see your favorite animal friends incorporated into a functional 
ceramic product then this is the line for you!
The Artfully Spiritual line was inspired by many of the lovely 
ladies I met through an online business class called B-School. I have 
always been interested in religion and spirituality and one of my first 
clay projects was a rather large Ganesha covered in henna patterns (not 
the one pictured). When I saw my fellow B-Schoolers sharing images of 
their crystal grids I was so intrigued by them and got to researching. I
 knew crystal grids could be so much more amazing if they were combined 
with animals and am really excited to offer this. I already have a mold 
for a sea turtle flower of life grid and am planing on developing a cat 
grid that incorporates the phases of the moon. I want  to combine the 
Sir Yantra with an animal but haven't settled on which one yet. If you 
have an idea, than this is the line for you. I would also like to create
 relief sculptures of various religious figures that could hang on the 
wall. 
The Adirondack Friends Line will focus around the animals of the 
Adirondacks. I am creating this line to reflect the area I live in. It 
will have products ranging from chipmunk coasters, to loon trivets, and 
snapping turtle pizza stones. The image above is of an early version of 
the pizza stone. The final product will be similar but not exactly the 
same. Mostly, it will be a bit more detailed in the texture of its 
shell. I have done extensive research into the technical aspects of 
pizza stones and am really excited to get started on this.  (Hint: the 
clay is sparkly!)And now, let me tell you a bit more about what you will be helping to create and why I need your help:My work combines art, animals, and every day objects in a way that amuses people, helps them to pause for a moment in their busy day, and maybe disturbs them a little bit. Since 2013 I have been lucky enough to work creatively everyday to help bring art into peoples' lives. I've tested many different product lines and strategies for turning my creative endeavors into products that people love. After much trial and error I realized that I and my work are best suited for custom designs. 
I love working one on one with clients but with the way I work, I need to charge at least $500, if not more, for the highly involved pieces I create. My clients love my work but it has left me wishing I could also produce pieces at a lower price point.Not everyone is able or wants to spend hundreds of dollars on art and the customers who helped to build my business in the first place can no longer afford my work. I feel very strongly that everyone deserves and needs to experience art in their life, so I have been searching for a way to make my work more affordable. I looked into licensing my designs and having them produced but the start up costs are in the thousands, most ceramic production is done overseas, and a minimum order of 1,000 units per design is required. 
  Why not simplify?
At first I tried to create simpler work but even with simpler designs, it was still labor intensive and customers weren't really interested in the dumbed down versions of my work. Then after making a plaster mold for a client's project I realized that if I work with certain shapes, I can use plaster molds to preserve my detailed style while greatly reducing the labor. With the reduction of labor, I can pass on lower prices to my customers. Having a lower priced mold made line will allow people who aren't looking for a custom order to experience art in their everyday life.In order to start a small scale production line I need financial help to cover a few things. I could keep going at my current pace, creating a few molds whenever I can squeeze them in, but that would make putting out a cohesive product line, with lots of options for you to choose from, next to impossible. With your help I can devote enough time to each line so that they will be done in time to be given as Christmas gifts to yourself or others.My biggest expense to get these going is the time that I need to devote to creating the molds. Molds have many steps that take up a lot of time and energy. While I am creating them I am unable to seek out and fulfill custom orders. By covering basic expenses like studio rent, I will be able to focus on getting molds made so I can start creating the new line. I need some new materials such as special thermal shock resistant clay for things like pizza stones and mold making quality plaster, which strangely enough is not available to me locally. I am also desperately in need of more storage space as my shelves are full and the floor is now covered with various molds and drying projects. A few new shelving units would create space to store both my molds and new work as it dries.
All of this can be covered in the $3,000 and anything raised over that will go towards things like boxes for shipping as I will need different shapes than what I have used in the past, product labels, and maybe even some advertizing.
  Be a part of the process
Once I make the molds they will be done and won't change much. Since I have only made a few so far you have a chance to be a part of their creation. By pre-ordering and supporting my efforts to start a production line I will inscribe the bottom of your piece with a note or little drawing of your choice. Also, to show my appreciation for your support you will receive a better price when you pre-order then you would in the future. If you have an idea of something I should create and I feel it will work with the line, I will happily put your idea into production. This is a unique opportunity to truly be involved in the creation of this new line of work. You will get a custom experience, without the custom price.
  Not interested in Pre-ordering?
That's totally cool. There are plenty of other ways to support my effort to make my work more accessible. The simplest is to share this campaign with your friends and family. You can always purchase something that is already in existence from my etsy shop or go for one of the custom project perks here. If you would like to see more of my custom work feel free to check out my page and read reviews here.No matter what you do, if you have made it this far, Thank You for reading.
^ Aren't these guys ^ adorable?

story:
Dear Friends,

We are a group of artists based in New York. We produce various programs in hopes of establishing a channel of communication with North Koreans through art.

Today, we would like to invite you to a participatory project, “Say a Word to North Korea.” The project is about collecting and exhibiting words of peace from supporters like you and delivering these messages to North Koreans.

Please submit a word of peace along with your donation. We will print your word on a 4” x 5” postcard for display in our upcoming exhibition, KOREA, which will take place at the Jorgensen Gallery at the University Connecticut, Storrs, from September 30 to December 11, 2015.

We hope to convey our wish for the unification of Korea through this exhibition of North and South Korean arts that have developed so differently over the last 70 years. At the same time, we seek to rebalance contemporary art, which has become increasingly stylized and homogenous. With the hope of contributing to peace in East Asia and building a peaceful relationship between the United States and North Korea, we are organizing the exhibition as a ground for communication, in which your messages of peace correspond with the group of works by North and South Korean artists.

Once you make your donation of $25 or more, we will reach out to you by email, asking for your word of peace. You can also send your word of peace to hhan@kafny.org by clicking the "contact" button above. Your contribution will be used to produce numerous arts programs to help widen communication with North Koreans. One of our main programs is to invite North Korean artists to New York for the exhibition this fall, and we will give them the postcards containing your word of peace as gifts. We also plan to organize international exhibitions that will include North Korean art in the upcoming years.

We will mail an additional gift to those who contribute more than $50. Your donations are tax-deductible, as the law permits. We sincerely believe that your word of peace is the beginning of communication and the first step toward building peace with North Koreans. We will not include hate or anti-peace speech in the project, as it conflicts with our goal of the project.

We would like to respectfully request that you consider participating in this meaningful project and support us in successfully managing the project.

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you in advance for your participation in this project for peace in East Asia. Please forward this video to your friends and spread the word about this project.

For more information about the Korea Art Forum, please visit http://kafny.org.

Thank you.

Henry Kim, Artist, with the Artist Advisory Committee of Korea Art Forum  


안녕하세요.

저흭들은 뉴욕에서 활동하는 미술가들입니다. 저희들은 힘을 합쳐 예술을 통해 이북과 단절된 소통의 길을 재개하는 프로그램들을 제작합니다.  

오늘 저희는 “Say a Word to North Korea” 참여 프로젝트에 여러분을 초대합니다. 이 프로젝트는 여러분들이 이북주민들에게 전달하고 싶은 평화의 뜻을 수집하여 전시하는 행사입니다.

여러분들께서 위의 “contact” 보턴을 누르셔서 hhan@kafny.org 으로 평화적 염원의 말 한마디를 저희에게 보내주시면, 저희들은 여러분들의 단어들을 4 x 5 우편엽서에 인쇄하여 저희들의 기획전 “KOREA”의 일부로 선보일 계획입니다. 그 전시는  스토어에 있는 코네티컷 주립대학의 조르겐슨 갤러리 (Jorgensen Gallery at the University Connecticut, Storrs) 에서  9월 30일에 개최되어 12월 11일 까지 진행될 예정입니다.

저희는 지난 70년동안 아주 다르게 발전된 남북미술의 전시를 통하여 남북통일을 염원하고 한쪽으로 치우쳐가는 동시대 미술계의 균형을 되찾고자 합니다. 그리고 동북아시아와 북미간의 평화를 기원하는 마음에서 저희는 남북작가들의 작품과 여러분들의 평화메시지가 어우러진 소통의 장이 되는 전시를 마련하고자 합니다.

이북주민들에게 전달하고 싶은 평화의 메시지 한마디를 코멘트란에 적어 주시고 $25불 혹은 그 이상의 액수를 기부해 주시면, 저희는 여러분들의 기부금으로 예술을 통하여 이북주민들과 소통을 넓히는 여러가지 사업을 실행할 것입니다. 그 주요사업 중 하나는 이북작가들을 뉴욕으로 초대하여 그분들에게 여러분들의 메시지를 담은 엽서를 전달하는 것입니다. 그리고 향후 또 다른 전시들을 매년 기획하고 개최할 예정입니다.

$50불 이상 기부금을 주시는 분들은 평화의 메시지 전달 외에 부가적인 선물을 받으실 수 있습니다. 여러분의 기부금은 법에 따라 세금혜택을 받으실 수 있습니다.  여러분의 도움과 평화의 한 단어는 이미 소통의 시작이고 서로를 감싸는 첫걸음이라는 것을 진심으로 믿기에 저희는 반평화적이거나 혐오스런 발언은 프로젝트에 사용하지 않을 것임을 알려드립니다. 동북아시아의 평화유지와 더불어 세계평화에 기여하고자 하는 이 프로젝트에 여러분들의 많은 참여와 뜨거운 성원을 부탁드립니다.  

또한 이 프로젝트를 친구분들께 알려주셔서 많은 분들이 이 프로젝트에 참여할 수 있도록  도와주시기를 부탁드립니다.

코리아 아트 포럼에 대하여 더 알고 싶으시면, http://kafny.org 을 방문하시면 됩니다.

감사합니다.

화가 김종헌과 코리아 아트 포럼 작가 자문위원회 일동

story:
Short Summary

We have a huge opportunity to get our adorable AKC Dog Stamps into a larger market! But I need to have about 20 more sets of stamps ready to go! This $6500 covers all of the prep, packaging, costs.

But we have some really cool items as thank you perks for helping us!! Big discounts on the stamp sets, and more!! 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down:

  • We are going to be spending the funds to get plates make of the 20 new designs that I will be hand drawing. I currently have more than twelve sets of these style stamps on my website. 
  • It will also cover the packaging and supplies. We are going to want your feedback! What breeds should I launch - I already have a list for the first 15 of the new sets, but i am going to open it up to my indiegogo fans to help with the last 5! 
  • I will be posting the dog breeds on an update so we can share which ones will be created.  

The Dog Breeds I will be drawing

  •  RETRIEVERS (LABRADOR)
  • GERMAN SHEPHERDS
  • RETRIEVERS (GOLDEN)
  • BULLDOGS
  • BEAGLES
  • POODLES
  • BOXERS
  • DACHSHUNDS
  • SIBERIAN HUSKIES
  • GREAT DANES
  • CHIHUAHUAS
  • BORDER COLLIES
  • BASSET HOUNDS
  • SCOTTISH TERRIERS
  • MINIATURE PINSCHER

OPTIONS for the last 5

  • POMERANIAN
  • CHINESE CRESTED
  • IRISH WOLFHOUNDS
  • OLD ENGLISH SHEEPDOGS
  • RAT TERRIERS
  • PHARAOH HOUNDS
  • LABRADOODLE 
  • TIBETAN TERRIER 
  • JACK RUSSELL TERRIER 
  • Other -- I am very open to your ideas!


The Impact

  • This is huge, it is a large box store that is interested if we can get them more samples and ready to go breeds!! 

Risks & Challenges

  • They might not order them. I could jump all of the hoops and they still turn us down. But it would not be a total loss we offer our designs on Amazon and  a few other Scrapbook store locations. So they will still be available designs.
  • Challenges - TIME - They are hoping for a preview by January and a Launch of the stamps (if they pick us up) of March 2016!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out (facebook, twitter, periscope, etc) and make some noise about our campaign.

Samples of my designs & cards 

 


The video above was created by Maria one of my DT Members. It shows you how to you can use the stamps.
