Support our campaign by following us on Facebook @RobertWeissCeramics Use Indiegogo's share tools to help us get the word out!

story:
PLACE FINE ART IN HOSPITALS OR OTHER MEDICAL VENUES IN HONOR OF/IN MEMORY OF YOUR LOVED ONE OR YOUR AREA OF MEDICAL INTEREST

WHY ART FOR MEDICAL VENUES?

Every one of us has been impacted by illness and the need to heal. Whether it's yourself, family, partners, friends, mentors, coworkers... and let us not forget, those who witness illness daily and do the healing... doctors, nurses, paramedics, counselors, clergy.

Research has empirically demonstrated that exposure to fine art in medical settings lowers heart rates, stabilizes vital signs, strengthens motor and neurological skills, enhances memory, speeds healing, shortens hospital stays, increases mobility, strengthens appetite, decreases symptoms, reduces anxiety, improves mood, lowers the use of painkillers/tranquilizers/substances, heals trauma, reduces stress, increases joy, improves quality of life, and alleviates the burden of chronic disease. 

Doctors and medical professionals also benefit, with less burnout and ptsd from the daily witnessing of pain, distress,trauma and death.

Do this in honor of or in memory of a loved one, a colleague, a group, or a medical cause... or simply to make the world a more healing place! See naming and placement opportunities in Perks section!

On the Undulation of Trees - Copyright 2015 Tracy Ellyn. All Rights Reserved.


WHY US?

1. I have 30+ years experience as an award-winning, published artist and designer in Miami, New York, Europe, India and Hong Kong. Click here for main website. 

 

2. I have exhibited at The Louvre Museum, Paris, SCOPE/Art Basel, Wynwood Miami, and many more. I was selected as one of seven of "The Top American Artists in the Art for Healing Genre" by American Arts and Medicine Blog. Click here for my fine art website.


3. I am Founder and Director of The Zen Tov Project for Healing Through the Arts, which you can Read About Here... and Watch a Video About Here.


In short, I am dedicated to the healing power of the arts.

Enough about me... Now about YOU!


WHY YOU?

Because we have all been impacted, and as a simple and beautiful act of tikkun olam, you can make the world a more healing place. 


WHY NOW? 

  1. To quote Hillel:  
2. I have a vision issue, and I want to be sure to culminate my lifelong idea while I still see clearly. (I do get treated at Bascom Palmer, #1 eye hospital in the world, and one of the medical venues to whom I plan to contribute a series. You see how this project works? Give back, pay forward, inspire others.)

3. We are already planning! We are hoping to install my art pieces at Baptist Health Systems, UM Miller/Jackson Memorial, Sylvester Cancer Center, Bascom Palmer, M.D. Anderson Cancer Center, Moffitt Cancer Center, Harvard/Mass General, Johns Hopkins, private medical offices, and more. 

We are also planning a tile installation at University of Washington for survivors of sexual assault, and a wall mural in Manhattan in memory of a public figure (name to be announced upon completion).

What You Get

You get the opportunity at various levels to select the medical venue of your choice, the artwork(s) of your choice from my website, and to donate an entire piece or series in honor of or in memory of a loved one, a colleague, a group, or a medical cause... and more. See Perks section.

*Please consider getting together a group of family members, friends, colleagues, coworkers, or interested parties for a particular medical cause or venue, in order to pay for a Perk of higher value, allowing you to donate a piece or series that is meaningful to the group. Don't forget to ask your boss, a company or foundation to match your funds and get an even higher Perk. Send in one lump sum payment when you do this.


You also get a tax deduction (where applicable) letter, regular updates and photos, a full-color downloadable art catalog of the completed project, and most of all, a grateful heart for giving back and paying it forward.

What We Need 

Following are the costs of the project:

  • FRAMING - Most of the funds will go here
  • EMBEDDING OF LARGER PIECES INTO ARCHIVAL METAL - Most of the funds will go here
  • Engraved signage plaques for dedications
  • Art/photo/tech supplies
  • Printing of gallery size fine art photography
  • Secure hanging materials
  • Security features at hanging site
  • Labor costs and meals for installation assistants
  • Catalogs and announcements
  • Transportation and communications
  • Packing, shipping and insurance: US and overseas
  • Copyright filings/professional costs

Funds will be used as planned above, even if we do not reach our goal. We expect to reach our goal and continue our work in more healing venues across the US and elsewhere, including other artists that we work with after the initial monetary goal is met.


The Impact

The impact of the dreaded white wall in a healing venue cannot be overstated. Research demonstrates heightened anxiety, depression, lack of energy, low motivation, heightened awareness of pain, loss of hope, and more...

Whereas... The impact of fine art on walls in a healing venue is powerful, on both a medical and a soul level.


Orchid Garden Refuah - "After the Pain, There Is Joy" - Japanese translation. Copyright Tracy Ellyn. All Rights Reserved.


The Risks 

We will make every effort to match your request for facility, but some facility requests may not be able to be matched precisely. Here are a few examples:

  • Some hospitals only display a specific kind of art; for example, 19th century
  • Some medical facilities only accept artwork from those who were patients there
  • Children's hospitals, rehabs, elderly centers sometimes do not accept artwork containing frames or metal edges
  • Sometimes, politics! Ugggh.
We will, however, make an alternative match keeping your interest group at heart, and with your knowledge. (An interest group would be, for example, neurology, chemo center, Crohn's and Colitis, lung cancer, adolescent psychiatry, etc., but at a different location if your first choice is not available).


Don't Forget!

  1. Make your secured payment here on Indiegogo.
  2. Make your artwork selection by visiting www.tracyellyn-recentworks.com
  3. Leave all your selection information and email on the Contact page on the www.tracyellyn-recentworks.com website. Your email is important! We will need to communicate about your selection, dedication verbiage, updates, tax letter, your free downloadable art catalog which will be available at end of campaign, and more.


Other Ways You Can Help
  • Please get the word out by emailing this campaign to everyone you know!
  • Spread the word on all your social media!
  • Use the quick Indiegogo share tools!
  • Grateful if you will put us in touch with your direct contacts! (at hospitals, medical offices, treatment facilities, chemo rooms, universities/medical schools, research centers, counseling centers, clergy offices, and similar)

And that's all there is to it! 

How can we ever thank you? Consider yourself hugged!

story:
EQUINOX

This is an adult coloring book that tells stories.  Equinox is a word that means a balance of opposites: day and night, sun and moon, waking and dreaming. Equinox is a coloring book that is set in a magical and dreamlike world filled with tree castles, flying pigs, and eggs that hatch candles.  It is a collection of 52 full-page illustrations, sorted into four chapters: Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter.  Equinox will take you on a meditative journey through a storybook world of fantasy and dreams.

The Book

EQUINOX, A Coloring Book
8.5 x 11", paperback, color glossy cover (below)
Approx. 120 pages, printed one-side-only on quality paper
52 illustrations, plus title pages

All the drawings in this book are completely hand-drawn with a pencil and pen, including all lettering and titles.  No computers were used except to scan them for publication.  I started drawing in July of last year, and worked almost every day, and now they are all done.  They have been scanned and prepped for publication.  I just need to lay out the book and create a back cover and the chapter titles.  This will be done during the Indiegogo campaign, so I should be able to send it to the printer shortly after this campaign ends.  This book will definitely be printed and delivered by September, but I hope to have it done by July.

The $4,300 in funds raised will enable me to have 1,000 copies of the book printed and shipped to me from my fine art book printer.  This is my third book, and my second book funded through Indiegogo, so you can rest assured that I will complete this project.  My first book, Capital Offenses, was named one of the Best Books of 2014 by Publisher's Weekly.

The Artist

I have been a working artist for over 35 years.  My fine art has been exhibited in over 70 museums and galleries throughout the US and  across Europe.  I have also done many book illustrations, magazines, and gaming products, most notably Heresy, Kingdom Come by Last Unicorn Games, and Mythos and Mythos, Dreamlands by Chaosium.

More images from the book in the Gallery above!

I had a lot of fun drawing these images, and I hope you will help me make this book a reality.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Dear All,

I wish to get your interest in an internet internet art project which already exists and has great development prospects. Details are presented below. First I describe what talent.pl is and this is followed by my proposal. Than you in advance for considering your financial and technical support. It is a fantastic way of promoting art and artists worldwide! It is a new idea of presenting arts – not by infos but by introducing artists and their works, letting all to admire what can be done by men and women from all the globe. Talent.pl is very wide considering all forms of arts that can be seen there. Talent.pl logo is in polish and is a trademark but exists for now also in English and French. I love art and I am certain that for every one of us this project will make life more beautiful.


Should you become interested, I will present the further detailed steps.

Your help will promote a way of life more distinguish and more interesting.

Instead of funds I am looking for every other way of promoting this project. I am looking for ideas, technical help and promotion of talent.pl.

I am PhD and LL. M. of law at Paris II Panthéon-Assas and advocate (graduated from the Warsaw University) specialized in company and copyright laws. I work as a lawyer and I manage talent.pl.

What is talent.pl?


Talent.pl is the first internet social portal in Poland that provides an opportunity for talented people in 13 artistic categories (music and singing; dance; film and animation; acting; photography; painting, drawing, graphics; sculpture; artistic handicraft; industrial design; poetry and prose; visage; architecture; modelling) to present themselves to all internet users in the form of their audio, video works, photographs or audio-video. Talent.pl includes over 50  sub-categories covering the above artistic categories. Talent.pl includes as many as over 54,000 unique works by the users! 

Talent.pl provides an opportunity for private individuals and companies to view and search for talented people, e.g. to hire them at a later time, to extend patronage above their talent in various forms offered by the portal or just to admire their skills. Talent.pl is addressed both at younger and more senior internet uses who look for valuable forms of entertainment, who love various forms of art and who are keen to support talented people and develop. The project is oriented on people who are involved in art professionally or as amateurs, on art lovers and those who look for values in life. 


The fanpage of talent.pl at Facebook (facebook.com/talentpl) is very popular (almost 50 000 likes) with differentiated content so that both young and more mature users can find something for themselves.

The talentpl.tv site presents all artworks published on talent.pl.

The English version of talent.pl (talentpl.com, talent-world.com) and the French version (lestalents.fr lestalents.com) attract foreign users to the portal.

Right now, talent.pl is among the most popular artistic portals in Poland.

Media patronage over talent.pl has been extended e.g. by: TVP 1, TVP 2, TVP INFO, TVP POLONIA, TVP WARSZAWA, Jedynka Polskie Radio, Radio dla Ciebie, ofeminin.pl, Warsaw School Film, Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw, Cracow School of Art and Fashion Design, The Higher School of Art and Design in Łódź, Deutsche Welle, Twoje Bielany biweekly, Extra Bemowo biweekly, Vistula University and Mediateka in Warsaw.



Development concept of talent.pl:

What I plan to do:

- the development of talent.pl is now affected in particular three portals for different reasons: pinterest.com (it is extremely simple, intuitive and accessible): it is easy to navigate, it is fast and modern; behance.net: very stable, clear and quite comprehensive; deviantart.com: nothing exciting about the site but the sales system is simple and well developed,

- talent.pl should be composed of four parts (it can be expanded afterwards but this will be the base):

1/ visual part / for viewing (focus on the work and artist and on artist promotion),

2/ social part (directly related to 1/): for communication with users and communication among users (subject to the finally approved concept, we will exactly define what will be permitted, e.g. contacts among users should trade in works is permitted) – 1/ and 2/ 17000 dollars,

3/artistic crowdfunding: practically non-existent in Poland but very much in demand – 5000 dollars,

4/ e-commerce: sale of works – I would start with “image” works (to be followed by e-commerce in other artistic categories, e.g. music: licences, transfer of economic copyright) and similarly to deviantart.com I would not trade in originals (at least not from the very beginning) but with copies – 3-4 options and 3 sizes (e.g. small, medium, large). I would develop the trade with a mobile application with which the phone can be approached to a wall to select a picture/photograph and place them on a wall determining sizes (e.g. the application of Dulux paints – you can change the colour of the wall and decide about all details). If we decide to go ahead with that, I have a well skilled person involved in e-commerce – 5000 dollars,

Apart from Polish, I would also use the following language versions: English, French, Russian, Spanish and Chinese.

Sources of revenues of talent.pl: e-commerce, advertising campaigns, announcements (people looking for specific artists to develop specific items), artistic patronage, golden accounts (here I would combine all payable options (not all but selectively) and make three options: 1 month, 3 months, 6 months). Additionally, I would also think about an automatic option of advertising campaigns at talent.pl but at a later stage.

I will be responsible for the media and development of talent.pl.

The promotion of the whole project – 8000 dollars.

All funds go the creation and promotion of the project. I do not get any funds of this. I will be pleased to answer all of your questions concerning funds.

Summary of things to do:

E-shop – sale of works

- The shop initially covering plastic arts and all categories ultimately

Auctions

- On-line art auctions like an auction house

- Mobile application

Portal development directions:

- Improvement of the portal graphic design + UX

- Commissions on agency services in sales of works

- Opening the portal in European markets

- Cooperation with art galleries

Potential additional directions

- Development of a sale strategy of industrial products (posters, photo wallpaper, pictures, etc.)

- Establishment of a sales team.

That would be fantastic to enjoy artworks from all around the world, to share tem, to make possible for artists to achieve their goals, to create new enormous things thank to you!

I estimate the costs of technical and promotional portal expansion at 35000 dollars.

24000 dollars will be used for costs: servers, 1 marketing PR employee, 1 trader, technical support, graphic support, 1 social media expert, accountancy, talent.pl premises for 1 year (before it will generate income necessary to its further development).

Talent.pl needs a new technical and promotional help to continue growing and be worldwide. Talent.pl will collect people interested in the arts worldwide. Talent.pl wants to become a multinational platform for artists and those who care about arts. Artists and their fans will have their favourite social place where they can meet and create!

If I will not achieve my fund goal all given funds will be invested in talent.pl.

Concerning unique perks there will be a hall of fame to thank you all, a unique type of account for life with free self-promotion, consultation for every important banner, being every time in the monthly newsletter, information about you on FB/talent.pl and your activities.

I want you to become a patron of the arts on and of talent.pl because it all happens thanks to you.

I am pleased to receive your ideas about being all the time on talent.pl as a patron of the arts. Please participate in giving you on talent.pl what you care about.

Concerning the concurrence there is mainly pinterest.com, behance.net and deviantart.com but talent.pl is something different, more specific so it has a special place on the net.

I do not offer many promotions on talent.pl because I don't want it to be a typic commercial portal, it must be interesting for its users. Please help me prepare the best artistic site ever :)

_____________________________________________________ 

Polish version:

Czym jest talent.pl?

Talent.pl to pierwszy w Polsce portal internetowy o charakterze społecznym umożliwiający osobom utalentowanym w 13 określonych kategoriach artystycznych (muzyka i śpiew; taniec; film i animacja; aktorstwo; fotografia; malarstwo, rysunek, grafika; rzeźba; rzemiosło artystyczne; wzornictwo przemysłowe; poezja i proza; wizaż; architektura; modeling) zaprezentowania się wszystkim użytkownikom internetu, w postaci stworzonych przez siebie dzieł audio, wideo, zdjęć lub audio-wideo. Talent.pl to ponad 50 podkategorii związanych z powyższymi kategoriami artystycznymi. Talent.pl to już ponad 54.000 unikalnych dzieł swoich użytkowników! 

Talent.pl umożliwia zarówno osobom prywatnym jak i firmom przeglądanie i wyszukiwanie utalentowanych osób np. w celu ich późniejszego zatrudnienia, objęcia w portalu "Mecenatu" nad ich talentem w różnych formach oferowanych przez portal, lub też wyłącznie zachwycania się ich umiejętnościami. Talent.pl skierowany jest zarówno do młodych jak i starszych internautów szukających wartościowych form rozrywki, kochających różne formy sztuki oraz nastawionych na wspieranie ludzi utalentowanych i rozwijanie się. Przedsięwzięcie kierowane jest do ludzi zajmujących się sztuką profesjonalnie bądź amatorsko, dla miłośników sztuki, oraz tych, którzy szukają wartości w życiu. 

Fanpage talent.pl na facebooku (facebook.com/talentpl) cieszy się ogromnym zainteresowaniem (prawie 50000 like’ów) i różnicuje treść, by i młodzi i dojrzalsi użytkownicy znaleźli coś dla siebie.

Strona talentpl.tv prezentuje wszystkie dzieła zamieszczane na talent.pl.

Wersja angielska talent.pl (talentpl.com, talent-world.com) i francuska (lestalents.fr lestalents.com) przysparza portalowi użytkowników zagranicznych.

Talent.pl na dzień dzisiejszy należy do najbardziej popularnych portali artystycznych w Polsce.

Nad talent.pl patronat medialny objęły w szczególności: TVP 1, TVP 2, TVP INFO, TVP POLONIA, TVP WARSZAWA, Jedynka Polskie Radio, Radio dla Ciebie, ofeminin.pl, Warszawska Szkoła Filmowa, ASP w Warszawie, Krakowskie Szkoły Artystyczne, Wyższa Szkoła Sztuki i Projektowania w Łodzi, Deutsche Welle, dwutygodnik Twoje Bielany,  dwutygodnik Extra Bemowo, Akademia Finansów i Biznesu, oraz Mediateka w Warszawie.

Koncepcja rozwoju talent.pl:

Co chcę zrobić:

- na rozwój talent.pl na dzień dzisiejszy wpływają dla mnie w szczególności 3 portale z różnych powodów: pinterest.com (jest niezwykle prosty, intuicyjny i dostępny): łatwo się po nim poruszać, jest szybki i nowoczesny; behance.net: bardzo stabilny, czytelny i dość kompleksowy; deviantart.com: strona moim zdaniem taka sobie ale system sprzedażowy prosty i rozbudowany,

- talent.pl powinien być złożony z 4 części (potem można rozbudowywać dalej ale to jest podstawa):

1/ część wizualna/ viewerowa (skupienie się na dziele i artyście oraz jego promocji),

2/ część społecznościowa (związana bezpośrednio z 1/): służąca do komunikacji z użytkownikami i komunikacji użytkowników ze sobą (tu w zależności od ostatecznie przyjętej koncepcji określimy szczegółowo co będzie dozwolone np. kontaktowanie się pomiędzy użytkownikami w razie wprowadzenie handlu dziełami sztuki/utworami),

3/crowdfunding artystyczny: praktycznie nieistniejący w Polsce a bardzo poszukiwany,

4/ e-commerce: sprzedaż dzieł i teraz, zacząłbym od dzieł „obrazowych” (potem się będzie e-commerce rozbudowywać o inne kategorie artystyczne, np. muzyka: licencje, przeniesienie autorskich praw majątkowych) i na wzór deviantart.com nie handlowałbym oryginałem (na pewno nie od razu) tylko kopią i dał z 3-4 opcje i 3 wielkości (np. mała, średnia, duża). Rozbudowałbym tu handel o aplikację mobilną, w której można sobie telefon przyłożyć do ściany i wybrać obraz/zdjęcie i układać je sobie na ścianie i wielkości ustalać (np. aplikacja farb dulux).

Pokusiłbym się o to by były poza polskim następujące wersje językowe: angielski, francuski, rosyjski, niemiecki, hiszpański i chiński.

Co do źródeł dochodów talent.pl: e-commerce, crowdfunding artysttyczny, kampanie reklamowe, ogłoszenia (jak ktoś szuka konkretnego artysty do zrobienia określonej rzeczy) i konta Premium Jak to wszystko by było pokusiłbym się o zrobienie zautomatyzowanej opcji kampanii reklamowej na talent.pl.

Podsumowując co trzeba zrobić:

- E-sklep - Sprzedaż dzieł
- Sklep obejmujący w pierwszym etapie prace plastyczne docelowo pozostałe kategorie

Aukcje:
- Aukcje sztuki on-line na zasadach domu aukcyjnego

- Aplikacja mobilna

Kierunki rozwoju portalu:
- Poprawa projektu graficznego portalu + UX
- Prowizyjność w pośrednictwie sprzedaży dzieł
- Uruchomienie portalu na rynkach europejskich
- Współpraca z galeriami sztuki


Wiktor Czeszejko-Sochacki (talent.pl)
story_txt:
Dear All,
I wish to get your interest in
an internet internet art project which already exists and has great development
prospects. Details are presented below. First I describe what talent.pl is and
this is followed by my proposal. Than you in advance for considering your
financial and technical support. It is a fantastic way of promoting art and
artists worldwide! It is a new idea of presenting arts – not by infos but by
introducing artists and their works, letting all to admire what can be done by
men and women from all the globe. Talent.pl is very wide considering all forms
of arts that can be seen there. Talent.pl logo is in polish and is a trademark
but exists for now also in English and French. I love art and I am certain that
for every one of us this project will make life more beautiful. 
Should you become interested,
I will present the further detailed steps. 
Your help will promote a way
of life more distinguish and more interesting.
Instead of funds I am looking
for every other way of promoting this project. I am looking for ideas,
technical help and promotion of talent.pl.
I am PhD and LL. M. of law at Paris
II Panthéon-Assas and advocate (graduated from the Warsaw University)
specialized in company and copyright laws. I work as a lawyer and I manage
talent.pl.

story:
Golf Coach and Putter Designer, Colin Howe works with the world's greatest Japanese swordsmith's to create these prestigious, unique putters, forged with the techniques of old and enriched with the history of Japan.

Aesthetics and skillfully engineered by the very men who continue to keep the integrity of the Japanese sword-making tradition alive, journey with us to help pioneer the most formidable precision putter in golf.

After completing design and prototype testing we need your help to create these work of art into reality, 75,000USD helps us bring the art of sword making back to life in the form of a putter, it also allows us to share the history of Japan's greatest Patriots.

For each contributor, we will offer the chance for you to enjoy the Putt Absolutte gifts and follow us as a fan. Please share with your friends in the journey we are embarking and welcome.

The Essence of the Company

The Japanese  character 士 translates as gentleman, warrior or samurai. To avoid too obvious a connotation, we added a second 士 into the logo 士士, set to the Japanese sun. We have come to recognise this with certain artistic license as “The Patriot”.


The character士士gives itself to the double ‘tt’ letters in the company name Putt Absolutte.


The Soul

Each beautifully designed limited edition putter has a unique identity with the name of one of 162 Japanese patriots engraved on the sole.

Each putter head is presented differently and reflects the belief of its Patriot with tastefully engraved elegance.

The Illustrations

The drawings by Alex Faichan are illustrations of the 162 Patriots, visually recreating the remarkable story of each.

It is important to Putt Absolutte that each unique putter invokes the Patriot soul to imbue class, honour and pride.

"Uesugi Kenshin, nickname was "Dragon of Echigo", to contrast with Takeda Shingen, the "Tiger of Kai".

Alex Faichan
Alex was born in Hong Kong and has been working in the CG industry for over 10 years.

He worked as a Matte Painter, Colorkey Artist, Storyboard Artist, and Illustrator at IMAGI ANIMATION STUDIOS

In 2011, he was a Comic Book Artist at UNICORN STUDIOS HK.

Now currently he is a freelance artist, Alex works on a number of projects including the 162 Patriots of Japan, illustrated for Putt Absolutte.


The Blessing

Brush writing, blessed and written by Head of the Shimane Shrine.

Perception is strong, sight is weak.

The tagline for the Company, by Swordsman, Miyamoto Musahi

story:
Short Summary

This is Horde of Cuteness! and I am J Everett Nichol, an illustrator and game designer with a passion for free culture and free software. My professional goal has been and still is the creation of gorgeous, comprehensive collections of art and game assets for anyone to use forever. I release my art under creative commons licenses or else into the public domain so there are few if any barriers to using them.

Utilising the support of my Patreon, one of the collections I created was a set of cute fantasy character icons I called the Questquest Icons. I want to expand that collection and create a full catalog of heroes and creatures for game designers and enthusiasts of things fantasy and things cute. With your help, we could create the largest single collection of free fantasy characters and creatures.

Ultimately, I'd like to create a large enough collection of art to fully illustrate a card game under development called Questquest. But why should I have all the fun? Let's make free art for everyone to use!


What We Need & What You Get

My Patreon has allowed me to create a number of free art collections, but its structure tends to favor smaller sets of works. I usually create four to six of a given collection and then move on to another project to keep my patrons interested and try out new ideas and styles. The Questquest characters began as a Patreon project; a project which I loved so much that I painted more freebies than paid illustrations, bringing the total at this point up to fourteen monsters.

That's why I'm turning to indiegogo. My patreon is perfect for creating small packs of art in many styles, but with IGG I can dig deeper into individual collections. If the preliminary funding is obtained from this campaign, I can eschew freelance for the time necessary to add an additional ten characters to the collection (2 heroes, 5 monsters, and 3 boss monsters chosen by the backers). Additional funding could see our little horde of cuties grow to a truly impressive size. All the characters will be released under a Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike 4.0 license, and will be made available as .pngs with transparent backgrounds, and will have include .kra or .xcf source files for editing the characters yourself. All new images will be 2000px by 2000px.

Backers will receive gifts for their contribution and will get to vote on which of three boss monsters are included in the collection. If the campaign is especially successful, additional boss monsters will reveal themselves. If they are defeated, they and five of their minions will be added to the collection. Also, wandering monsters will join the collection if certain goals are achieved to defeat them.

Risks & Challenges

A significant portion of the funding goes to supporting me while I take time away from freelance in order to paint all the characters. I'm guessing finishing the initial ten will take about a month. But another major portion of the funding will go into fulfilling the gifts and rewards due to backers of the campaign. So if the campaign is not fully funded, it is unlikely I will be able to fulfil physical rewards, though other rewards will be unaffected,

Apart from that, there are very few risks for this campaign, I love this collection and I would like to see it grow until there are dozens or hundreds of them. I am passionate about the project, and I do not foresee any difficulty in creating them or backer rewards should I achieve funding.

Wandering Monsters

Wandering Monsters are new monsters that have joined the Horde. If they're here, they're included in the collection in addition to the primary goal. Defeat a wandering monster together and a new monster shall appear to join the horde! The Phrase of Power is #hordeofcuteness.


Huge shoutout to my Patreon patrons who funded the original icons:

Clint Bellanger

Brandon Blackmoor

Andrew Montgomery Hurrell

Hercules Q Einstein

Zonk PJ Demonio Soriente

Hannes Aspåker

Akerraren

Dragonbox Brothers

Conway Scott Smith

story:
Our Mission

Are you someone who has a wonderful craft, skill, or passion that defines you? Maybe you sing, paint, take beautiful photos, or you're an excellent juggler, or whatever your trade may be, Nackly is the app for you. Haven't discovered your talent yet? No problem, Nackly is still the place for you! 

Our goal with Nackly is to bring you a social network that will allow you to showcase and share your talent and skills. Our mission is to build a streamlined platform that is dedicated to YOU and free of all "social noise." Nackly's platform will be specifically used for finding and sharing talents, skills, or creative crafts. We believe that Nackly could revolutionize the way people share material as well as express themselves online.

Our Impact

Our aim is to reach a wide audience and hopefully impact many lives by:

  1. Redefining what TALENT means - No matter how unique or obscure your talent, hobby, or craft is, we encourage you to share it with the rest of the world. (Whether you are the next SINGING SENSATION, THE GREATEST POET who ever lived, or a PROFESSIONAL LEGO BUILDER, bring your passions to Nackly!) 

  2. Helping you EASILY connect with others based on your PASSIONS- We want you to find others that share similar interests with you or people that you can admire and look to for motivation. Our platform would allow you to do this easily, starting with your friends.

  3. Transforming the "SOCIAL" in social media- Many young teens and adults have conformed to the idea of racking up likes and shares on social media based on selfies or images of social life. We want to take the spotlight off of social content and focus specifically on your skills and passions. We want you to pride  yourself in pursuing your interests!

  4. Allowing you to BUILD a repertoire- We encourage our users to share their passions and to build a brand for themselves off of this platform. Our ultimate goal is to allow others have access to your talents, whether they are fans, recruiters, or just admirers.


How Will We Use Your Funds?

We are asking for $16,000 of funding. About 65% of that will go to building the applications. This will include a version for IOS and Android.

The next 15% will go to covering taxes and Indiegogo Fees. The rest of the money will go to renting server space for a secure place to store all user information, app maintenance (making sure there are no bugs and solving any problems the users may have with the app), and minimal marketing costs. In addition, there might be a few additional development costs and unexpected costs, so we'd love any additional help or funding.

FAQ's

1. When will Nackly become available?
Development of the beta version of Nackly will begin once funds are received from our campaign. The estimated time frame is about 2 and a half months for development. From there we will launch the beta version to our backers, and use their feedback to develop the final version of Nackly.  
2. What if I don't know what to upload?  
If you don't know what to upload, you may not have discovered your passion. You can use Nackly to follow people who interest you and get inspired from others to create what you want as well as share content that you find interesting.
3. What will Nackly look like?
We know we haven't include pictures showing our user interface. This is because the design is under development and will be revealed in the beta version. Some things you can expect are a clean home screen, thorough search functionality, a personalized/customizable profile, and more. We will gather feedback on this design to create the best possible user experience. We are very keen on details!  
4. What type of things can I upload?
You will be able to upload audio, textual, video, and image content that is related to your talents or passions. We included these different forms of media in order to incorporate many different talents.   
5. How are you different than other social media apps?
 While other social media limits the way you express yourselves (i.e. Youtube only has videos), Nackly doesn't limit the method of expression. Our platform supports text, pictures, videos, and audio clips. Nackly has a large emphasis on sharing talent, which makes it stand out from its other competitors, and discourages media that solely has a social purpose.
6. Are there any data limits? 
 Initially there will be limits that we set. However we hope to expand, as we expand (and our resources grow) we hope to eradicate these limitations, and allow as much content in as many forms as possible!  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not in a position to donate to our campaign, there are still other ways to support. We would appreciate it if you could help get the word around by sharing this campaign through Facebook, Twitter, email, etc. We’d also appreciate if you have any feedback or comments you may have about Nackly! Don’t hesitate to reach out to us at nacklyco@gmail.com. 


Nackly is the work of Steven and Anushri. We're two college students with a passion to create a platform that allows people to fully express themselves and share it with the rest of the world. We are inspired by creativity, talent, and passion and hope that we can inspire others through this app. 

If you're passionate about your craft, please consider donating to our campaign. Help us make Nackly a reality by supporting us.

story:
What’s THE DEEP?!?

It's a lifelike jellyfish -- that's an art car ! She's a glowing, pulsing, bigger-than life jellyfish hooked to bamboo poles and a coral reef on wheels. THE DEEP premiered last year at Burning Man 2015, and this year we're bringing her back in a bolder and more beautiful version. 

THE DEEP is our party-to-go, community art and spacemaking project.  We're bringing glowing lights, bouncing tentacles, amplified dance music and very serious people together on impromptu dance floor wherever we roam. This year, each of THE DEEP's tentacles will be programmed to light up to music and to hug all who come near!

Most exciting, THE DEEP is the embodiment of our message to learn new skills, engage technology, and make art! Exercise your creativity in all it’s forms, embrace your inner artist, turn off the TV and MAKE something as unique as your and your friends. If you share our message, help us open hearts to arts as a sponsor of THE DEEP today!


OUR IMPACT

Our local arts community is growing fast and we need more absurd, oversized, bioluminescent, rough-and-tumble art! Every donation for THE DEEP is a vote of support for our community art and helps us share big fun with you and the public. 

2016 is year two of THE DEEP’s mission to keep our community creating, crafting, learning, collaborating and dancing. Last year our crew brought this project to Black Rock City (2015), Love Burn (2016), and Artomatic (2015).

Now we want THE DEEP to touch a lot more people over the next year, so we’re reinforcing our Jelly and our cart to bounce through the night at Black Rock City 2016, and Artomatic, Love Burn, and the D.C. Funk Parade in 2017.

If you’d like to see The Deep jamming at all these awesome community events, please show your support today.

Cutting Edge!

This year, our art cart features an experimental new neural sensor ring designed by team-genius Dave Ngheim.  So when you support  THE DEEP this year, you're also sponsoring the innovative work of one of our communities most energetic and talented programmers and inventors!


WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Funding and work space are our primary challenges.  Your gift will help us cover costs like:  

    • Design and build of glowing Tentacles that pneumatically move to hug special friends: $750
    • Critical repair and upgrades to new axle, spare parts, paint, and electrical system: $750
    • Decor rebuild to turn the vehicle chassis into a floating coral reef: $500
    • Transportation to Black Rock City 2016: $1250
    • Storage: $1250
    • Fees, fuels, incidentals: $500

Please help us make it happen!

  • Buy THE DEEP a drink! (Jellies must maintain a liquid environment)
  • Rent a Tentacle for 2016!
  • Sponsor THE DEEP’s travel!

We have lots more options and tentacled perks for generous donors. Thank you for your support!

Other ways you can help:

  • Viralize this Jelly! Helping us spread the word and raise more support is a huge help for THE DEEP!
  • Lend us your space as an in-kind gift! We are in great need of a small garage sized space in the D.C. -metro area to house and work on The Deep this summer season!
  • Invite THE DEEP to your events!
  • Just keep being the generous-hearted person you are in this moment!
Thank you for your support!

story:
What is Encaustic Collagraph? Check it out.

My name is Elise Wagner and I have been part of the Portland, Oregon art community for 30 years. I work in the ancient medium of encaustic, the oldest known binder, which combines beeswax, resin and pigment. Collagraph printing is a 20th century method in which a rigid printing plate is created using various textured, stenciled “collage” materials such as beeswax, string, sandpaper, acrylic medium, textiles, bubble wrap or leaves (and almost anything else you can imagine) can all be used in creating a collagraph.  The plate is then inked and pressed on to the paper with a rolling pin, or with the great force of an etching press.

Back in 2003, while experimenting, I came up with a way to combine the two art forms by applying the texture of white encaustic paint (my very own brand... eponymously named "Wagner Encaustic Collagraph White") in place of collage material onto a plexiglas printing plate then running it through a press and pulling a print from it. 

The adherent and moisture resistant properties common in encaustic, along with its overall flexibility, make it an ideal printmaking material. 

Printing from the textures of my white pigmented wax with non-toxic soy and honey based Akua Intaglio inks makes the perfect marriage of materials!

Since developing this unique and fun technique, which has come to be known as Encaustic Collagraph, I have absolutely loved teaching, presenting and demonstrating it to other artists. Artists have come to my Portland studio from as far away as Tasmania, Holland, Singapore, Australia and Calgary in addition to states in the US as diverse as New York and Alabama to learn this exciting technique and experience its many elements of surprise. 

I have also been invited and have taught at educational institutions and printmaking ateliers throughout the U.S. and Canada from New York, to Alberta.

Over the years since its development, Encaustic Collagraph, has been written about and photographed in various books, blogs and articles crediting me for its creation, and bringing more attention and interest to the technique. 

I continue teaching classes in my studio to novices, printmakers and established artists – and my work is shown in galleries in Seattle and Portland. It is also included in private and corporate collections across the US. 

The SGCI (Southern Graphics Council International) Conference Flux: Portland will be my first major opportunity for international exposure, and provides a uniquely multi-faceted opportunity to share my printmaking process, as well as marketing handmade Wagner Encaustic Collagraph White paint product, my class offerings, and my work as an artist.

        

Why I need your help 

This unique technique, that combines the ancient 2000 year old process of encaustic painting with the mid 20th century art of collagraph will be demonstrated at the Southern Graphics Council International Conference (SGCI) Flux: Portland. This is the largest printmaking conference in the world, attended by artists, educators and art collectors from near and far. 

I have been honored to have received grants in the past, but, more importantly, I have been fortunate to have built a support network comprised of students, collectors and friends who have all watched and been part of my journey.

I wanted to use Indiegogo as a broader based appeal that would be able to reach beyond my current sphere to include those that only a crowdfunding platform could engender.

Your contributions will go towards conference participation fees and putting together a great and memorable presentation and exhibit. 

Additional funds will go towards photography, design, the production of informational videos and webinars that will be available on my website in order to give interested artists a feel for what Encaustic Collagraph is all about. I also hand formulate and package Wagner Encaustic Collagraph White paint for my workshop students, I would love to be able to produce this in large enough quantities to make it available to everyone.

I have chosen a low fundraising goal, however, the more I receive the more I will be able to subsidize teaching the process in my workshops for those in need and to spread the technique of Encaustic Collagraph so people everywhere can experience the joy, magic and surprise of pulling prints. 

I am offering a series of perks that will give you the opportunity to share in this adventure of artistic expression. As the world gets smaller and smaller with advances in communications as well as the need for a creative outlets grows among society in general, I look forward to knowing others can learn this process regardless of where in the world they are. 

Your contribution will be invaluable towards bringing Encaustic Collagraph to artists around the world by helping fund a website that will offer online courses and access to a specially formulated product designed for the technique. The only thing that is standing between me and sharing this technique is adequate funding.

Our world has become more and more fast paced, often resulting in our own creative outlets being compromised. Your contribution is vital towards keeping the dreams that are born of artistic expression alive – allowing me to bring creativity to those who seek something fun, exciting and new to escape the ruts we all find ourselves in when we fail to stop and appreciate our hidden talents. 

What they're saying...
My twenty year history as a teacher has inspired many people from all learning levels, many of whom have gone on to pursue their art seriously. Here a few student testimonials.

“If you are interested in creative workshops that are chock full of technical information, yet immensely enjoyable, I urge you to look into taking one with Elise Wagner. My daughter and I enjoyed a week long program in Red Deer,Alberta. I have since travelled twice to Oregon for a "Wagnerica fix"! Elise is a fine art professional who also has a gift for sharing her passion.” –Carole Lulham, Calgary, Canada

"My very first exposure to learning encaustic was at a weekend workshop with Elise Wagner. I really lucked out. From the minute I walked into her studio, I knew I was in great hands. Her skill and knowledge with the materials and process, her excitement about sharing them, and brilliant artistic practice were all inspiring. Since then I have developed my own style and just had my first major show on the east coast. I also learned about encaustic collagraph with Elise and Master Printmaker Jane Pagliarulo and that was also life changing." 
-Ann Mavor, Portland, OR
"I enjoyed learning to make encaustic collagraph plates in Elise's workshop. She is professional and knowledgeable. The paper released beautifully from the plate. This method is a great tool to add to any printmakers toolbox...and it allows for a wide variety and subtlety of expressive mark making." -Christine Aaron, Larchmont, NY

Survival Skills Needed

Choosing the life of an artist was not an easy one, but the twists and turns along the path have been rewarding to me in many ways. 

Over the years, with each risk I've taken, I have trusted and relied upon my instincts and abilities to be resourceful in overcoming every hurdle and breaking through to new understandings of my art and myself.

As a result, my means of survival has by necessity come to be a combination of three income streams: teaching workshops, being an Airbnb host (sometimes for my students traveling from far away places) and selling my artwork through annual exhibitions and the galleries that represent me.

Along the journey I have done everything I can think of, and have made many sacrifices, to continue my development as an artist. As a result of opening my once private studio and home to the public in an effort to stay financially afloat and survive as an artist, I found new opportunities continued to present themselves. 

I often wake up in the morning filled with new ideas for my art, and then develop ways of teaching others new techniques that incorporate those ideas. It's about sharing the love!  I have been happy to do so and have received only positive results and reactions.

Over the years, I have inspired others and garnered much support, advice and admiration for my survival skills from friends, colleagues, collectors and students. This has greatly helped and inspired me to stay on the path.

I have learned to be resourceful... bartering my artwork for studio upgrades, graphic design, art supplies, website optimization and even dental work; things that are necessary and often outside of my skill set or beyond my financial means. 

In setting out to solve the many challenges and hurdles involved with executing the SGCI: Flux Portland project, I intend to tap into my collection of recent artwork, to create a series of campaign perks for your enjoyment.

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that contributing to this project may not be possible for you at this time. However, there are many other cost free ways that you can help make a difference. If you have taken a class in Encaustic Collagraph, share your experience of what you learned. Tell your friends about what you made, how fun this is as a technique and the chance creative surprise that comes with pulling prints. I would like to hear from you!
story_txt:
What is Encaustic Collagraph? Check it out.
 

My name is
Elise Wagner and I have been part of the Portland, Oregon art community for 30
years. I work in the ancient medium of encaustic, the oldest known binder,
which combines beeswax, resin and pigment. Collagraph printing is a 20th century method in which a rigid printing plate is created using various
textured, stenciled “collage” materials such as beeswax, string, sandpaper, acrylic medium, textiles, bubble wrap or leaves (and almost anything else you can imagine) can all be used in creating a collagraph.  The plate is then inked and pressed on to
the paper with a rolling pin, or with the great force of an etching press.


Back in 2003, while experimenting, I came up with a way to combine the two art forms by applying the texture of white encaustic paint (my very own brand... eponymously named "Wagner Encaustic Collagraph White") in place of collage material onto a plexiglas printing plate then
running it through a press and pulling a print from it. 
The adherent and
moisture resistant properties common in encaustic, along with its overall
flexibility, make it an ideal printmaking material. 






Printing from the textures of my white pigmented wax with non-toxic soy and honey based Akua Intaglio inks makes the perfect marriage of materials!


Since
developing this unique and fun technique, which has come to be known as
Encaustic Collagraph, I have absolutely loved teaching, presenting and
demonstrating it to other artists. Artists have come to my Portland studio from
as far away as Tasmania, Holland, Singapore, Australia and Calgary in addition
to states in the US as diverse as New York and Alabama to learn this exciting
technique and experience its many elements of surprise. 



I have also been
invited and have taught at educational institutions and printmaking ateliers
throughout the U.S. and Canada from New York, to Alberta.



Over the years
since its development, Encaustic Collagraph, has been written about and
photographed in various books, blogs and articles crediting me for its creation, and bringing
more attention and interest to the technique. 




I continue teaching classes in my studio to
novices, printmakers and established artists – and my work is shown in galleries
in Seattle and Portland. It is also included in private and corporate
collections across the US. 



The SGCI (Southern Graphics Council International) Conference Flux: Portland will be my first major opportunity for
international exposure, and provides a uniquely multi-faceted opportunity to
share my printmaking process, as well as marketing handmade Wagner Encaustic Collagraph White paint
product, my class offerings, and my work as an artist.
        
Why I need your help 
This unique technique,
that combines the ancient 2000 year old process of encaustic painting with the
mid 20th century art of collagraph will be demonstrated at the Southern
Graphics Council International Conference (SGCI) Flux: Portland. This is the
largest printmaking conference in the world, attended by artists, educators and
art collectors from near and far. 


I have been honored to have received grants in the past, but, more importantly, I have been fortunate to have built a support network comprised of students, collectors and friends who have all watched and been part of my journey. 
I wanted to use Indiegogo as a broader based appeal that would be able to reach beyond my current sphere to include those that only a crowdfunding platform could engender.

Your contributions will go towards conference participation fees and putting together a great and memorable presentation and exhibit. 
Additional funds will go towards photography, design, the production of informational videos and webinars that will be available on my website in order to give interested artists a feel for what Encaustic Collagraph is all about. I also hand formulate and package Wagner Encaustic Collagraph White paint for my workshop students, I would love to be able to produce this in large enough quantities to make it available to everyone.
I have chosen a low
fundraising goal, however, the more I receive the more I will be able to
subsidize teaching the process in my workshops for those in need and to spread
the technique of Encaustic Collagraph so people everywhere can experience the
joy, magic and surprise of pulling prints. 
I am offering a series
of perks that will give you the opportunity to share in this adventure of artistic
expression. As the world gets smaller and smaller with advances in
communications as well as the need for a creative outlets grows among society
in general, I look forward to knowing others can learn this process regardless
of where in the world they are. 
Your contribution will be invaluable towards bringing Encaustic Collagraph to artists around the world by helping fund a website that will offer online courses and access to a specially formulated product designed for the technique. The only thing that is standing between me and sharing this technique is adequate funding.
Our world has become more and more fast paced, often resulting in our own creative outlets being compromised. Your contribution is vital towards keeping the dreams that are born of artistic expression alive – allowing me to bring creativity to those who seek something fun, exciting and new to escape the ruts we all find ourselves in when we fail to stop and appreciate our hidden talents. 





What they're saying...My twenty year history as a teacher has inspired many people from all learning levels, many of whom have gone on to pursue their art seriously. Here a few student testimonials.


“If you are interested in creative workshops that are chock
full of technical information, yet immensely enjoyable, I urge you to look into
taking one with Elise Wagner. My daughter and I enjoyed a week long program in
Red Deer,Alberta. I have since travelled twice to Oregon for a "Wagnerica
fix"! Elise is a fine art professional who also has a gift for sharing her
passion.” –Carole Lulham,
Calgary, Canada


"My very first exposure to learning encaustic was at a weekend workshop with Elise Wagner. I really lucked out. From the minute I walked into her studio, I knew I was in great hands. Her skill and knowledge with the materials and process, her excitement about sharing them, and brilliant artistic practice were all inspiring. Since then I have developed my own style and just had my first major show on the east coast. I also learned about encaustic collagraph with Elise and Master Printmaker Jane Pagliarulo and that was also life changing." -Ann Mavor, Portland, OR

"I enjoyed learning to make encaustic collagraph plates in Elise's workshop. She is professional and knowledgeable. The paper released beautifully from the plate. This method is a great tool to add to any printmakers toolbox...and it allows for a wide variety and subtlety of expressive mark making." -Christine Aaron, Larchmont, NY


Survival Skills Needed

Choosing the life of an artist was not an easy one, but the twists and turns along the path have been rewarding to me in many ways.

As a result, my means of survival has by necessity come to be a combination of three income streams: teaching workshops, being an Airbnb host (sometimes for my students traveling from far away places) and selling my artwork through annual exhibitions and the galleries that represent me.
Along the journey I have done everything I can think of, and have made many sacrifices, to continue my development as an artist. As a result of opening my once private studio and home to the public in an effort to stay financially afloat and survive as an artist, I found new opportunities continued to present themselves.

story:
My America

Being Human

“Before you are a race or religion, you are a human being.” -KRS One

In the 21st century, people of color are still fighting for our humanity and civil rights. In America, “the country of the free,” Black communities will have to constantly challenge our idea of freedom without compromise.  The Ferguson riots, Baltimore riots, and the Million Man March (Justice Or Else) movements are a representation of the people refusing not to be invisible. The forces that contest their opposition for freedom and equality strengthen our culture. In spite of threats and attacks with tanks, k-9 dogs, water hoses and teargas, the oppressed still stands for justice.

This sort of heroism displayed by the opposed, is conveyed though the iconic superheroes in American Comic books. A unique characteristic about comic book superheroes is that they are able to live in the same time as their readers. This makes superheroes malleable to any era. From the start, superheroes spoke out against civil injustice and exercised their super-ability to make a difference. Superheroes in the 1960’s, helped shape the reader’s identity and consciousness of reality. The imagery and context of comics push the status quo and represent rebelliousness. 

Pop Culture has made superheroes part of our everyday lives. Characters such as the X-Men are examples of the idea of Double Consciousness. Coined by W.E.B. Dubois, this concept is deeply rooted within the African America community and submits that Blacks are typically outcast and torn between who they are and what society wants them to be. The aesthetic of this concept is a conveyance of anger, friction, and action. Superheroes in comic books display a full range of emotion, and just the same, it’s in our human right to express them as part of being human.

story:
The RVA Street Art Festival is Back!

The 3rd edition of the RVA Street Art Fest is scheduled to take place at the Southern States Silos in Manchester April 22-24th!

The RVA Street Art Festival is locally run and dedicated to three outcomes:
  • Raising money for arts education for kids
  • Finding and uncovering local artistic talent
  • Revitalizing blighted areas of the City to create new life and energy

This year, we are focusing on Bridging the River. As a part of the festival, we will be revitalizing a public park that is next to the silos (that few people know about) and partnering with Style Weekly on Earth Day (4/23) to offer two fantastic festivals for Richmond to enjoy.

The Festival will also feature:

  • An interpretive and active exhibit along the Slave Trail in front of the silos
  • Sculpture, steamroll printing, and other interactive exhibits
  • Painting with amazing local and national talent working side by side
  • The powerful images of photographer and Richmond native LeRoy Henderson
  • An artisan market, local food trucks, and Taste the Local craft beer

What We Need & What You Get

We are 85% of the way to full funding for the festival! We have partnered with local sponsors and donors, and need to secure the last bit of the funding to make the 2016 RVA Street Art Festival a reality!

  • The total cost of the Festival is $125,000. We need your help to raise the final $20,000 to make this thing happen!
  • Your funding will go to buying paint, securing lifts so artists can paint sky-high, and provide infrastructure for the festival.

  •  We have lots of sweet, sweet swag for you. Custom koozies, t-shirts, and event posters printed by RVA's Studio Two Three. You can also learn to paint murals with Ed Trask, drive a steamroller, get some VIP insider access, and permanently put your John Hancock on a Street Art Fest wall.
  • Every dollar counts! We are all-volunteer run, and are committed to making this festival celebrate creativity in all its forms in our fantastic city! Your contribution supports Richmond, RVA artists and arts organizations, and supports youth art education.

The Impact

  • This is a festival for Richmond, by Richmond. We are working with local artists, organizations, and sponsors, and committed to showcasing the incredible talent in our city.
  • Our first two Street Art Festivals (in 2012 and 2013) drew thousands of community members, raised thousands of dollars for local nonprofits, and brought new life to drab areas of the city.
  • This year, we will transform an iconic part of the Richmond skyline, bring in performing artists, musicians, sculptors, and an artisan market, in addition to  beautiful murals.

We have worked hard to plan the event and raise 85% of the funds. We need your support to make this epic event happen! Please donate to the 2016 RVA Street Art Festival!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign and help us get the word out! You can sign up to volunteer at event, as well - we need all hands on deck! Check out our website rvastreetart.com for ways you can get involved!

Take a Walk Down Memory Lane

Check out some of the epic murals done in 2013!

story:
Who We Are

My name is Simone Bailey Campbell and I am a visual artist and designer. My husband, Kyle Campbell and I have an online company called Mahogany Blu Design. We create sculpted beeswax candles along with pen and ink sketches.

Why sculpted candles, you may ask? The events of 9/11 had a profound effect on me and I sought ways to soothe and uplift my spirit. Creating the candles signified the light that would and did rise from the ashes. For a long time, this was my personal way of healing from 9/11. However, it was my husband that encouraged me to share this form of healing and encouragement with the world.

Our candle designs are original. We sculpt our own models, make our own silicone molds and create a few of the fragrance blends. These unique candles burn clean because of the natural and eco-friendly ingredients of beeswax, palmwax, cotton wick, essential and fragrance oils and dyes (fragrance and dyes can be excluded upon request) . We currently have one design in our shop online, but your support during this campaign will help to complete the execution of the other 10 designs, five of which are on target for release this year.

The original sketch art is a recent addition to our online store. I began sketching last summer as a way to free my "voice". I choose pen and ink because of the need to commit to the line. Intuitively, the subject of the sketches are lips. I decided to post them on Instagram in order to get feedback. Moved by the response, we decided to give away the original small 3.5"x 5.5" sketches straight out of sketch pad to the first person to comment. I believe there is nothing better than the feel of the original lines and texture made by the artist especially for you. To date we have given away just over 140 original sketches. This campaign will help with purchasing of supplies to meet the high volume of request to do sketches 36"and larger.


What We Need:

We are asking for $5000. Here's the breakdown of the funds:

  •  Supplies for the production of new candle designs. These include: sculpting foam, silicone, casting plastic, beeswax and general candlemaking supplies
  • Supplies for the production of large scale sketches
  • Set up of independent website for one year on Squarespace
  • Production of your perks ;)
  • Indiegogo fees (4% if we meet our goals, 9% if we don't )
  • Credit card and Paypal fees (3%)
  • Taxes


Your Perks!

This is why your here! We put together an assortment of featured items from my collection for those interested in either artwork, candles, a mix of both, and custom artwork*. Hopefully one or some of these will catch your eye!
*Note regarding add-ons: Unfortunately, Indiegogo doesn't allow add-ons or

combining perks. You will have to make separate contributions for each perk you would like. So sorry about this inconvenience.

_____________________________________________________________________________


Sticker Delight: $6

 

Sticker Delight! I will choose a sticker for you from this lot, or you can select one by indicating the corresponding number. I will also include a postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign.

The  sticker are made from waterproof vinyl and are Ideal for smooth surfaces like laptops, journals and windows.

U.S shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016

_____________________________________________________________________________

Kid's "Smiling" Tee: $27


Kid's "Smilin" Tee in grey only.

Size: XS: 2-4; S:6-8; M:10-12; L: 14-16

  • 5.3-ounce, 100% preshrunk, open-ended carded cotton
  • Classic loose fit for all-day comfort

U.S shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016

______________________________________________________________________________

Small "Low Light" Candle: $25

Your choice of scented or unscented:

In these originally created candles, we use our special blend of filtered beeswax and palmwax. Natural ingredients include cotton wick, essential oils, fragrances and eco-friendly dyes. When combined, they produce a clean, natural burn. Once your Chantilly Low Light Candle is lit, you will notice that it the center burns straight down and ultimately extinguishes itself. You are then left with a wax container. Once this happens, simply replace with the tealight.
  • Dimensions: approx. 3.5"L x 3"W x 2.125"H
  • Total weight: approx. 5.6 oz
  • Burn time: approx.12 hrs.
  • Includes 1 Tealight, burns for 4 hrs. each

  • Fragrances:Unscented, Lavender Rain, Ginger Frankincense or Teakwood.

U.S shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016

 

 

_____________________________________________________________________________

Your Selection of Women's Luscious Lips Tee - $30 
Select your T-Shirt ( 1 or 2 in M or L):
  • 4.5-ounce, 100% ringspun combed cotton
  • Soft to the touch for all-day comfort
  • Flattering contoured silhouette

U.S shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016

____________________________________________________________________

Your Selection of Men's Tee: $30 (L and XL)
 Select your T-Shirt ( 1 or 2):
  • Heavy Cotton Tee
  • 5.3-ounce, 100% preshrunk, open-ended carded cotton 
  • Classic loose fit for all-day comfort
  • Shoulder-to-shoulder tape and seamless collar
  • Double-needle neck sleeve and bottom hem

U.S shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016


_____________________________________________________________________________

A Set of 10 Note Cards: $35

A Set of 10 note cards. 5 different designs, 2 of each in a pack. The note cards are 5.5"x 4", with accompanying envelops. The cards are blank inside for your personalized message.

U.S shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016

_____________________________________________________________________________

 

Select a Medium "Low Light" Candle: $37

Your choice of candle and scent:

The wax in our Medium Chantilly Low Light Candle is a special blend of cleaned and filtered beeswax and palmwax. Natural ingredients include cotton wick, essential oils, fragrances and eco-friendly dyes. When combined, they produce a clean, natural burn. Once your Chantilly Low Light Candle is lit, you will notice that it the center burns straight down and ultimately extinguishes itself. You are then left with a wax container. Once this happens, simply replace with the tealight.

  • Dimensions: approx. 5.25"L x 3.5"W x 2.25"H
  • Total weight: approx. 12.2oz
  • Burn time: approx.24 hrs.
  • Includes 2 Tealight, burns for 4 hrs. each

  • Fragrances: Unscented, Lavender Rain, Ginger Frankincense or Teakwood.

U.S shipping included in price - add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016

____________________________________________________________________________


The PURIST Candle Set: $55

The PURIST. Made from 100% cleaned beeswax. This candle DOES NOT contain fragrance, color or palmwax. The only other ingredient is a cotton wick.
It is said that 100% beeswax can effectively reduce allergies, asthma, and hay fever by releasing negative ions into the air. The pollen and honey content of the 100% beeswax offer a natural orange color and light, sweet fragrance.

Once your Chantilly Low Light Candle is lit, you will notice that it the center burns straight down and ultimately extinguishes itself. You are then left with a wax container. Once this happens, simply replace with the tealights.

Package includes:

  • 1 Medium Candle, 1 Small Candle, 3 tealights.
  • Dimensions: approx. Med: 5.25"L x 3.5"W x 2.25"H; Sm: 3.25"Lx 3"Wx 2.125"H
  • Total weight: approx. Med: 12.2oz; Sm: 5.6oz
  • Burn time: approx. Med : 24 hrs, Sm: 12 hrs
  • Burn time for tealights: 4hrs ea.

U.S shipping included in price - add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery date: May 2016

____________________________________________________________________________

A Custom Lip Sketch: $130

A custom lip sketch in pen and ink on an 11"x 14" acid free, heavy weight watercolor paper.
What you will receive from me: 
A pen and ink sketch in my personal style. I am willingly to add a wash or dash of color as an accent. I will only allow 1 round of edits in order complete the sketches in a timely manner. 
What I need from you:
  •  After the campaign is over, I will send out emails asking for your photo/name/color preferences.

The Process:  

  • When the sketch is complete, I will send you a small version for your approval. 
  • After your approval, I will ship the drawing to you.

Photo Specifics:

  • It is EXTREMELY difficult to draw a lip sketch based on a tiny, dark, or blurry photo. Please send me images that are over 500pixels wide/tall, clear and well lit.

story_txt:
Who We Are
My name is Simone Bailey Campbell and I am a visual artist and designer. My husband, Kyle Campbell and I have an online company called Mahogany Blu Design. We create sculpted beeswax candles along with pen and ink sketches.
Why sculpted candles, you may ask? The events of 9/11 had a profound effect on me and I sought ways to soothe and uplift my spirit. Creating the candles signified the light that would and did rise from the ashes. For a long time, this was my personal way of healing from 9/11. However, it was my husband that encouraged me to share this form of healing and encouragement with the world.
Our candle designs are original. We sculpt our own models, make our own silicone molds and create a few of the fragrance blends. These unique candles burn clean because of the natural and eco-friendly ingredients of beeswax, palmwax, cotton wick, essential and fragrance oils and dyes (fragrance and dyes can be excluded upon request) . We currently have one design in our shop online, but your support during this campaign will help to complete the execution of the other 10 designs, five of which are on target for release this year.
The original sketch art is a recent addition to our online store. I began sketching last summer as a way to free my "voice". I choose pen and ink because of the need to commit to the line. Intuitively, the subject of the sketches are lips. I decided to post them on Instagram in order to get feedback. Moved by the response, we decided to give away the original small 3.5"x 5.5" sketches straight out of sketch pad to the first person to comment. I believe there is nothing better than the feel of the original lines and texture made by the artist especially for you. To date we have given away just over 140 original sketches. This campaign will help with purchasing of supplies to meet the high volume of request to do sketches 36"and larger.
What We Need:

We are asking for $5000. Here's the breakdown of the funds:



 Supplies for the production of new candle designs. These include: sculpting foam, silicone, casting plastic, beeswax and general candlemaking supplies

Supplies for the production of large scale sketches
Set up of independent website for one year on Squarespace
Production of your perks ;)
Indiegogo fees (4% if we meet our goals, 9% if we don't )
Credit card and Paypal fees (3%)
Taxes


Your Perks!
This is why your here! We put together an assortment of featured items from my collection for those interested in either artwork, candles, a mix of both, and custom artwork*. Hopefully one or some of these will catch your eye!

*Note regarding add-ons: Unfortunately, Indiegogo doesn't allow add-ons orcombining perks. You will have to make separate contributions for each perk you would like. So sorry about this inconvenience.

Sticker Delight: $6

The  sticker are made from waterproof vinyl and are Ideal for smooth surfaces like laptops, journals and windows.

story:
Hello! 

My name is Super-Mrin and I am an installation artist from New Delhi, India where I practiced architecture for several years before turning to art. 

I believe that our cities can be depressing and alienating experiences and I use public installations to transform them: to make our shared experiences more beautiful, interesting, playful and emotional. 


Here's what it's all About!

What you see is a giant public installation that we worked on over the last 4 years: today it has found a home temporarily at the magnificent Diego Gallery at the San Francisco Art Institute, a not-for-profit institution for the arts. The show goes live on the 6th of March, it is free and open to all. After this it will travel to other spaces across the city, and in the future, even to India.


It's so abstract! What does it Mean?

‘Willing’ is a suspended installation inspired by an essay on the nature of time in the Sanskrit epic the ‘Mahabharata’, a mythological/philosophical narrative on human nature. Using formal abstractions that evoke natural processes; the piece refers the body - its fragility, historicity and decay - to probe the notion of the will. 

The installation is a site - an interiority, an introspection, a meditation, a wonderment. It is reminiscent of the flow of water, corals, clouds and trees even the process of mitosis. Perhaps you see something completely unique in its forms. That is its beauty.

The installation, spread across a 20 x 30 ft dimly lit space, comprises 31 suspended acrylic pieces that narrate the journey of the body - the first or the ‘original’ mutates into the next, each piece developing unique personality, breaking apart in loops, illusions, mirages. Sound is used to extend relationships between space and audience; lights cast changing celebratory shadows across the floor and wall.


Come Join Me!

I need your help. This project is the first step in an art space collaborative titled 'Street Light' that I am building up. 

Lets work together to transform the spaces around us. 

Collaborate with me if you are passionate about art, support this project if you believe that things can change, and come by and volunteer your time if you are in the Bay Area.

Some of you who know me (my friends across the world) may remember this image!! Please share and support the project so that we can finally build it up!!!


What We Need:

The first $3000 will be spent purchasing 20 sheets of acrylic, laser cutting the material to create the crazy forms that the installation entails, purchasing cables, hardware and building a suspension system from the gallery roof. I know, its a tall order with that much but we are hands on workers!

The next $1500 we raise will go into purchasing lights and sensors that will make the piece more interactive.

If we are able to raise more than this, we will start planning a travelling exhibition for the project.

And You Get Perks!

Each of you contributing anything more than $2 is connected to the project forevermore: your name will be credited every time the installation is on show anywhere. You made this happen and we will always remember that!!!

Check out the drawings and photographs we made during the process. To thank you for contributions over $15 we offer signed prints, postcards that will be mailed to you. Of course, your names will be up there too!

This photograph of the installation was taken by the talented photographer Vishal Amler from India.

These two drawings are titled 'The Landscape of the Brain', Ink on Paper.

For those of you contributing $100 or more, you will receive just about everything: signed prints from the show itself, USB drives with the videos of the actual event including an artist presentation.


Share this Project!

We are a small team of artists doing everything. We are very good at what we do but we would love your help! If you have any expertise in installing works like these, get involved, we want you here! And if you don't, come hang out anyway! Get in touch with me, and see how you could help!

Spread the word, make some noise share our project with everyone you know, just that would be so so helpful! Use the Indiegogo share tools and give a holler!
