story:
What is the One-Eyed Monster?

The One Eyed Monster is a unique 30-foot tall art car that looks like a freestanding sculpture. Every year he changes his look to fit the theme of the event. 

Our dream for many years has been to create another, smaller art car that could carry additional people since the One-Eyed Monster can only hold eight people at a time. The Baby One Eyed Monster will take another 12 people and will follow along behind the OEM. Perhaps one day we'll have an entire brood of baby monsters!

We want to bring people together and bring more fun and more joy to the community. It's what it's all about.  If you feel the same way, we hope you'll support us in making this project a reality. 

Who is behind this project?

Stone Larkin is our lead fabricator and designer of this project as well as the creator of original One-Eyed Monster. Throughout the years he has been involved with various Burning Man art creations including Tiki Island, The Blind Mistress Art Car and the Zipline Tower and other various art projects at regional festivals. 2017 will be his 6th year attending Burning Man.

Where will my money go?

We already broke the ground on the Baby Monster and purchased an old trailer that Stone opened. The project is well underway, and many people have been willing to volunteer their time to help us on the building grounds near LA.

However, funding is essential since we have to obtain the necessary materials to finish The Baby. This is a list of what needs to be purchased:

Total  cost of materials: $12,000

  • Steel Metal Chase          $1,200
  • Steel Metal Body            $2,700
  • Aluminum Neck             $1,100
  • Aluminum Eye                $2,000
  • Wood for Benches          $800
  • Hardware/Linkage         $300
  • Tires/Rims                        $400
  • Decoration/Suit              $1,200
  •  Lighting                             $1,500

Additional Expenses:

  • Indiegogo fees (estimated)             $1,500
  • Reward production (estimated)    $2,000

TOTAL  :  $15,000 

The estimated cost of the entire project is higher than our first mark. Any amount over our goal will allow us to put more money into the baby monster and focus on building him even better.

If we hit the initial goal here are our STRETCH GOALS!

$20,000 - We’ll give baby monster his own engine! 
$22,000 - We’ll add a sound system!

It takes a village to raise a child! You can contribute in so many ways, and every effort will make a change. 

Here is what else you can do:

  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or email your friends!
  • Follow One Eyed Monster on Facebook, Instagram and watch out for fundraising parties.
  • If you’re an LA local, help us build and participate in our work campout weekends.
  • Wanna help out on Playa? We’ll need help with construction too.

Don’t hesitate, give us a shout, if you want to take part and not sure how.   

To donate any amount without getting a perk, please hit BACK IT on the top of the page!

Perks:

  • $10 - Rubber Ducky

A handwritten postcard with our heartfelt thanks! It will be postmarked from the official Black Rock City Post Office and mailed directly from the event. On top of that, look for your name on our Wall of Thanks.

  • $15 - Baby Shower Playa Party

An invitation to our Deep Playa Party just for Indiegogo supporters! Celebrate the birth of Baby Monster with us. Dancing, DJ spinning all night long, and special drinks! It will be a party to remember!

  • $25 - Pacifier

    A beautiful custom lapel pin featuring the baby monster himself! This humble token of our appreciation comes with a handwritten postcard postmarked by the Black Rock City Post Office. And you are so welcome at our Baby Shower Party! * Keep an eye on updates for designs!

  • $50 - Baby Bib

    Keep baby monster close to your heart with this lovely medallion made out of copper. A lifelong memory of this unique event you supported. Hope to see you at the Baby Shower playa party too. * Keep an eye on updates for designs!

  • $75 - Adorable Onesie

    Show off a T-shirt with an image of the Baby Monster. It's proven to attract lovely strangers who like to know about a cool local art you support. Our appreciation on the Wall of Thanks and an invitation to the Baby Shower Party are included.

  • $100 - Baby's First Steps

    A ticket for a two-hour art tour ride on a big One Eyed Monster or the Baby. We will treat you with a special drink and decorate you with lapel pin! Hurry up; seats are limited.

  • $125 - Diaper cake

    Bundle up the party favors! Get a t-shirt, medallion, lapel pin, invitation to the Baby Shower Party, and of course get featured on our Wall of Thanks.                                                                  (save $25)

  • $300 - Silver Rattle

    A collectible solid aluminum sculpture of the Baby Monster designed and fabricated by our lead artist Stone Larkin. Each piece is numbered, and hand signed. Only 10 are available. First come, first pick until they are gone!

  • $500 - Golden Rattle

    A rare artifact -- solid steel sculpture of the Baby Monster designed and fabricated by our lead artist Stone Larkin. Each piece is numbered, and hand signed. Only 5 are available. First come, first pick until they are gone!

  • $750 - Unconditional Love

    One of a kind the Heart of Stone. A hammered copper heart backlit with neon lights on the stainless steel rays. This wall piece depicts the strength of love bond that can never be broken.

  • $1000 - Dusty Babysitters

    A 1+7 ticket for the Regional Burn (the other large pieces burn the night before the man burns). Gather with your seven friends at the top of the big One Eyed Monster and get a perfect view on this special night.

  • $2000 - Fairy Godparents

    A 1+7 ticket for the Man Burn. Start this night dining with us at the Camp One Eyed Monster. Then hop on the big One Eyed Monster holding for you a perfect spot in a circle of art cars. And watch the apex of the festival from the 30 ft above the crowd!

  • $2500 - The Rich Uncle

A tribute to the David Bowie's Alladin Sane donated by our lead artist Stone Larkin. A steel masterpiece has been a pearl in Stone's private collection for years and now released to contribute to the baby Monster's trust fund.

​​​Risks and Challenges:

Building an art car is not a small project, but after building much larger vehicles over the years, our team is focused and understand that failure is not an option. We will do whatever it takes to make this another successful project. 

Since the project majorly depends on the fundraising to purchase the materials, we need your help to close this gap and make it happen! In this way, you can literally participate in the art creation and be a part of our crew. 

Thank You!!!

Special Thanks for helping with the creation of this campaign:

- FlyHelo

- MediaFervor

- The main photo is by The Blissful Idiot

story:
To match its legendary stature in Norse mythology, Yggdrasil will be the tallest structure ever built at any Burning Man event. EVER. Which is why this visionary project already received partial funding from the Swedish Kulturbryggan and AfrikaBurn Arts Grant. A 6-meter tall prototype of the tree has already been built in Denmark but to make it reach its new dimensions we need your help! 

This campaign will allow the viking ship to stand at the top of its branches, have the mythological dragon at its roots, integrate the balconies and secure the grand fire show at the end!

 

 

 

In order to come to life, certain dreams require us to take collective action. We need you to join the hundreds of volunteers already working on the ground by simply contributing with what you can through this fundraising page. From wherever you are in the world, step up to join us to bring this fantastic dream of life to the desert.

By picking one of the options below, you will be directly contributing to the rising of the Yggdrasil. We have already received over 1.5 million Rands (100 000€) from the Swedish Kulturbryggan and the Afrikaburn organisation, and now we just need a little more to bring it all home. Creating such a massive structure in the desert is very complex and expensive. We are scouring the timber mills and scrapyards of the Cape area to gather 50 tons of wood and metal to build the tree, next to the much-needed 1000 liters of coffee and 35 liters of sunscreen for pale Scandinavian viking necks and noses! ;)

 

 

 

Nix - Born and brought up in Zimbabwe, Nix Davies is a force of nature. With her hands in a thousand jars at once, she is a collaborative and conceptual artist that explores the possibilities that arise from consciously stepping into and existing in the unknown. She creates and produces large-scale experiential spaces, events and artworks that ordinarily are impossible to create alone.

 

Agust - Born from Icelandic parents and raised in Sweden, Agust Örn Helgason possesses a unique charisma and leadership that draws people to work with him on projects that test the limits of what is possible. Storyteller at heart, lover of unordinary things and people, he aspires to initiate the creation of manifestations greater than the pyramids of Giza during his lifetime.

 

Their message: 

"As the biggest structure to be built at a Burn ever, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible for large scale interactive outdoor art pieces. This requires high quality materials, experienced artisans and extra safety precautions which are stretching our budgets. Our original budget for the tree landed the total expenses at 2.4 million ZAR. After receiving 1.6 million ZAR from AfrikaBurn and the Swedish Kulturbryggan, we have instituted a policy of sourcing local, recycled materials and cutting back on all unnecessary expenses. We are therefore now in a position to complete the tree for a total of 1.9 million ZAR and therefore are asking for your support in order to gather the remaining €21.000(300,000 ZAR). Thank you for making this happen with us!"

 

Find out more!  

Check out our youtube channel with the mini-vlog episodes we have created to keep our fan-base up-to-date with the evolution of the project.

 

 

 

2000 – On a run around the Serpentine, London, Nix Davies has an idea of building a giant baobab somewhere in Europe to represent the feeling of being uprooted from Africa. She also has a distinct notion that it will take 15 years before this idea will be realized.

2000 – 2009 Nix draws and investigates the baobab talking incessantly about it.

2009 – 2015 Nix decides to live in Cape Town, meets the Space Cowboys and starts to build collaborative projects at Afrikaburn.

2015 – Nix decides to start working towards building the baobab, which now has an arc at the top of it lying in its branches.

2016 – Nix embarks on a giant golden X at Afrikaburn, reaches out for help in the newsletter and on the 17th March gets an email from Agust Örn Helgason.

Afrikaburn 2016 – Agust and Nix decide to build a giant tree together.

May 2016 – The tree becomes Yggdrasil and has a viking ship in its branches.

May 2016 – September Agust and Nix start to bring the tree to life.

August 2016 – Agust applies for funding through a few different channels in Sweden.

September 2016 – Agust organises to build the Tree of Wonder for the 25th Anniversary for the Kaos Pilots. Nix flies to Denmark to join him and Leon Högberg joins them with all his tools from Sweden. They build the Tree of Wonder, a prototype for Yggdrasil standing at 6 meters tall. 

November 2016 – Kulturbryggan message Agust to say the funding application has been successful. The same day Afrikaburn agree to support Yggdrasil, Tree of Life with R100 000 with another possibility of R200 000. Dreams come true when people back crazy ideas.

2017 – The family begins to grow. Yggdrasil becomes a large-scale exponential collaborative platform that instigates and ignites people’s dreams and in-turn together grow The Tree of Life.

 

 

- four building weekends with over 30 volunteers each time

- meeting with architects & engineers to fine-tune building structure

- flying in of expert builders from US, Sweden, UK

- acquisition & transport of a lot of building materials to the desert of Tankwa Karoo 

- acquired a huge infrastructure of tools

- we have more than one hundred volunteers that will help us built the tree

 

 

The Valhalla Viqueen Saga

With every camp at AfrikaBurn with its own story, this is what you would hear around the bond-fire of the Viqueen's camp: 

"Ancient nordic runes recently found in a viking shipwreck in the Tankwa desert describe the mythic tale of the brave viking tribe of the Viqueens daring to cross the southern seas to find the mysterious Tree of Life, Yggdrasil. Through their journey from the far cold North, they endured many unlikely adventures, crossing jungles, mountains and oceans, meeting strange beings upon their path such as the Spanish Sparkle Crocodile and the Camel of Nod, partaking in the great war of Furious Dassies against the Monstrous Meercats and after many trials and against all odds, they neared Tankwa town, the ancient home of Yggdrasil.

At the dawn of tea-time, after losing a drinking game in the halls of Valhalla, the Great Mantis One-Eyed-Steve, Odin's long long lost African Cousin was forced into exile in the plains of Tankwa Town. Finding himself very alone in the desert, Steve going slightly mad with sexual frustration turned his attentions towards the awesome beauty of the fairest tree of them all, Yggie. On the prospect of a severe humping session by One-Eyed-Steve, she inverted herself and buried her beautiful crown in the desert sands, with just her roots rising into the sky.

It was this sight of the inverted Yggdrasil which greeted the Viqueens. As they approached, One-Eyed-Steve was disturbed from his floral debauchery and awakened in his jealousy. He unleashed his wrath upon the intrepid travellers and set the sea in fury. The viking ship was flung by mighty waves through the air and landed in the roots of Yggdrasil where it rests to this day.

The ancient Viqueen scrolls tell of the coming of Ragnarok, and how you are to be a part of the tribe of free souls preparing for the final feast to resurrect the Viqueen tribe. The finest Viqueen souls are gathering from across the world to come together and join in the co-creating of the ultimate celebration of these intrepid vikings and dine at the table of the San Clan and to party with us as the tree burns in Ragnarok."

 

Are you one of us? Have a look at: www.dreamyggdrasil.com

This project is made possible with the support of the Swedish Kulturbryggan, AfrikaBurn and hundreds of inspired dreamers, geeks, visionaries and burners from all over the world.

 

Risks & challenges: 

At the moment we are working closely with skilled carpenters and engineers to finalize the build plan. We know that one big risk is that many of our 60+ volunteers are not trained builders. We are relying on people to learn quickly from skilled carpenter and repeat what they do. Same with rigging. We will be working at height and security is the most important factor. The volunteers need to learn about safety ropes for themselves and tools.
story_txt: To match its legendary stature in Norse mythology, Yggdrasil will be the tallest structure ever built at any Burning Man event. EVER. Which is why this visionary project already received partial funding from the Swedish Kulturbryggan and AfrikaBurn Arts Grant. A 6-meter tall prototype of the tree has already been built in Denmark but to make it reach its new dimensions we need your help! This campaign will allow the viking ship to stand at the top of its branches, have the mythological dragon at its roots, integrate the balconies and secure the grand fire show at the end!   In order to come to life, certain dreams require us to take collective action. We need you to join the hundreds of volunteers already working on the ground by simply contributing with what you can through this fundraising page. From wherever you are in the world, step up to join us to bring this fantastic dream of life to the desert.By picking one of the options below, you will be directly contributing to the rising of the Yggdrasil. We have already received over 1.5 million Rands (100 000€) from the Swedish Kulturbryggan and the Afrikaburn organisation, and now we just need a little more to bring it all home. Creating such a massive structure in the desert is very complex and expensive. We are scouring the timber mills and scrapyards of the Cape area to gather 50 tons of wood and metal to build the tree, next to the much-needed 1000 liters of coffee and 35 liters of sunscreen for pale Scandinavian viking necks and noses! ;)   Nix - Born and brought up in Zimbabwe, Nix Davies is a force of nature. With her hands in a thousand jars at once, she is a collaborative and conceptual artist that explores the possibilities that arise from consciously stepping into and existing in the unknown. She creates and produces large-scale experiential spaces, events and artworks that ordinarily are impossible to create alone. Agust - Born from Icelandic parents and raised in Sweden, Agust Örn Helgason possesses a unique charisma and leadership that draws people to work with him on projects that test the limits of what is possible. Storyteller at heart, lover of unordinary things and people, he aspires to initiate the creation of manifestations greater than the pyramids of Giza during his lifetime. Their message: "As the biggest structure to be built at a Burn ever, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible for large scale interactive outdoor art pieces. This requires high quality materials, experienced artisans and extra safety precautions which are stretching our budgets. story:
Welcome to my Tarot project.

My name is Loveday and I make art. For my 16th birthday, I received my first Tarot deck, a Rider Waite deck. I still use that same deck today although my Tarot deck collection has grown by leaps and bounds.

I love that the tradition of Tarot reaches back hundreds of years. My grandmother and my great- grandmother were both Tarot readers and spell casters. I love that this tradition called to me and to my own daughter. I love this chain stretching back into the mists of time and forward into the uncharted future.

As an artist and Tarot enthusiast, I've spent a lot of time thinking about purpose and meaning. I began my career in art as a means of working through my own traumas and demons but soon realized that my struggle resonated with many people. My art resonated and kept me on my current path. I realized that my search for meaning was so much simpler than I'd ever dreamed.

The same message conveyed in dozens of different ways and in an infinite number of voices. We are made of star stuff. We are eternal. We are valued. We are worthy of love. 

I started working on a Tarot deck a few years back and my Tarot art resonated deeply with more people than I expected. I made the completion of the artwork for the deck my primary art project in 2019, creating one new card every week.

I was inspired by the iconic artwork of the Rider Waite deck, creating unique imagery for all 78 cards. Pictured on the left are the images for the New Orleans Tarot Cats and on the right are photos of my thirty year old Rider Waite deck.

When I began this journey, crafting a card a week, I was moved by the encouragement and enthusiasm I received. I don't know if I would have gotten here without the support of my friends and my tribe. Thank you all so much. Your support has meant the world to me.

.

My first great love was the city of New Orleans. We moved a lot as a family when I was a child and I never really felt like I had roots anywhere. Then I met New Orleans. I fell in love with the architecture, the food, the music, the art, and the unbelievable sprawl of the live oak trees. 

I'd never seen anything like them. My previous experience was with palm trees and birches and cedar. The live oak is a universe unto itself. The roots go deep. At last I felt a sense of belonging. I'd come home.

The Artwork 

I've used a variety of art techniques in creating my deck. I started with my own photography of local places: Jackson Square, Audubon Park, City Park, local cemeteries, St Louis Cathedral, the Moon Walk, and many more. I worked with the photographs digitally, collaging in other aspects and using digital brushes and filters until I got the art to look exactly the way that I wanted.

I've opted to have the deck printed on linen cardstock. The linen "texture adds ridges that reduce surface contact between cards, making them easier to shuffle, deal and handle."

I worked to create a true mirror of the traditions of the Tarot.

The Major Arcana tells the story of the journey of the Fool as they learn important lessons and ascend to a higher level of understanding, spiraling up to the World.

The Minor Arcana reflect the eternal truths of the four elements.

- The Wands (representing Fire) bring us ferocity and passion. 

- The Cups (representing Water) remind us of the importance of love, emotion, creativity and intuition.

- The Swords (representing Air) cut through the distracting noise of our every day lives with logic and intellect leading the way.

- The Pentacles bring us back to Earth, enforcing the importance of nurturing love and the material world.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding I am trying to raise covers the costs of printing my artwork on linen cardstock, creating the boxes and getting the boxes shrink wrapped so the recipient knows it's a brand new for them Tarot deck. Cards are the traditional Tarot size 2.75 inches by 4.75 inches.

If you would like to support this project, you can get the perks as described: artwork, cards or even a Tarot bag of holding in velvet.

Risks & Challenges

My deck is completed: all 78 images created over the course of a year and half. I have already ordered the decks. They are currently in production and will be arriving to me by the end of this campaign.

Each full deck will come with its own shrink wrapped tuck box, ready for you to unwrap it and feel the mystical promise in your own hands.

This is actually my second Indiegogo project. My previous campaign, The Animal Spirits of the Apocalypse received full funding between the campaign here on Indiegogo and a fundraiser on Facebook. Everyone that ordered the Animal Spirits deck has received their pre order.

The New Orleans Tarot Cats deck is already being printed. You will receive your order. The Tarot Bags of Holding are made and ready to be shipped.

I've been a professional artist for many years and I intend to continue on this path for as many years as I can.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can afford to financially support my campaign, but I would be deeply grateful if you could share my campaign with the world.

Share my campaign on Facebook or Instagram or Twitter.

Tell your spiritually inclined friends. Mention my deck to your Tarot enthusiast friends. Any sharing would help.

I'm proud of myself for having gotten this far; for having accomplished my goal. And, of course, the most important thing of all: the cats must still be fed.

Please take advantage of the Indiegogo share tools. I would love to share my project and my artwork with the world.

Remember that you are valued. You are loved. You are made of the same stuff as the stars. Shine on, Tribe. Shine on.

Music in videos is by Bensound.

story:
Our Story

FARM is a brand created for those of us who stand apart without effort. The doers and the thinkers with innate traits that drive us to pursue greater truths and wellness for themselves and the world of which we live.

We are artists, humans that pursue and share the deepest depths of creativity for all to see. We are the athletes, those who choose to chase the pain and sacrifice required to reach beyond our own physical and mental limits. We are the craftsmen that never stop making, the students who seek to never stop learning. We are sons and daughters of those who have lived before us, a generation of dreamers and fighters that endured countless adversities and hardships in order to provide us with a brighter future we enjoy today. We are forever grateful, we will never forget, and we carry your spirits, grit and unwavering enthusiasm as we continue to fight the good fight for a better tomorrow.

We are different, together. We are one another. FARM represents our united voices and our individual stories.

Simple - We believe in simplicity. The designs of our clothing and activewear collections showcase the truth that less really is just that much more. Avoid complexity; stay simple.

Unique - Stand apart from all others through the beauty of being different. Share your special story with us, and revel in what it means to be unique with designs that embody YOU. 

﻿Fresh - Our made to order products are all designed, printed, and packaged in the USA.  We work with local suppliers; our goal is to shift more and more of our manufacturing and supply chain to be done here in our home of USA. We support small businesses, we love American made product, it’s a part of who we are.

Comfortable - There is ‘comfort over beauty’, but what about being both? Our product team sources only the best materials and fit that in themselves define the essence of comfort while always looking incredible. There is nothing in our own curated collection that we do not absolutely love to wear.  

Socially responsible - Corporate social responsibility is of the utmost importance in how we structure our family owned business. We focus on ethics, sustainability, and creating clothing that is always manufactured and sourced responsibly. Shop with the confidence knowing that all of our clothing is eco-conscious and sourced from partners who manufacture with fair labor and ethical business practice.

 

Pay it Forward – When you are lucky enough to be in a position to help others, you should. Farm Brand always donates a portion of our sales to local and national charities and nonprofits so that together we can support the causes we hold closest to our hearts. Be a part of the positive change with us.

When a customer purchases an item at FARM, they can choose a charity or non-profit organizations that they wish to support - FARM will take care of the rest:                                    

  • Creating Equality (Equal Rights, Constitutional Rights, Women’s Rights, LGBTQ+ Rights and more)
  • Fighting Hunger and Homelessness
  • Wildlife Conservation & Environmental Sustainability
  • Veterans Support
  • COVID-19 and Disaster Response Fund

Our desktop and mobile site is also optimized with ‘Accessibility Assistant’, which ensures easy access and usability for everyone, regardless of who you are and where you are shopping from in the world.

                           

From now until January 1st, 2021 it is our goal to deliver 10,000 free shirts to local charities and non-profit organizations that focus on fighting homelessness and poverty in local communities. 

We pledge to continue our One Purchased to One Donated initiative with a goal of donating 1,000,000 shirts or clothing items to charity in 2021.​

 

Our Mission

At FARM we embrace individuality and breathe diversity. Celebrate these amazing traits with us, and share your own individual and unique stories for the world to hear. Together we will inspire and together we will unite.

Celebrate Individuality. The core of what it means to be an individual spans from the ever changing and always different lives that we all have lived. Each of us has experienced great pains. We have risen above the challenges, trials, and tribulations that life has thrown our way to in turn find the delicate balance of hard work and sacrifice with happiness and joy. Life is about creating and telling stories that inspire others to achieve their own definitions of greatness. In order to grow, we must push our limits into uncomfortable boundaries so that we as individuals can achieve the impossible. 

Celebrate Diversity. Human nature reaches the epitome of intricacy, diversity and harmony through the billions of voices that all deserve to be heard. At FARM, we hope to enable these voices to share their own diverse, always unfolding stories of motivational and heart warming nature. Our platform aims to share and celebrate the diversity of humanity.

Be Different, Together. Discover your meaning and your purpose by sharing your story with the world. Our actions and our words will etch themselves into history. Pay it forward as one united humankind. You are the story, we simply help to tell it. Take part, join the FARM movement today!

 

What We Need

  • We are seeking $200,000 in funding to continue our cause and sustain our business. As a family-run and startup business, we have invested close to $100,000 of our own money, which went into building the e-commerce store, manufacturing and sourcing our products, inventory, charitable contributions to charities and non-profits (we donate 5% of all sales and give away 1 shirt for every one merchandise sold), payroll for a staff of 10 team members with diverse backgrounds, and other sales and administrative expenses 

 

  • With your support and an additional $200,000 in funding, we can accomplish:
    • Expand our production capacity, and continue toward a goal of shifting larger parts of our manufacturing and supply chain to be done here in the US
    • Increase our inventory to support a 6-month run-rate, based on high double-digit growth rate in sales each month 
    • Increase the amount of charitable donations and direct givebacks to local communities 
    • Expand our staff to provide more living wages to those impacted by pandemic
    • Continue to spread positive message around social equality, environmental sustainability and personal inspirations to as many people as we can reach

 

What You Get

If you support our fundraising effort, you will be a lifelong guardian angel of our family and those involved with the brand, as a thank you for you contribution, 

  • You will receive your very own "Farm Brand Fall Fashion Essentials Box" - a unique, one of a kind basket of fashionable goodies including hoodies, travel duffels, joggers, shirts, and more - picked out just for you
  • You will become a VIP customer of FARM, and receive lifetime free shipping for all of your purchases made on www.farmexclusives.com 
  • As a VIP customer, you will receive exclusive discounts, future giveaways, early drops on new styles and designs, and limited-edition styles and designs that are not available in store 

If for some reason we fall short of our $200,000 funding goal, as a contributor to our fundraising effort, you will still receive all of the perks listed above. 

Globally located angels - our fundraising campaign is setup as a worldwide campaign, which means we welcome all potential contributions from everyone, including friends from outside of the US. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to support our fundraising efforts, but cannot do so through monetary donations, that's okay and we'd still appreciate any support you can lend us, 

  • Be our voice, share our website www.farmexclusives.com and this funding page with your family, friends and anyone in your personal and professional network
  • Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Pinterest @farmbrandinspires, join us and stay updated with our brand and our social agendas 
  • Become an affiliate or brand advocate for FARM, simply join our affiliate program, learn more at www.farmexclusives.com/pages/affiliates-influen.... Receive 15% commission on all referred sales, get your own unique discount code to share with your friends and family, and most importantly - promote for a good cause. It only takes 1-minute to sign up, do it today!
story_txt:
Our Story
FARM is a brand created for those of us who stand apart without effort. The doers and the thinkers with innate traits that drive us to pursue greater truths and wellness for themselves and the world of which we live.
We are artists, humans that pursue and share the deepest depths of creativity for all to see. We are the athletes, those who choose to chase the pain and sacrifice required to reach beyond our own physical and mental limits. We are the craftsmen that never stop making, the students who seek to never stop learning. We are sons and daughters of those who have lived before us, a generation of dreamers and fighters that endured countless adversities and hardships in order to provide us with a brighter future we enjoy today. We are forever grateful, we will never forget, and we carry your spirits, grit and unwavering enthusiasm as we continue to fight the good fight for a better tomorrow.
We are different, together. We are one another. FARM represents our united voices and our individual stories.

Simple - We believe in simplicity. The designs of our clothing and activewear collections showcase the truth that less really is just that much more. Avoid complexity; stay simple.
Unique - Stand apart from all others through the beauty of being different. Share your special story with us, and revel in what it means to be unique with designs that embody YOU. 
﻿Fresh - Our made to order products are all designed, printed, and packaged in the USA.  We work with local suppliers; our goal is to shift more and more of our manufacturing and supply chain to be done here in our home of USA. We support small businesses, we love American made product, it’s a part of who we are.
Comfortable - There is ‘comfort over beauty’, but what about being both? Our product team sources only the best materials and fit that in themselves define the essence of comfort while always looking incredible. There is nothing in our own curated collection that we do not absolutely love to wear.  
Socially responsible - Corporate social responsibility is of the utmost importance in how we structure our family owned business. We focus on ethics, sustainability, and creating clothing that is always manufactured and sourced responsibly. Shop with the confidence knowing that all of our clothing is eco-conscious and sourced from partners who manufacture with fair labor and ethical business practice.



 
Pay it Forward – When you are lucky enough to be in a position to help others, you should. Farm Brand always donates a portion of our sales to local and national charities and nonprofits so that together we can support the causes we hold closest to our hearts. Be a part of the positive change with us.
When a customer purchases an item at FARM, they can choose a charity or non-profit organizations that they wish to support - FARM will take care of the rest:                                    

Creating Equality (Equal Rights, Constitutional Rights, Women’s Rights, LGBTQ+ Rights and more)
Fighting Hunger and Homelessness
Wildlife Conservation & Environmental Sustainability
Veterans Support
COVID-19 and Disaster Response Fund


Our desktop and mobile site is also optimized with ‘Accessibility Assistant’, which ensures easy access and usability for everyone, regardless of who you are and where you are shopping from in the world.
                           
From now until January 1st, 2021 it is our goal to deliver 10,000 free shirts to local charities and non-profit organizations that focus on fighting homelessness and poverty in local communities. 
We pledge to continue our One Purchased to One Donated initiative with a goal of donating 1,000,000 shirts or clothing items to charity in 2021.​
 
Our Mission
At FARM we embrace individuality and breathe diversity. Celebrate these amazing traits with us, and share your own individual and unique stories for the world to hear. Together we will inspire and together we will unite.

Celebrate Individuality. The core of what it means to be an individual spans from the ever changing and always different lives that we all have lived. Each of us has experienced great pains. We have risen above the challenges, trials, and tribulations that life has thrown our way to in turn find the delicate balance of hard work and sacrifice with happiness and joy. Life is about creating and telling stories that inspire others to achieve their own definitions of greatness. In order to grow, we must push our limits into uncomfortable boundaries so that we as individuals can achieve the impossible. 
Celebrate Diversity. Human nature reaches the epitome of intricacy, diversity and harmony through the billions of voices that all deserve to be heard. At FARM, we hope to enable these voices to share their own diverse, always unfolding stories of motivational and heart warming nature. Our platform aims to share and celebrate the diversity of humanity.
Be Different, Together. Discover your meaning and your purpose by sharing your story with the world. Our actions and our words will etch themselves into history. Pay it forward as one united humankind. You are the story, we simply help to tell it. Take part, join the FARM movement today!
 
What We Need


We are seeking $200,000 in funding to continue our cause and sustain our business. As a family-run and startup business, we have invested close to $100,000 of our own money, which went into building the e-commerce store, manufacturing and sourcing our products, inventory, charitable contributions to charities and non-profits (we donate 5% of all sales and give away 1 shirt for every one merchandise sold), payroll for a staff of 10 team members with diverse backgrounds, and other sales and administrative expenses 
 
With your support and an additional $200,000 in funding, we can accomplish:
Expand our production capacity, and continue toward a goal of shifting larger parts of our manufacturing and supply chain to be done here in the US
Increase our inventory to support a 6-month run-rate, based on high double-digit growth rate in sales each month 
Increase the amount of charitable donations and direct givebacks to local communities 
Expand our staff to provide more living wages to those impacted by pandemic
Continue to spread positive message around social equality, environmental sustainability and personal inspirations to as many people as we can reach


 

What You Get
If you support our fundraising effort, you will be a lifelong guardian angel of our family and those involved with the brand, as a thank you for you contribution, 


You will receive your very own "Farm Brand Fall Fashion Essentials Box" - a unique, one of a kind basket of fashionable goodies including hoodies, travel duffels, joggers, shirts, and more - picked out just for you

You will become a VIP customer of FARM, and receive lifetime free shipping for all of your purchases made on www.farmexclusives.com 
As a VIP customer, you will receive exclusive discounts, future giveaways, early drops on new styles and designs, and limited-edition styles and designs that are not available in store 



If for some reason we fall short of our $200,000 funding goal, as a contributor to our fundraising effort, you will still receive all of the perks listed above. 
Globally located angels - our fundraising campaign is setup as a worldwide campaign, which means we welcome all potential contributions from everyone, including friends from outside of the US. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you'd like to support our fundraising efforts, but cannot do so through monetary donations, that's okay and we'd still appreciate any support you can lend us, 

Be our voice, share our website www.farmexclusives.com and this funding page with your family, friends and anyone in your personal and professional network

Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Pinterest @farmbrandinspires, join us and stay updated with our brand and our social agendas 
Become an affiliate or brand advocate for FARM, simply join our affiliate program, learn more at www.farmexclusives.com/pages/affiliates-influen.... Receive 15% commission on all referred sales, get your own unique discount code to share with your friends and family, and most importantly - promote for a good cause. It only takes 1-minute to sign up, do it today!

story:
Bref résumé

Pour souligner le 300e anniversaire de la merveilleuse Ville de L'Assomption, notre collectif Mur/mur Création prépare un livre sur ce qui caractérise l'âme de la Ville. Parsemé de photographies, de peintures, de montages, d'illustrations et de textes, ce livre de 232 pages exige de ses trois auteurs (Julie, Anne-Marie et Arsénio) un travail colossal. Notre approche aborde les gens, les lieux et les objets qui donnent à la Ville de L'Assomption ses couleurs si particulières.

 Ce dont nous avons besoin

Le montant demandé servira à payer l'entièreté des coûts d'impression du livre. Un surpassement de notre objectif nous permettra de choisir un papier de meilleure qualité et une couverture plus rigide. Notre objectif étant de produire un superbe livre de style table à café, le papier et la finition sont d'une grande importance.

 L'impact

Depuis juillet déjà, nous travaillons activement à la préparation du contenu. Notre démarche nous permet de rencontrer des gens fascinants, qui ouvrent grandes les portes de leurs domaines. Nous nous intéressons à l'agriculture, à la culture, à l'architecture, à l'insolite. Notre projet est une incursion dans ce que nous percevons de plus beau à L'Assomption. Nous souhaitons que notre livre laisse sa trace dans l'histoire de la Ville, même s'il ne s'agit pas d'un livre d'histoire.

Votre contribution nous permet de nous attarder à l'aspect créatif du projet et de ne pas nous inquiéter de l'aspect financier.

Nous sommes trois professionnels du domaine de l'édition, du design graphique et de la photographie. Ajoutons qu'Anne-Marie Charest est aussi artiste-peintre.

 Risques et défis

Notre plus grand défi est de continuer à travailler pour subvenir à nos besoins tout en accordant du temps pour faire avancer le livre. La réussite de cette campagne nous libère d'un fardeau financier supplémentaire.

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Suivez notre page Facebook et aimez-la. Nous y publions de fréquents avis de recherche et votre participation est d'un grand secours.

Achetez notre livre en prévente.

Partagez notre campagne de sociofinancement avec vos amis. Informez-les de notre projet.

story:
My crew and I are constructing  a new art installation for the 2016 Burningman arts festival.

I designed this installation to draw attention to the many ways we limit our self identities and therefor our life potential. Identity Reorganization Portal is designed to be a gauntlet thrown down before the apparent solidity of the assumed "I".   Our mirrored transport system will visually suggest new identity options for viewers/participants/Black Rock Citizens as they find their reflections  multiplied, fractalized and rearranged to include others in the near vicinity. 
Simultaneously our portal will supply  a  continuos looping sound collage suggesting new and different self perceptions.
Acolytes will take a moment to view their reflections while listening to and considering the identity suggestions shared in our sound collage.  Then when they press the lighted button within the portal the sound collage will fade and an audio oracle emerges with exactly the piece of information needed to step into the new moment.
We received a grant from BurningMan to begin this process. However to complete the project to its potential we are seeking a small crowd fund for assistance.
With your help we will purchase a large solar panel, charge controller. Solar Battery, speakers, amplifier and all the electrical components to bring our sound system to life. Your assistance will also help us to pay for transport of the portal to the Black Rock Playa. Likewise We are seeking assistance in paying the bills we have accrued building our portal thus far.
As a thank you for your assistance we will be offering a variety of perks including stickers, T-shirts, Pendents, original Ceramic tiles, platters and sculptures. All will be made and or designed by Michael Emery with a unique and original Identity Reorganization Portal logo
I have built thus far 10 installations for the BurningMan festival. Four of these installations received funding assistance from the BurningMan organization. I have also received crowd funding assistance for three of these projects.
This installation, like all my previous installations will be installed temporarily at the high school where I teach as a way to share my artistic process with my students.
Please consider making a donation to help bring this installation to its full potential. Any donation is appreciated. If 200 friends and/or acquaintances donate only $10 then we will be able to complete this project well and without debt.
Also please share this campaign with your friends and acquaintances . 
Thanks
Michael

story:
We're Thinking Big

"Given the opportunity what would you do to make a big difference in how the park serves youth and seniors?" This is what a Friend of the Park who serves on the Wedum Foundation board asked us.

Our answer: Build a 20' x 20' outdoor classroom for our Tuesday morning children's programs, tours and other activities for all ages.

The foundation gave us $12,500 and we matched that with a Capital Improvement grant from the Metropolitan Regional Arts Council and an Arts Access grant from VSA Minnesota for a total of $24,000 raised for the project.

All we need is your support to raise an additional $6,000 by the end of September to make the outdoor classroom happen.

New Opportunities

Our programs are growing and we need more space to hold workshops, host tour groups and present performances.

This outdoor classroom will do just that plus it will be:

  • A shelter for our programs in rainy weather.
  • An intimate setting for music and other kinds of performances. 
  • More accessible than any other site in the park - just up the hill from the main parking lot.
The outdoor classroom opens up a whole new area of the park and creates a space for new program opportunities.  

Please help us get the word out about this campaign and multiply your impact. 

You can use the built-in sharing tools to reach your friends on Facebook and Twitter. Here's a short url - - https://igg.me/at/caponiartpark for emails and the hashtag to keep us all connected - - #caponioutdoorclassroom.

The Details

  • Size: 20' x 20'
  • Materials: Oversized Douglas Fir Beams and lumber, 
  • Metal Roof, Cement Slab Floor
  • Capacity: 6 work tables, 30 students

Caponi Art Park: Restoring and nurturing the human spirit through art, nature and community

Caponi Art Park is a distinctive community space offering cultural and educational experiences in an inviting, natural setting. The Park is located on 60-acres of rolling, wooded hills that are embedded with art in Eagan, Minnesota.

"The park erases the delineations between art and play, creating an immersive experience of learning, nature, and exploration in a park where the land itself is as much of a sculpture as the sculptures upon it." Elisabeth Heying, graduate of the School of the Chicago Art Institute and park visitor since the age of nine.

Caponi Art Park inspires exploration and discovery in all ages!

Caponi Art Park is the 2016 recipient of the Art Achievement Award from the Metropolitan Regional Arts Council. This award highlights the Park's outstanding contributions to the arts and the way it has helped to integrate the arts into the social fabric and identity of its community.

story:
I'm Carson Barnes, master printmaker.

The past weighs on me more and more; its physical evidence moves me - ruins, relics, statuary in cemeteries.  The motherlode of funerary statuary is in Genoa, Italy; last year's campaign got me to several cemeteries in Germany and France.  The resulting new work has been shown a couple of times in New York, in Georgia and North Carolina this year; not only is the work being noticed, it's getting better.

The statuary is of women mainly; those of men of the period (mostly 1700s - early 1900s) don't show much emotion.  These women have been forgotten, they were real people, with concerns and feelings like ours.  Research often reveals who they were, their names, their calamities and joys; this helps me bring out their character.  They are my muses; my muses are of stone.

Cost breakdown

I was surprised to see that ink alone cost $2,178.00 over the past year - I'd budgeted less than half that.  Paper for a full edition runs $300 per edition of 50 prints, though with digital technology it's  no longer necessary to run off all 50 at once (not as it was with silkscreen printing, which I loved and in which I hold the Master's in Fine Arts, but which destroyed my wrists after 35 years). Other costs are airfare (Turkish Air runs the cheapest flights), and Air BnB which is the cost effective means of finding a room.  I'll fly to Milan and take the train to Genoa.  It appears to me that $7,500 will get the imagery needed for the next year's work.  I insist on making the prints here, when I'm done working the composition, color, light, textures.  It's imperative to make these images.  These women deserve remembrance.

What do you get out of it?

The work of the past two years is online at carsonbarnesart.com ; longer essays on most pieces are on my page on Facebook, https://www.facebook.com/Carson-Barnes-Fine-Pri... .  For this campaign, I'm offering a selection of ten pieces at 40% discount:  those that sold at $500 are temporarily $300, the $250 portrait pieces are $150, the intimate pieces regularly priced at $125 are $75. There are also two of the large pieces, 26 x 39 inches, at $600 for the month instead of $1000.  Pricing is simple, it's by size, as twice the area takes twice the work, twice the ink and twice the cost of paper (Rives BFK printmaking paper, made in France since the 1500s).

Feel free to share this campaign with those who may be interested.

story:
Short BIO

        I was 14 years old when I first took up the camera and I have not put it down ever since.Photography came to be a part of me and the way I see life.The stories I am interested are:people's everyday life,breaking news of the day related to political events,social issues,crisis and war. My work has been acknowledged and published in:The New York Times,The Guardian, TIME, WP, WSJ and etc.My picture was top rated by Magnum Photography Awards 2017

 

The story behind the book

       Four years ago I met Guerassim Dichliev. I knew that he lived in Paris, that he was an actor and worked with Marcel Marceau. I photographed him for the local newspaper, that I worked for. I learned that mime artists were struggling and their shows in Paris were becoming less and less popular, after Marceau's death. I started going to his shows in Bulgaria and France, watched him rehearse and tutor his students in Paris. In this photo book, I am presenting his story and at the same time the story of so many mimes all over the world. For me Pantomime is like the foundation of a building and this building is the life around us. Art is not business. Business in which to invest and expect great profits. 

Through this photo book "The Last(Eternal) Mime" I want to make the pantomime more understandable as an art form. 

 

Your part: 

       After the photo book "The Last (Eternal) Mime" is published  I will organize photo exhibitions in Europe to spread the word and bring light to the problems of Mime artists. I already have arrange that with some renowned galleries that I have worked with before. I also plan to make second edition in which to tell the stories of Mimes from all around the world. To find how this art is changing and to preserve it.

 

Where the money goes:

I need 3000 euro for publishing the book

I am looking for other sponsors as well, but if I don't reach the amount of 3000 euro, I will publish it on time and you will get your copy, but I may miss the deadlines for arranging some of the exhibitions.

story:
This campaign has ended, but we still need your support!

Please visit our live campaign to make a tax-deductible donation. Thank you!!

 

 

_____________________________________

 

 

Help us create a new kind of art.

 

Imagine a massive canvas -- the largest canvas you've ever seen.

It's made of hundreds of thousands of tiny LED lights that are hidden inside 25,000 magical leaves. The leaves are connected to an enormous climbable tree.

When the sun sets, the leaves begin to glow. Lying beneath the tree, you find yourself looking up at the largest interactive "light canvas" in the world, enveloped in colors, shapes and patterns that move to music through the surreal canopy above you.

Instead of giving control of this canvas to a single artist, imagine we put sensors around the tree that empower YOU to control the canopy using your voices, movements, and biorhythms.  

Finally, imagine we open-sourced the control software so that any artist or technologist around the world could create unforgettable light art for this new medium. 

What would happen? What things would you experience under this magical tree of life?

Find out beneath the Tree of Ténéré.  

 

Our inspiration

We were inspired by a tree that once grew in the middle of the Sahara desert, in a region called Ténéré. It was the most isolated tree on Earth: not a single other tree could be seen for 250 miles. And yet, the tree became an important ceremonial gathering place for traders and travelers as they crossed the desert. It brought people together for community, ritual and rest.

It was mysteriously destroyed almost 50 years ago.

Let's bring this tree back to life. Let's create a natural space of contemplation, community, creativity, and play. Help us bring Ténéré to Burning Man 2017 and then to cities and festivals around the world.


Come climb...

Nearly four stories tall, Ténéré lets climbers rekindle their childhood love of adventure and awe for nature.

We designed and engineered Ténéré to support the weight of 60 climbers, with construction already underway in southern California. Made from hand-sculpted fiberglass and hand-painted resin, the bark looks and feels so real you’ll think you’re climbing a living tree.


...and create

At night, hidden LEDs within each leaf come to life. The leaves begin to glow. Together, these 25,000 LED leaves form a massive, dome-shaped "canvas of light."

Using our open-source tools, artist and technologists around the world are creating experiences for this canvas that you will never forget.

Lying beneath the tree at night, you'll look up and see stunning colors, shapes and patterns move through the treetop in synchrony with soothing music. We’ll host live events as well: imagine a DJ, choir or orchestra up in the tree, controlling the canopy with their music.


At other times, YOU get to control the tree. Hidden sensors and simple wearables let you activate the LED leaves through sound (chanting, humming, singing, words), biorhythms like heartbeat, and movement. Imagine harmonizing with others under the tree or shouting names of colors to create mind-bending patterns. Someone passes you a Fitbit: when you slip it onto your wrist, 25,000 leaves begin pulsing to the beat of your heart.

We're creating this canvas in partnership with the Symmetry Labs team. You have to see their past work to believe it:


 
 

We can't do this without you! Two ways you can help:
 

  1. Please consider making a generous donation to support this project. We have amazing perks for supporters and donations are tax-deductible.
     
  2. Please share this campaign on Facebook and via email with your friends.

We can't thank you enough, and we can't wait to see you under the Tree of Ténéré.

 

Meet the team

ALEX GREEN, CO-LEAD ARTIST & SYMMETRY LABS CEO

My work as an artist and technologist bridges the digital and physical worlds. Before pursuing interactive art I was a physicist and jazz musician; both science and music remain lasting sources of inspiration in my work. I try to push the boundaries of both knowledge and expression through art -- often my projects require technological innovation as well as custom fabrication.

Over the last few years, I've been focused on building modular "light instruments": volumetric lighting blocks with sophisticated software that can be played like a musical instrument. My work has been featured in Gizmodo, Creators Project, Discovery Channel’s In The Making, an upcoming PBS documentary on the future of art called Ineffable with violinist Tim Fain, and in music videos for Eric Prydz and Cathedrals. I've done light sculptures for Google, Cisco, Dreamforce, and many others.

I've had the chance to perform at festivals around the world, including the Future of Storytelling, Treasure Island Music Festival, and Cannes Lions Innovation Festival, where I gave the keynote on “Beyond Sound: The Music Experience of the Future”. I'm thrilled to be bringing Ténéré to the world in 2017.

 

MARK SLEE, CO-LEAD ARTIST

My visual art draws heavily on a background in computer programming. I develop algorithmic patterns inspired both by organic and mathematical process, employing procedural motion, subtle variation, and evolving shifts in form and hue. I find it fascinating to explore the way our visual perception works, and my goal is to create vivid, colorful experiences that are pleasing both aesthetically and intellectually - pretty lights can tickle both mind and soul.

I've been developing an open-source stack for LED animation called LX since my first playa light-art installation at my second Burn in 2010. That system has gone on to see use in a variety of major installations, by myself and others. But Ténéré has to be one of the most audacious canvases I've ever seen envisioned, and I'm super excited to be creating for it.

 

ZACHARY SMITH, CO-CREATOR 

I couldn't be prouder of the incredible team working to make Ténéré a reality, and I've been blown away by the support we've received from people all over the world. I spend most of my time on project management, fundraising (we need your support!), and creative direction.

By day I'm an entrepreneur and product manager. I live in San Francisco with my wife Sophie.

 

PATRICK DEEGAN, PHD, CO-CREATOR

I build intelligent and self-sovereign robots and am fascinated by the potential of technology, applied to the advancement of society for the benefit of all. I have been attending Burning Man since 1996. This year, I'm excited to bring a wealth of technical experience to the task of creating an open-platform that is at the intersection of art, interaction, and digital identity.  I'm inspired by an amazing team and the really beautiful vision we share, to illuminate and support transformational synergies with technology and offer an experience of transcendent oneness with nature and each other.

 

TANNER BEREE, DIGITAL MEDIA LEAD

After my first burn I knew that becoming involved with an art project was in my future. As always the Playa provided; this time with The Tree of Ténéré. I work as a visual storyteller and couldn’t be more excited to document the journey of bringing this amazing piece of artwork to the world.

Come find me under the LED canopy of Ténéré!

 

RIWA HARFOUSH, COMMUNITY BUILDER

If the playa has taught me anything, it's the exponential nature of generosity. My fiancee Alex and I have felt how worthwhile our time, effort and love has been in building our camp (The Pineapple Motel) when we see our family of Pineapples come together each year to build our home in the dust. This year, we're looking beyond our little community and are so excited to rally an even larger family around this beautiful piece of art that can be experienced by all.

 

NATHANIEL HEDGES, BUILD TEAM

I moved to San Francisco from Honolulu. For eleven years I was a trauma medic/deep-sea-diver in the United States Navy, and recently I made the transition to studying furniture/product design at California College of the Arts (CCA). I love to bike and sail, and I'm passionate about Muay Thai and avidly committed to physical fitness/personal wellness.

With encouragement from friends and family, I ventured into developing large-scale art installations for the Burning Man community. I'm grateful for an amazing community of Bay Area Burner friends and can't wait to see you all under Ténéré!

 

MATT HERRICK, FUNDRAISING LEAD

After running fundraising for 2016's "Catacomb of Veils," I swore that I would take this year off. However, Ténére's beauty and audaciousness inspired me to join the team. I am also a lead for Epic, Burning Man's "World Series of Poker" theme camp. 

In the default world, I live in San Francisco and work in enterprise sales.

 

CLAY SADER, PROGRAMMING LEAD

I'm so incredibly excited to be a part of bringing Ténéré to the Burning Man community. Last year while being a small part of building Catacomb of Veils, I learned about the power of building spaces for healing and exploration. This year I'm proud be be bringing some of what I learned to help create this space of beauty, magic, and community. I cannot wait to lounge in the shade (and light) of Ténéré and see the community experience it for themselves.

I live in SF, but I spend most of my time in the default world in Africa and elsewhere, working to build software in the developing world to strengthen healthcare, crisis response, and development systems.

 

STEVE TAM, COMMUNITY & CROWDFUNDING

I help organize the Pineapple Motel camp and am excited about building the narrative and community around Ténéré. 2017 will be my fourth burn and I am looking forward to finally contributing to an artistically and experientially driven piece of magic on the playa.

During the day I work in brand and marketing for an AI company. I helped launch Daybreaker in Toronto and now live with my wife in NYC.

 

ALEXANDRE TERRIEN, FUNDRAISING

I'm the co-founder of the Pineapple Motel camp and better known as "Monkey" on the playa. I'm a dedicated Burner and community builder and so excited to bring Ténéré to the playa.
 

TYLER GOIN, FUNDRAISING

Over five trips to Burning Man, I've developed a special bond to Black Rock City, especially around the unique collection of art, nature and people. For me, Burning Man is an expression of what humanity is capable of, and a reminder for how much stronger we are when we work together then we are divided. I believe deeply that facilitating the construction of a lonely tree in the desert for people to gather and come together is a beacon of hope and beauty in these tumultuous times.

 

 

Thank you for your support!

Photo credit: Thanks to Afonso Salcedo of Sutro Studios for the beautiful playa photograph featured in the opening scene of our video.

story: Dre
story_txt: Dre

story:
Milkweed Zine was born out of an itching little idea in my wandering dirty mind while on a trip to Melbourne in February 2015. With the dedication of many incredible editors, designers, contributors and community members, it has become an important piece of the erotic artscape.

With each issue, we have refined the quality of the zine, grown our distribution, and engaged more deeply with artistic and sex-positive communities. We continue to prioritize an intersectional approach to erotica, reflecting a myriad of desires and embodiments. Our logo, designed by Vancouver illustrator Laura Perry, has become a symbol of queer- and sex-positivity, showing up on bods and bathroom walls around the world. 

As we turn to our fourth issue, we are no longer able to sustain the financial burden of printing a perfect-bound, full colour physical magazine alone. We need your help to keep this project thriving. Your donations will go directly to the printing costs of Issue IV, keeping the feminist erotica flowing.

With love and smut,

S. K. Hughes                                                                                                                                                           Editor-in-Chief, Milkweed Zine

story:
Summary and Background

Hey, I am Tyler Lee a senior at Chamblee Charter High-school.  I am a mostly self taught digital artist starting my first semester of AP Studio Art. I love art and coming up with interesting concepts that invoke meaning and emotion. 

I suffer from depression currently, and while I am managing it school becomes a heavy weight in the balancing scale of my mind. To get control over my art and my school life, I came up with a plan. Bring my art to the school. However with a 19' inch monitor tablet and laptop this goal is easier said than done. That is where the Cintiq Companion comes in.

What I will Use the Money For

The $700 dollars will be going solely to purchase a first generation Cintq Companion and the purchasing of perks for donors​. Any money leftover, or if we do not make the goal, will all go to tablet or accessories such as wireless keyboards and stands, etc.                                                                                  

Get Art Prints and Downloads!

For helping me out donors will receive artwork, and high resolution downloads of the artwork I have produced now, and some that I will produce over the course of my time in AP studio art. 

And for higher tiers I'll even do a personal drawing for the donor (but I'm currently a bit behind on some work, so this will be at a high tier).

Showing Depression

I have created art of this theme before but I want to go even further with my work, and really push to explore different topics, and relating them to interesting concepts. Your donation will help me be able to achieve this goal.

If you can't donate please share! :D

It's understandable if you can not donate, but a simple Facebook share or mentioning it to your art friends is just a simple way you can help fund me without shelling out a dime. 

Thank you for taking your time to read this and I hope you consider donating!

story:
I started my animation career in 2002. I started in commercials as a freelancer. Eventually, I started to direct projects and one of my side hobbies was to tell stories. I was enjoying explaining and sketching the details of those worlds.

While technology became more accessible, I got to experience virtual reality, and I discovered that this was always the way I was imagining my stories. I decided to experiment on that, and how to bring the environment as a plot player. I got to do my Animation Masters about "Storytelling in Virtual Reality." Soon enough, an incomplete real story kept coming to me through news, through memories from back home, through experiences. I came to the USA from Egypt. I got the chance to create animation over here, and back home I remember refugees,  homeless families, and their stories. And I felt maybe I got the chance to tell what are their real stories aside from any news and directed media. While elders were traumatized by what happened to them, kids' worlds were full of hope to go back and to live again the happy life they barely had.

From that, I got the idea of creating a split virtual world that tells the story of this homeless kid that lost everything, yet she still has hope. Audiences get to know that she is determined about that, but it takes more than just happy thoughts to achieve her goal.

In this project, it is important to me and to my team to do more than just an entertaining piece, or another virtual reality cool project. It is about a humanistic message. It is about standing for peace. It is about being in the experience of those victims, and more than just a detached look to their environment. Therefore, we want you to help us finish the project and reach as many people as we can so that we can use this project to actually establish a very basic decent life for those innocent kids.

We now have so much done in the production. Many shots of animation are done; environment texturing is coming along. Visual effects are happening as much as many other things. We are going to use your donations and help for:

  • We need to get fulltime talents for cloth and hair simulations.
  • We need to get texturing artists for the character look developmentand some parts of the environment.
  • We will need to rent equipment software and talents for post production and compositing.
  • We need to buy oriental specific music licenses that work with the environment.
  • We need to push things faster through our team to get things done quickly. This includes expenses from studio rents, upgrading equipment, and software licenses.
  • And the most important part is the rendering cost through render farms. 
  • Some of those expenses will be spent on the production of perks you get.
  • We will need to rent space for the show.

These costs are very expensive, and we need your help to achieve them. While our initial aim is $10,000, there are 4 stages of our actual aim:

Stage 1: $7,000 This barely can get us to render in a decent render farm.

Stage 2: $10,000 This is enough to render, to get the music license, rent the space, and pay some of the expenses.

Stage 3: $15,000 This will be enough to cover all our expenses, and to get a decent and fast rendering for our project.

Stage 4: $15,000+ This will be enough to apply for festivals and to show the project to as many people as we can.

As for perks: Along with the digital link to the animation short when it's done, we have a lot of amazing gifts as a thank you for your donations. This includes: posters, T-shirts, Google Cardboard, and more. Please check them out, along with our great bundles.

​If you like the idea, please join us in our cause. You have a chance to do more than just watch another sad video about helpless victims and do nothing. We need you to fight war with peace and to show people that humanity wins by caring for each other. By helping us finishing this animation project, you are helping us to send a strong message and a solution, and later we will use this message to help and fundraise for children refugees to get their basic life needs: education, healthcare, and culture preservation.

​​​If the funds are not enough, this will drastically have an impact on the rendering time, quality of simulations and production time. I will cut the cloth and hair simulations. I will use generic music. The render quality of details will have to be reduced.

There are so many ways other than money that you can support us with.

  • Please if you feel that your talent can help in this project, you are welcome to contact me.
  • If you cannot contribute with much but you have a social network, please help us to reach more people on social networks.
  • If you are a professional in the animation field, please share this with your colleagues and friends, to help their fellows
  • If you cannot do any of these, please remember us and remember that there are more people around the world that are just like you, and they want to live and build their environments.

While technology became more accessible, I got to experience virtual reality, and I discovered that this was always the way I was imagining my stories. I decided to experiment on that, and how to bring the environment as a plot player. I got to do my Animation Masters about "Storytelling in Virtual Reality." Soon enough, an incomplete real story kept coming to me through news, through memories from back home, through experiences. I came to the USA from Egypt. I got the chance to create animation over here, and back home I remember refugees,  homeless families, and their stories. And I felt maybe I got the chance to tell what are their real stories aside from any news and directed media. While elders were traumatized by what happened to them, kids' worlds were full of hope to go back and to live again the happy life they barely had.
From that, I got the idea of creating a split virtual world that tells the story of this homeless kid that lost everything, yet she still has hope. Audiences get to know that she is determined about that, but it takes more than just happy thoughts to achieve her goal.
In this project, it is important to me and to my team to do more than just an entertaining piece, or another virtual reality cool project. It is about a humanistic message. It is about standing for peace. It is about being in the experience of those victims, and more than just a detached look to their environment. Therefore, we want you to help us finish the project and reach as many people as we can so that we can use this project to actually establish a very basic decent life for those innocent kids.


We now have so much done in the production. Many shots of animation are done; environment texturing is coming along. Visual effects are happening as much as many other things. We are going to use your donations and help for:

We need to get fulltime talents for cloth and hair simulations.
We need to get texturing artists for the character look developmentand some parts of the environment.
We will need to rent equipment software and talents for post production and compositing.
We need to buy oriental specific music licenses that work with the environment.
We need to push things faster through our team to get things done quickly. This includes expenses from studio rents, upgrading equipment, and software licenses.
And the most important part is the rendering cost through render farms. 
Some of those expenses will be spent on the production of perks you get.
We will need to rent space for the show.

These costs are very expensive, and we need your help to achieve them. While our initial aim is $10,000, there are 4 stages of our actual aim:
Stage 1: $7,000 This barely can get us to render in a decent render farm.
Stage 2: $10,000 This is enough to render, to get the music license, rent the space, and pay some of the expenses.
Stage 3: $15,000 This will be enough to cover all our expenses, and to get a decent and fast rendering for our project.
Stage 4: $15,000+ This will be enough to apply for festivals and to show the project to as many people as we can.

As for perks: Along with the digital link to the animation short when it's done, we have a lot of amazing gifts as a thank you for your donations. This includes: posters, T-shirts, Google Cardboard, and more. Please check them out, along with our great bundles.


​If you like the idea, please join us in our cause. You have a chance to do more than just watch another sad video about helpless victims and do nothing. We need you to fight war with peace and to show people that humanity wins by caring for each other. By helping us finishing this animation project, you are helping us to send a strong message and a solution, and later we will use this message to help and fundraise for children refugees to get their basic life needs: education, healthcare, and culture preservation.


​​​If the funds are not enough, this will drastically have an impact on the rendering time, quality of simulations and production time. I will cut the cloth and hair simulations. I will use generic music. The render quality of details will have to be reduced.
There are so many ways other than money that you can support us with.
Please if you feel that your talent can help in this project, you are welcome to contact me.
If you cannot contribute with much but you have a social network, please help us to reach more people on social networks.
If you are a professional in the animation field, please share this with your colleagues and friends, to help their fellows
If you cannot do any of these, please remember us and remember that there are more people around the world that are just like you, and they want to live and build their environments.

story:
Hi,

We are two painters and illustrators from Montreal, we are fortunate to live in a city that inspires us and is full of art opportunities.

About the project
We have been painting since ... we could say forever, but decided to team up to create a bigger project and grow. That's why we are in the midst of creating an exhibition project that will take place in July. Our exhibition will talk about the culture from here, the culture of Quebec, about its history, its nature, its language. We will explore the same topics, but interpreted by our two completely different styles. We were fortunate to be selected to receive a grant from the Quebec government through the Young Volunteers program. That's why we now have a studio where we can fully create. We just need a little help to keep the studio till June, but more importantly for the gallery fees.

This project is really important for us because it is the first time we have the chance to do a bigger project and it will help us to get our name out there and hopefully open doors to more projects. It's really thanks to your help if we can continue.

We appreciate your support and your concern. Your support will make this exhibition happen. If you have any questions, please contact us.

To support us it's super simple you can buy our promotional items or simply make a donation.

***Every kind of help is welcome (materials, contacts, tips, exchanges, etc.) 

We promise you an unforgettable experience at our exhibition in Montreal.

And we hope to see you in July!
